loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is an eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. She resides in Keanthu, a remote village in the lush hills of Chuka in the central area of Kenya.

As the key breadwinner of her family with three children, Nancy has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and bananas. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Because of her immense farming knowledge, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. While she has been making a living from farming, she has identified a niche market for cereals. The only challenge she faces is a lack of funds.

Nancy is now requesting a 50,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy different varieties of cereals to sell in the local market. The market for cereals is never a problem because the demand is high, and she plans to take advantage of that. Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market share by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets.

Nancy is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. Through accumulated profits she will then be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. With this loan Nancy’s life will take a positive turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of cereals to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and has four children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, horticulture and tree farming to provide for her family. She enjoys what she does, and it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge lack of access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo, however, has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Kitale can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.

Emily is seeking a 20,000 KES loan to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the marketplace and, in the process, give her income to repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.

Her positive attitude and the desire to get ahead demonstrate in this individual a great willingness to improve herself, and she hopes for a favorable response to her request. Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity.

loans.name: Marlis Esperanza

texts.es:
Marlis, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos estudian, mientras que su esposo trabaja la agricultura desde hace muchos años. 

Marlis, se dedica a trabajar con su esposo en la agricultura; pero aparte de eso también trabaja los fines de semana vendiendo minutas y por las noches trabaja en una empresa de limpieza de pescado. 

Marlis, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de maíz, de esa manera asegurara una excelente cosecha.   

El sueño principal de Marlis, es primeramente es obtener buenas cosechas y también desea ver crecer a sus hijos y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Marlis is a 32 year old, hard working woman who studied until the 3rd grade. She is married and has 3 children, two of which study whilst her partner has worked in agriculture for many years. 

Marlis earns a living working with her partner in agriculture, but she also works weekends selling quick meals and during the nights she works with a fish cleaning business.

Marlis needs the loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate her maize, through this she will obtain an excellent harvest. 

Her main dream is to obtain a good harvest, she also wishes to see her children grow and become good people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to cultivate maize

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
At the tender age of 20, Ziporah started practicing mixed farming due to her passion for farming and education. Right now she is 37 and a very industrious, honest, and hardworking mother from the Kitale area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment.

Over the years, Ziporah has gained much farming experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops, and some other small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Ziporah is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan: to buy farm inputs such as seeds.

Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's most populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that Ziporah could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Ziporah, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring small-holder women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Ziporah believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and will improve her business. Increased profits will allow Ziporah to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Ziporah has many dreams in her life but, as expected, her family is the principal one: she wants to give them a good quality of life. She also wants to pay for her children's education and, someday, buy a house so that they can all live safely and comfortably. You can help Ziporah to fulfill all of these goals with a loan that will get her a lot closer to achieving them.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds.

loans.name: Jaime Ovidio

texts.es:
Jaime es una persona luchadora que tiene su propio negocio de venta de pupusas, panes con pollo  y bebidas, además es empleado desde hace dos años, su madre le enseñó el negocio de pupusería y con la buena administración del mismo logro incluir la venta de panes con pollo, tiene muy organizadas sus actividades para cumplir con sus responsabilidades, tiene un hogar que comparte con su compañera de vida y dos hijos que están estudiando.
Invertirá en quesillo, chicharrón, loroco, aceite, pollo, papel, bolsas, etc., tendrá a su disposición los materiales necesarios para cubrir con facilidad los pedidos al por mayor que le hacen sus clientes, cree que de esta manera sus ventas se estabilizaran y generaran más ingresos.
Los sueños que él tiene son construir su propia casa, fortalecer su negocio con nuevos productos y disminuir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is a fighter who has his own business selling pupusas (thick, stuffed corn tortillas), chicken sandwiches, and drinks. For the past two years he has also been an employee.

His mother taught him the pupusa business, and with his skillful management he was able to add chicken sandwiches to his menu. He organizes his activities very well in order to meet his responsibilities. He shares his home with his life partner and two children who attend school.

He will invest in buying cheese, pork rinds, loroco (vines with edible flowers), oil, chicken, paper, bags, etc. so he will have the materials he needs to meet the wholesale orders he receives from his clients. He thinks this will stabilize his sales and generate more income.

His dreams are to build his own house, strengthen his business with new products and to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork rind, loroco (vine with edible flowers), oil, chicken, paper, bags, etc.

loans.name: Luis Gonzaga

texts.es:
En la foto podemos apreciar lo que el cliente Luis quiere comprar (2 máquinas guadañadoras), él es un habitante del sector rural de puerto triunfo el cual se dedica a prestar los servicios de podado de césped, donde genera un empleo.
Luis es un hombre de 54 años de edad que vive en unión libre con su pareja, inicio su negocio por necesidad económica y encontré en este la mejor oportunidad de progreso que se le ha presentado en su vida, pues desde que ejerce su actividad ha obtenido grandes beneficios, todos ellos sirvieron para que tuviera calidad de vida y un alimento que disfrutar en su mesa.
texts.en:
We can see what the partner, Luis wants to buy (2 sowing machines). He lives in the rural area of puerto triunfo, in which he carries out services cutting lawns. 

Luis is a 54 years old man who lives together with his partner. He started his own business due to economic needs and found himself in this opportunity of progression which presented itself to him. Since he began this activity he has achieved great outcomes, all of which serve to give him a better quality of life and and to put food on his table.

loans.use: to buy two sowing machines

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, es madre de dos niños (niña y niña), los cuales ya asisten a la escuela, tiene como actividades económicas la elaboración y venta de antojitos, además cultiva granos básicos, con las cosechas puede elaborar parte de la venta y también alimenta a su familia, ya es reconocida en la zona por ser una persona luchadora y responsable, comenta que desde hace 15 años se dedica a administrar su negocio, trabaja todos los días, ella es una mujer que también realiza labores domésticas y por las tardes elabora la venta de antojitos para salir a vender.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar verduras como papas, zanahorias, repollos, tomates, etc., para preparar la venta de antojitos, además invertirá en abono para fortalecer sus cultivos de granos básicos y así tener cosechas abundantes, tiene la esperanza de mantener a flote su negocio con esta inversión, por su experiencia sabe que los meses venideros son muy buenos para las ventas y de esta manera podrá estar preparada para generar mayores ingresos.
Entre sus aspiraciones está mejorar poco a poco su negocio, darles mejor vida a sus hijos y apoyarlos para que puedan convertirse en profesionales.
texts.en:
Doris is the mother of 2 daughers, who already attend school. She produces and sells street food, and also grows basic grains, she sells part of her harvest and also uses it to feed her family. She is already known in the area for being a hard-working and responsible persona, she says that she has spent 15 years running her business and works every day. She is a woman who also carries out the domestic tasks and during the evenings makes street food to go out and sell. 

She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cabbages, tomatoes etc. to make and sell street food. She will also invest in fertilizer to improve her growing and have plentiful harvest. She hopes of growing her business with this investment, and with her experience she knows the coming months are good for sales and wants to prepare to make the best possible income. 

Amongst her hopes are to slowly improve her business, to give her children a better chance and to support them so that the can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cabbage,tomatoes etc to make street food, she will also invest in fertilizer to improve her harvests

loans.name: Derney Esther

texts.es:
Derney una tierna y carismática persona la cual posee un humilde negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, ella es madre de tres hijos, vive en unión  libre con su pareja, trabaja diariamente para sacar su familia adelante.
Hoy Derney se encuentra solicitando un crédito la razón es que quiere vender nuevos productos en su negocio, por ello el dinero será destinado en la compra de un congelador y surtido de refrescos.
Para ella es muy gratificante esta idea y esta oportunidad de crecimiento que con tu ayuda puede materializar.
texts.en:
Derney is a tender and charismatic person who owns a humble business selling fruit and vegetables, she is a mother of three children and lives together with her partner, she works daily to help her family move forward. 

Today Derney finds herself asking for a loan the reason for which is that she wants to sell new products in her business. The money will be used to buy a fridge and a range of drinks. 

She is very grateful for this idea and the opportunity to grow which may happen with your help.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and a selection of drinks

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna, de 19 años de edad, está casada, su esposo trabaja en una clínica y junto tienen una hija de 1 año de edad. 

Mirna, trabaja como vendedora de ropa ambulante en su comunidad; ella tiene este negocio desde hace un año, ella sale de lunes a viernes por las tardes a vender.

Mirna, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para vender, porque se aproxima la temporada navideña y necesita estar preparada.
El sueño de Mirna, es tener su propio puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mirna is 19 years old and is married, her partner works in a clinic and together they have a 1 year old daughter.

Mirna works travelling and selling clothes in her community, she has had this business for a year and she goes out in the evening monday to friday to sell. 

Mirna needs the loan to buy clothes to sell, because with the Christmas season coming she needs to be prepared. Her dream is to have her own shop to sell from in the city market.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Tauaita

texts.en:
Tauaita is a 34 year old mother with 2 children, she runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Tauaita requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers and butter to assist with the business. She plans to expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers and butter.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en:
Vineta is 53 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Samoa.

Vineta owns and operates a convenience store in her village. She has been running her business for 6 years now. She has excellent repayments records. Vineta is applying for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk and box of sausages to help her with her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk and box of sausages.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a very industrious, honest, and hardworking woman who hails from the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Mount Kenya region. She has been farming for the past 10 years. Over those years, she has gathered so much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village.

Lucy has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet.

Lucy is very passionate about farming, and she loves cultivating her farm. That is why every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she earns profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income through the selling of cereals. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals.

The Ndaragwa area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. That means that Lucy will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Lucy, but she feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Lucy believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals. She believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow her to repay her loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Lenders, if there is someone you should invest in, then it is Lucy. Support this smallholder farmer, who wants to show that the role of a mother and a farmer isn't too much for her. She just needs your vote of confidence.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is an enterprising young woman, smart and creative. She knows how to overcome the problems that life presents and despite having few opportunities for paid work, she has never given up looking for ways to support herself. She started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. Although she has only farmed for the past ten years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her parents.

Margaret lives near Chesoi in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. The Chesoi area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize.

Margaret intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully breakdowns will be few and far between. To accomplish this, Margaret is applying for a 100,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill.

Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Margaret sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kindness. Her dream is to build a modern house for her family.

loans.use: To buy an electric posho (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a responsible person and a hard worker. She is a woman who is limitless in accomplishing her dreams and a strong example of hard work.

She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Monica makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Monica can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Monica’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Monica a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Astrid Elena

texts.es: Astrid de 39 años es una madre amorosa de dos hijos varones y en compañía de su cónyuge viven en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, localidad en donde funciona su venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que inició en sociedad con una amiga en el año 2012.  Su amiga manejaba muy bien el tema de la preparación de las comidas y le enseño, ellas trabajaron juntas un buen tiempo y posteriormente decidieron disolver la sociedad.  En la actualidad Astrid cuenta con una plaza de comidas muy concurrida por vecinos, amigos, familiares y transeúntes del lugar que degustan de perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos, chorizos y bebidas. Con la finalidad de renovar su carro de comidas rápidas y comprar insumos y materias primas: panes, embutidos y salsamentarías, Astrid realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y hacer realidad su proyecto.  Con esta inversión tendrá mayor comodidad y un mejor aspecto su negocio.
texts.en:
Astrid is 39 years old and a loving mother to her two sons. Together with her husband, she lives in a neighborhood of the municipality of Soledad. This is the place where she operates her fast food business, which she began in partnership with a friend in 2012. Her friend was very skilled at preparing food and taught Astrid. They worked together for quite a while, but later they decided to dissolve the partnership.

Currently, Astrid has a food stand which is very popular with neighbors, friends, family members and people passing through the area, who enjoy hot dogs, hamburgers, salchipapas [sausage slices with French fries], kabobs, chorizos and soft drinks. With the aim of renovating her fast food cart and buying more supplies and ingredients -- bread, sausages and condiments -- Astrid has applied for a Kiva loan. This is an opportunity for her to enter the world of financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and make her goal a reality. With this investment, her business will be better equipped and more attractive.

loans.use: renovate her fast food cart and buy supplies and ingredients: bread, sausages and condiments.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer casada de 49 años de edad la cual genera ingresos gracias a su negocio de venta de alimentos los cuales elabora en la cocina de su hogar, dado que no cuenta con un local para operar.
Inicio con su trabajo pro gusto y vocación al trabajo, gracias a su trabajo goza de una mejor calidad de vida y está cumpliendo su sueño de pagar la educación a sus hijos.
Actualmente cuenta con un pequeño inconveniente el cual es los largos desplazamientos que tiene que hacer para entregar sus productos, pero no se atreve a comprar una motocicleta ya que no cuenta con suficientes ingresos parar pagar un mensajero.
La cliente en la temporada de diciembre tiene mayor volumen de trabajo, quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para afianzarse en el mercado y lograr buenos clientes, para ello necesita de enseres y herramienta de trabajo para producir cantidades grandes de alimento.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ollas, enseres y una nevera para almacenar más productos.
texts.en:
Marta is a 49 year old married woman who generates her income from her own business selling food which she makes in her own home, given that she has no shop to work from.

She started her own business and thanks to her work she enjoys a better quality of life and is fulfilling her dream paying for her childrens education.

Currently she has a small inconvenience which is the long journey she has to make to deliver her products, but she daren't not buy a motorcycle because she doesn't have the funds to pay for a driver. 

The partner has a bigger volume of clients during December and wants to make the most of this opportunity to establish herself in the market and gain good clients, but she needs work tools to produce large amounts of food.

She is asking for a loan to buy pots and basic tools to store more products.

loans.use: to buy necessities and work tools to produce large quantities of food.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 51-year-old man, a veteran of a thousand battles, who works on his mixed farm. Silas is humble and he wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on his farm. He is fully dedicated to his farm work and thinks only of progressing.

Silas resides in the Chure, Nkubu area of Kenya, which is a remote village with poor living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. He is happily married and, together with his wife, has a lovely family. Silas's primary sources of income are milk and some personal business he engages in to make ends meet. He has managed to take care of his family with his income from selling different varieties of food crops. The Nkubu area has conditions that favor crop farming.

Silas has always wanted to start banana farming, but the lack of capital has prevented him. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start banana farming. With this loan he will be able to harvest more bananas and hence satisfy the ready market in his region. Demand for bananas in the Nkubu area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Silas is going to comfortably meet the demand.

His increased income will allow Silas to provide a secure future for his school-going children by paying their tuition fees. He believes that education is the gateway to success. His vision is to be a leading supplier of bananas to major hotels and households in his region. You can be part of Silas dreams with a loan that will help him achieve all that he wants. Help him out so that he can maintain his big smile!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start banana farming.

loans.name: Mamisoa Emilienne

texts.fr:
Mamisoa a 24 ans, elle est  mariée. Le couple a 2 enfants (7-4 ans) scolarisés. Son mari fait de l’élevage. Elle a commencé l’activité de vente de matériels en plastique depuis 2013. Avant, quand elle habitait dans une autre région, elle vendait des produits de première nécessité. Suite à l’hospitalisation de son enfant dans la capitale, le fonds utilisé a diminué. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle a crée cette activité. En raison de la localisation de son point de vente au bord de la route, elle rencontre parfois des problèmes durant la période de pluie , elle prévoit de changer de point de vente.
Son rêve est que ses deux enfants seront des médecins. L’objectif est d’être autonome sur le plan financier (augmentation des fonds propres) . Elle prévoit aussi de construire sa propre maison afin d’éviter  le paiement de loyer.
texts.en:
Mamisoa is 24 years old and married. The couple has two children (seven and four years old) who are in school. Mamisoa’s husband is a livestock farmer. She began selling plastic goods in 2013. Before, she lived in another region and sold essential items.

Following her child’s hospitalization in the capital, her available funds diminished. This is why she began her current business. Given the location of her point of sale along the side of the road, she sometimes encounters problems during the rainy season. She aims to change her point of sale.

Mamisoa dreams that her two children will become doctors. Her goal is to become financially independent (increase her own income). She also aims to build her own house to eliminate renting costs.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, seals, pots and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Joyline

texts.en:
The above picture presents Joyline, a woman with a strong character, who is serious and focused on her farming business. Joyline, who is 40 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Joyline is a farmer and a salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Joyline makes a commission on sales when she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Joyline can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Joyline’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Joyline a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Greetings from Kitale, Kenya! Joy is a 28-year-old farmer. She is the mother of a lovely family and is hard-working, humble, and responsible. When she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teachings.

Joy has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs, cows for milk and grows maize and vegetables to sell. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Joy is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya. 

Joy is seeking a loan to expand her farm and she intends to buy farm inputs. This move is quite a big deal for her. With the loan she will be able to buy inputs such as animal feeds and fertilizers that will help in increasing her production.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children,” she said.
Profits from the loan will be used in repaying the loan and expanding her business. Please help out this heroine!

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
When you look at Silvia, pictured above with her child, she is the true definition of a hard worker. She is a farmer in Chuka and is involved in maize, poultry and dairy farming. She has milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. Silvia also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses, which in fact she does.

Silvia is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter. This will aid in cutting down hay into smaller pieces before it’s mixed with other forage to feed the cow. Through the loan her cow will have a humble time in feeding and this will translate to increased milk production. Silvia has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. She has no plans to quit in the future, as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of funds.

With your loan, Silvia will improve her milk business. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity of milk and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education.

Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams!

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a mum who is humble, modest, and focused on her goal of improving the living conditions of her home. She lives in a post-conflict zone, where there are not many employment opportunities. Born in Nyakoria, a rural village in Nyamira, she has lots of enthusiasm and is very resourceful. Since she was a little girl she has demonstrated her talent and knack for farming.

Nyakoria is a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya where people live in shanties. But within these shanties Esther is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most smallholder farmers view Esther as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her four children as a primary caregiver.

Esther started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his one acre, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize and tea. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Esther is seeking a loan to buy farm implements such as modern farming tools and seeds. Her operations are growing consistently and through the loan she will be able to produce more produce. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her four children who are in public schools. She feels blessed to have the support of her husband through all her undertakings.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Metrine is an ambitious, 37-year-old young lady from the Bumula location, which is a luxuriant maize producing region in Rift Valley province of Kenya. Metrine is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and take on new challenges. These qualities have propelled her to become one of the most respected farmers in her village. 

She sells milk, poultry, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Metrine is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows that she has named them, which makes Metrine very proud and she feels fulfilled. 

Metrine is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for her child. She believes that the knowledge and skills her child will get from school will help her child in the future because her child will have a brighter future. Donate $25 towards this loan and empower a child’s life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 26 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kiminini, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with five children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and various food crops from her farmland.

The Kitale area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming operation, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to buy poultry.

Accessing funds is very challenging for her because she is a woman. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, to permanently change her living conditions, and to secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Berthine

texts.fr:
Berthine a 41 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari l’aide dans l'exercice de son activité. Le nombre d’enfants est de 7. L’ainé de 22 ans est un marchand ambulant, le second de 20 ans suit une formation en théologie en province. Les autres (18-15-11-6 ans) suivent encore leurs études. Le dernier est un bébé de 6 mois. 
Elle avait une petite unité de gargote, elle se trouvait dans l’obligation d’arrêter cette activité en raison de la construction de route passant sur le point de vente. Et depuis 1995, elle a créé cette petite unité de fabrication de paniers à partir des feuillards  en plastique. Les produits sont livrés directement auprès des clients. Le problème rencontré est la hausse du coût des matières premières d’où cette demande de prêts.
Le rêve du couple est l’extension de l’activité afin de pouvoir créer une petite unité d’élevage car le couple dispose d’un terrain propice à l’élevage, à cela s’ajoute la réussite de leurs enfants dans leurs études respectives.
texts.en:
Berthine is 41 years old and married. Her husband helps her with her business. They have seven children: the eldest, aged 22, is a hawker and the next-eldest is 20 and is in theology training outside of the city. The others (aged 18, 15, 11 and 6) are still in school. The last is a 6-month-old baby.

She used to have a small restaurant, but needed to stop the business due to road construction at her point of sale. In 1995, she started a small basket-making business using strips of plastic. Products are delivered directly to clients. The problem she faces is the rising cost of primary materials, which is why she is requesting a loan.

The couple’s dream is to expand the business to be able to create a small livestock farming business, as the couple has some land favorable for livestock farming. They would also like their children to succeed in their respective studies.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of plastic strips

loans.name: Litara

texts.en:
Litara is a 63 year old mother with 13 children. She is strong and still fit to run her business with the help of her children.

Litara owns and operates a small bingo business in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. Litara requested a loan to buy a bingo machine, boxes of bingo papers and a box of ink bottles to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, boxes of bingo papers and a box of ink bottles.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, de 45 años de edad, es una persona responsable y muy dedicada a su trabajo, es viudo, estudio hasta tercer grado, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales unos aun están estudiando y otros trabajan junto a él. 

Juan, se dedica a la pesca, este es un negocio que le ha generado muy buenos resultados y es por eso que lo sigue realizando.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para poder reparar las redes de pesca que necesita para el trabajo, porque con el tiempo se le han deteriorado y la pesca es el único sustento de su familia. 

Juan, sueña con seguir dándole el estudio a sus hijos y poder comprar una lancha propia para seguir trabajando para poder tener una vida plena junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 45 years old, is a responsible person and very committed to his job.  He is a widower and went to school until third grade.  He has eight children some of whom still go to school, while others work with him.  Juan works as a fisher man, and continues to do so because that activity gives him good results. 

Juan needs a loan in order to fix his fishing nets which he needs to perform his job.  His nets have deteriorated over time and his only way to make a living is through fishing.  Juan's dream is to continue to provide education for his children and be able to buy his own boat to keep working and have a fulfilling life next to his family.

loans.use: to buy the fishing nets he needs in order to perform his job

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Julienne a 53 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple a trois enfants. L’ainé est déjà marié. Les deux autres (22-9 ans) suivent encore leurs études. Le mari exerce une activité de négoce mais la famille fait aussi de l’élevage porcin et de l’agriculture. 
L’expérience dans l’activité de vente de charbon date de Février 2015. Avant, elle faisait de la lessive mais comme cette première activité nécessite beaucoup d’efforts physiques, elle a abandonné. En cette période de pluie, le coût à l’approvisionnement des sacs de charbon augmente d’ où cette demande de prêt pour augmenter le stock.  
Le rêve du couple est la réussite des études des enfants car les deux (Julienne et son mari) sont convaincus que leur situation actuelle est due à leur faible niveau d’études, à cela s’ajoute la finalisation de la construction d’une maison qui est en cours et également la construction  d’une autre.
texts.en:
Julienne is 53 years old and is married. The couple has three children. The eldest is already married, and the other two (aged 22 and 9) are still in school. Her husband has a small business, but the family also farms and raises pigs.

Her experience in selling charcoal dates back to February 2015. Previously she washed laundry, but as this business required significant physical effort she discontinued this work. During this rainy season the cost of purchasing charcoal is rising, which is why she is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

The couple’s dream is to ensure success for their children’s studies, as the two (Julienne and her husband) are convinced that their current situation is due to their low level of education. They would also like to finish construction on a house currently underway as well as the construction of an additional house.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 46 year-old dark-skinned farmer from a remote village in Kombu in the Kitale area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 5 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. 

Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. 

Thanks to your support, Jackline will succeed in making her dreams come true.  Take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Las Bellitas De Pachali Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank “Las Bellitas de Pachali” was formed by 9 women in the town of San Juan Sacatepéquez. This is an agricultural area where there are corn, beans, rice, sugar cane and coffee crops, as well as fruit trees. Produce is taken to the capital of the country, Guatemala City, to sell. Also, the area is quite famous for fields of cultivated flowers that enjoy huge popularity throughout the year but especially on Mother’s Day and Saint’s Days. The ladies in the Trust Bank have various businesses that include traditional textile production, handicrafts (sale of pottery items and “comales” used to grind corn), as well as the sale of chicken meat.

María is a member of the Trust Bank who is 38 years old and only had one year of formal education. She is married with five children. Maria sells chicken meat by the pound not only in her own community but in nearby ones as well. She, along with her husband, is determined to work hard so that their children can go to school. Happily, she has been successful as three of them are about to finish high school. Maria is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory of chicken meat. She also wants to buy some chickens to raise and, in the future, she would like to sell eggs!

Maria and her friends in the Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings when they transact business on their loans and participate in educational trainings led by a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. The ladies learn how to improve their lives and their businesses as they learn about empowerment and self-esteem, realizing goals, setting dreams, women’s rights and violence against women.

Friendship Bridge serves over 22,000 indigenous women in mostly rural areas in Guatemala where the rate of poverty is the highest. Through loans and education (“Microcredit Plus”), the organization offers these women a chance for a more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their communities.

Thank you, Kiva lenders, for believing in these women and funding loans for them. They are opening the door to a more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community!!!

loans.use: to increase her inventory of chicken meat for sale and buy some chickens to raise so she can sell eggs.

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.en:
Quixaya is a community near the Toliman Volcano in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. This area was severely affected by Tropical Storm Agatha in 2010. Nearby rivers became raging torrents of water, washing away bridges and roads. There was a massive loss of homes, crops (coffee and watercress) and water systems. In some areas, mud flow was over six feet deep. Sadly, there were a number of lost lives.

Seven hard-working women from the town have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Santa Cruz”. Their average age is 35 years and they have a maximum of 5 or 6 children.

Rosa is a member of the Trust Bank, who is 23 years old and has a 7 year old son. Her husband works as a laborer at a nearby coffee farm. Rosa has three fish farms where she raises more than 600 fish that she sells in the market. She also sells fruit and sweets outside the local school. Rosa is requesting a loan to purchase 600 more fish and large sacks of fish food.

Many of the ladies have businesses raising and selling fish, as well as the sale of chicken, fruit and vegetables. Others have farms where they grow bananas and coffee. Another lady has a perfume shop! All share the common goals of personal growth, raising the standard of living for their families and seeing their children become educated. They are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders.

Education is an important component of the “Microcredit Plus” Program (loans + education) of Friendship Bridge. As part of their loan agreement, clients are required to participate in non-formal education curriculum that is taught in their native indigenous language.

loans.use: to purchase 600 more fish and large sacks of fish food for her fish farm.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Her desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her age and the obstacles she has experienced, she doesn't reduce her efforts to achieve her objective. What she sets out for she gets. She is so humble and honest and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Ruth is the mother of lovely children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good for so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.

Ruth hails from the Likuyani, Kitale area of Kenya. She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Ruth started farming and has been doing farming for the past five years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips.

Ruth practices mixed farming on her farm and, through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success.”

Ruth is a woman who is very enterprising and she is seeking a loan of KES 70,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Ruth wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Ruth to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing.

Ruth hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Ruth's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets by exporting fruits and vegetables.

Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Ruth is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society and that is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

Help this woman with dreams and goals to realize. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Christine, who is a 38-year-old smallholder farmer from Ehoya farm Kitale area in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Christine owns a 0.5 acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This kind mother keeps dairy animals and grows a variety of crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming.

Christine is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Christine. Through a group of 15 members called Muihwa, Christine has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral.

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Christine because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Mary, a 43-year-old farmer from the remote village Shamakokho, situated in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and horticultural produce. Mary's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs.

Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Mary made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

The additional income from the expansion will go to Mary's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families.

With your loan, Mary’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Humble, hardworking and a dreamer are three words that perfectly describe Margaret, a family woman and worker. She does whatever she can to offer a better quality of life to her husband and seven children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide for them a better future. She is a 63-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale, a thriving area full of people like Margaret, who, with hard and honest work, make this a very productive town. She is a woman eager to get ahead.

Margaret was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Margaret always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.”

Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family.

Margaret also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs, and so she is kindly seeking a loan to buy high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore, using high quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Margaret is visionary, and her goal for the season is to get a greater crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Margaret believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Margaret’s way out of poverty.

Please support a working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a responsible, respectable, hard-working, honorable, and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her children, who mean everything to her. Salome is a very hard-working woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Salome offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mom, Salome has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. 

Salome has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES which she will use to start the shop. 
Her projections are that by the end of the first year she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a hardworking person, who has been able to get ahead thanks to her daily struggle. She is a practical woman.

She has no higher education or work experience, but only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Makuyu in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Eunice is happily married and a proud mother, and, together with her family, lives on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs and milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from the wonderful Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Eunice to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

Her greatest dream is to get ahead with her farming business and be able to have a good quality of life and better economic stability. She knows that with the help of KIVA and Juhudi Kilimo, she'll be able to do it.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Tzancoton Group

texts.en:
In the Western Highlands of Guatemala in the town of Nahualá, seven dedicated and hard-working mothers have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tzancoton”. In joining a Trust Bank, the ladies realize many benefits including increased support, camaraderie and self-esteem, improved hygiene and health care, an increased number of their children attending school and a greater ability to weather economic shocks such as illness or natural disaster, decreased malnutrition.

“Tzancoton” Trust Bank member Manuela is 54 years old and married with 7 children. She has a traditional textile business and makes wraparound skirts called “cortes”, ornate woven and embroidered blouses called “huipiles” and napkins. Four of her children work with her in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase various colors and textures of high quality thread and other supplies for the business. She wants to be certain to meet the demand of her clientele, especially since the holidays are approaching.

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bride effectively combines small loans and education to help women expand their businesses and learn practical applicable lessons on a variety of topics. The ladies are eager to participate in these trainings as they have had little or no formal education and most cannot read and write.

Manuela and the ladies in the “Tzancoton” Trust Bank are appreciative of Kiva lenders for funding their loans.

loans.use: to purchase various colors and textures of high quality thread and other supplies for the business.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine, who is 29 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business.

On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Maurine makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over four years.

She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Maurine can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereal produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit.

Your loan will help Maurine’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood. Support her dream by giving Maurine a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking, humble country woman who is 60 years old. Since she was a girl, she learned to handle all the farm chores, thanks to the teachings of her parents. She is a very industrious and honest mother from the Kitale area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpments.

Elizabeth has been farming for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been from milk, eggs, and crops. She is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm.

Although Elizabeth earns profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds to plant and increase her output. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's most populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that she could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Elizabeth now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with the wonderful Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Elizabeth believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

Elizabeth also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow her to not only repay this loan but also secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old, strong, full of energy, and hardworking. She hails from the Kiminini, Kitale, area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming.

Elizabeth has a handsome husband and eight children that she really admires and would do anything so that they never lack anything. Through practicing dairy and crop farming, she has always been able to provide food for her family and also meet their basic needs. She has acquired much experience over the last 10 years, and this has helped her earn profits.

She is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy poultry. Through the loan, she is sure that she will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Kitale, which is densely populated and has ready markets for eggs and poultry. Because of the immense knowledge that Elizabeth has and also because of the good will she enjoys with the villagers, she will not have any challenge in selling her products.

She also believes that through word of mouth, she will be able to get more customers and increase her customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Elizabeth and her family, and this will also allow her to make permanent changes to her life and increase her business.

Be inspired, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a smallholder farmer, who lives and works on a small farm in the Transnzoia, Kitale area of Kenya. Beatrice is a humble and hardworking woman, who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her six children.

She makes a living doing dairy, crop and vegetable farming. Beatrice enjoys her job as a farmer because it provides food, income, and a livelihood for her family. Besides being a means of securing the basic necessities for life, farming provides her with self-respect and fulfilment in knowing that what she does feeds her nation.

In the area of Kenya where Beatrice operates, there is a huge deficit in terms of access to financial products and services. For years, Beatrice has had yields and incomes that are far below what they could have been because she can't afford quality agricultural inputs.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through this partnership, financial services are now available to farmers like Beatrice.

Beatrice is seeking a loan to buy important agricultural inputs ahead of the planting season. These farm inputs include seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. These funds will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to overcome various obstacles that have arisen in her life. A mother of three from Nkubu, a remote town in the central province of Kenya, she has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Gladys is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart.

Gladys wants to diversify by starting a cereal-selling business, and so is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Nkubu area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Gladys will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Gladys is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Gladys awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Twikany'e Mbee Kiene S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Alphonce. He is 39 years old, married and has three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. This enabled him to manage his business better, especially through proper record keeping and utilization of profits.

He practices dairy farming and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed for his dairy. This will enable him to increase production and he intends to use the increased profits to diversify farming activities by starting to farm fruit. He will also be able to cater to his family's needs with ease.

Alphonce is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed to increase milk production and use the profits to start farming fruit.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Speaking with the ever-smiling Caroline, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their five angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

Caroline has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling products from her farm including milk, sheep's wool, mutton and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, as does poor productivity.

Caroline is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm.

Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way toward changing the life of Caroline and her family.

Caroline promises to make her payments punctually, and is thankful to all those who will support her in buying farm inputs. All she can tell them is "Thank You".

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
The only thing on Nicholas' mind at the moment is success. He has to work hard and always stay strong through all of the adversities that may arise. A youthful 28-year-old father, Nicholas is a wise farmer who is respected by his neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Siongiroi, which is in the Rift valley region of Kenya. He is also engaged in a side motorbike delivery business. He is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family which is his greatest motivation in life to persevere because he wants to provide them with a better future.

Nicholas was unable to study for a professional career because of the economic situation that his family faced. However, he never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. He is an early riser who goes to his farm to earn a living, and he has space there to use for dairy farming. He has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Siongiroi is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Nicholas, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. He hopes that this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living and expand his milk-selling business.

Once Nicholas has accumulated more profits, he plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center where he will package and sell milk. He wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging. But with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, he feels relieved to know that all his dreams will be achieved and he will be able to provide a secure future to his children and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with seven children who are her greatest motivators. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Annah was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation in her family. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past ten years.

Annah has always had an affinity for farming. She has even nicknamed one of her cows and is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day which helps her support her family. Annah also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seed, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits.

Annah is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Annah believes that through the loan, she will be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will lift Annah out of poverty.

Make a $25 loan or more, and push Annah’s dream closer to reality

loans.use: to buy farm imputs.

loans.name: Wend La Telda Group

texts.fr: Antoinette, est une femme âgée de 27 ans, mariée pas d'enfant. Elle exerce son activité depuis 5 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est qu'elle a un bon emplacement (sur une grande voie), elle est très propre et le elle fait de la bonne salade. Elle veut le prêt pour aménager son local à 50 000 f, pour acheter l'huile à 10 000 f, la salade pour 25 000 f, les œufs pour 15 000 f, le reste des 50 000 f pour les autres ingrédients. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité.Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a 27-year-old woman who is married with no children. She has been running her business for five years. What makes her business work is that she has a good location (on a large street), she is very tidy and she makes good salad.

She would like the loan to renovate her location for 50,000 f, purchase oil for 10,000 f, lettuce for 25,000 f, eggs for 15,000 f, and use the remaining 50,000 for other ingredients. The purpose of this loan is to purchase a sufficient amount of supplies to strengthen her business. She already received one loan and paid it back on time.

loans.use: to renovate her location for 50,000 f, purchase oil for 10,000 f, lettuce for 25,000 f, eggs for 15,000 f, and use the remaining 50,000 f for other ingredients.

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvia, de 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y su esposo es pastor de una iglesia y juntos tienen 4 hijo. 

Silvia, ha dedicado toda su vida a los oficios del hogar y a la agricultura, por el momento se dedica a la venta de pan y de tamales una vez a la semana y también tiene sembrada 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol cerca de su casa. 

Silvia, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y otra parte será para invertir en un nuevo negocio de pupusas que quiere instalar a la orilla de la calle principal. 

Silvia, desea obtener buenas cosechas y que su nuevo negocio sea rentable.
texts.en:
Silvia is 43 years old and was never able to go to school. She is married and her husband is a a pastor at a church. They have four children together.

Silvia has dedicated her whole life to homemaking and farming. She is currently growing a little over 1.5 acres of beans near her home, and she also sells bread and tamales once a week.

Silvia needs this loan to buy farm supplies. She will also invest part of it in starting a new business by setting up a pupusa stand on the side of the main street.

Silvia wants to get a good harvest and for her new business to be profitable.

loans.use: to invest in farm supplies as well as to set up a new business selling pupusas.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
With 12 children to look after (which is a big number) and food to cook for the whole family, Rosa has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family.

With the little time Rosa has, she sells crops from her small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. Rosa is seeking a Kiva loan of 10,000 KES to buy seed and grow her agriculture business. Through this loan she will be able to improve her agriculture through producing more outputs.

With your loan, Rosa’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seed and grow her farm.

loans.name: Vierina

texts.en:
Despite the importance of farmers and farming on the Nkubu economy, microfinance institutions (M.F.I.'s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market, and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Vierina, an ever smiling, hardworking, and honest mother, who is 27 years of age. She hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of three lovely children. She loves and treasures her children, and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Vierina’s primary source of income has been selling milk, crop farming and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer, who has been farming for five years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mom has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Nkubu area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Vierina has received training, and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Vierina is quite visionary, and with her accumulated profits, hopes she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Zippora

texts.en:
Farming is one of the most difficult jobs today in Kenya due to the great effort that one must put forth to progress. Zippora is a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Kaplamai in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with two lovely angelic-looking children.

For the last 10 years, Zippora has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back. She really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been sales of vegetables, eggs and crops, as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet.

Zippora finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs.

She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels. Zippora is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change.

She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and improve her farming business. Zippora has big dreams for her farming business, and she thinks that her future can improve considerably, thanks to the support of organizations like Juhudi Kilimo that make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds.

loans.name: Fetiniaina

texts.fr:
Fetiniaina est une femme âgée de 30 ans qui vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle loue une petite maison en ville avec sa famille. Elle est vendeuse de vêtements d’occasion au bord de la route dans un quartier très animé.
Elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 1 an. Les prêts d’avant lui ont permis d’augmenter le capital de l’activité. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 2 balles de friperie afin de donner une large gamme à ses clients.
Les bénéfices qu’elle obtiendra servira à renforcer le capital de l’activité ce qui lui permettra de donner un meilleur avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fetiniaina is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her four children. She rents a small house in the city with her family. She sells second-hand clothing alongside the road in a bustling neighborhood.

She has been a borrower with Vahatra for one year. Her previous loans allowed her to increase her business capital. With this loan, she plans to purchase two bales of second-hand clothing in order to offer a large selection to her clients.

The income she will earn will serve to strengthen capital for the business, which will allow her to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is an accomplished farmer from Kitale area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, blessed with seven children.

For the past 44 years she has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, farmers from her village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques.

Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and some personal businesses she engages in to make the extra income.
