Florence sells cereals to her neighbors and to the local market and makes more money, although her work is not without challenges, she says, though she is regarded as the best cereal seller in her village.

She has been unable to meet the market demand which has resulted in a loss of tenders. One of her neighbors ordered cereals from her which she was unable to supply. She is seeking a loan to buy more cereals so that she can satisfy the demand. She intends to buy different variety of cereals such as millet, rice, sorghum and maize.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro-finance that supports small scale farmers, Florence is confident that this loan will permanently change her life.

Increased profits from cereal selling will allow her to afford her highest monthly expenses: farm related comforts and the ability to channel a surplus amount to her children's education. Florence is a visionary and plans to buy a maize milling machine through accumulated profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Elijah, a hardworking, dedicated, and honest 53-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of his family, with a wife and eight children, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Litein, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya.

For the past 15 years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and maize selling. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. Elijah passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market.

He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and another quality breed of dairy cow. The chaff cutter will assist Elijah in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage to feed his cow. Also, it will aid the animal’s digestion and prevent the animals from rejecting any part of their food.

Elijah also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-25 litres of milk a day. Before Elijah joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming not a lucrative business. After training, Elijah now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into.

With the loan, Elijah will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Elijah will achieve this.

An increase in income will allow Elijah to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Elijah fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable credit facility. Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as a chaff cutter and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Visionarias Group

texts.en:
Seven motivated women have gathered together and formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Visionarias” or “Visionaries”. Their average age is 35 years and they average two children. The ladies have various businesses that include handicraft and traditional textile production, as well as restaurants catering to both local and international travelers.

Elena, who is 37 year old, married and has 2 children, is a member of the Trust Bank. She is a seamstress and, along with her husband, makes pants and backpacks, as well as traditional clothing. This is an especially important time of the year as the holidays are approaching as well as graduation and end of year festivities. Elena wants to be able to have plenty of inventory available and is requesting a loan to buy thread, buttons, fabric and other supplies for her textile business. She wants be able to fill all orders in a timely way.

The women of the Trust Bank share goals of empowering themselves in their community, raising the standard of living for their families, sending their children to school and moving ahead in their lives. They are most aware of the value of a good education. Many of them were unable to attend school while others reached primary and secondary grades.

The women share “Without the growth of our businesses and the income that we are making, it would not be possible for us to take care of our household expenses and give our children the education that they need”. They are most appreciative of Kiva lenders for funding their much-needed loans! Thank you!

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, fabric and other supplies for her textile business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 28-year-old, charismatic, young, and dark-skinned woman who is a strong role model for hard work. Agnes wants to take the world by storm. She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm, she keeps cows and poultry and has a small cash crop garden and trees.

To earn additional income, Agnes arranges the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers and makes a commission on those sales. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. 

Given that Agnes can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy  more produce from local farmers at fair prices and to use her good understanding of market conditions and prices to sell the produce at a profit. Your loan will help Agnes’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Agnes dreams of leaving the business to her children, but before that, she wants to pay for their education so that they can be professional.

You can get this mom closer to her dreams with just a loan. Support Agnes’s dream by giving her a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 59 years old and lives with her husband in the Muyuki, Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with 8 children who are her greatest motivators. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Jane was unable to study for a professional career because of the economic situation in her family. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

Jane has always had an affinity for farming. She has even nicknamed one of her cows and is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10 and 15 liters a day which helps her support her family. She also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why Jane is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through this loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seed, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits.

Jane is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Jane believes that through this loan, she will be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will lift her out of poverty.

Make a $25 loan or more, and push Jane’s dream closer to reality

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Esther, a young farmer from the Nandi Hills area in Kenya, who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Esther is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some varieties of crops she plants.

From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income, and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal selling business.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandi Hills, and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. With your loan, Esther will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals.

There is no doubt that through your loan, Esther's life is permanently going to change, and she will assure her school children a secure future.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Ten years ago Rosemary started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Mirirua, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense farming knowledge, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to Rosemary's heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes a profit by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through this loan she will be more comfortable when milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Rosemary believes that with this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will be able to save money that she would otherwise spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Rosemary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo es empleado en una funeraria y juntos tienen 4 hijos.  

Doris, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, aprendió este negocio por medio de un vecino que también tiene ganado y ella se encargaba de cuidarlos y después de eso decidió hacerlo por cuenta propia y su esposo se encarga de venderlos. 

Doris, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer ataúdes y para comprar ganado. 

El sueño de Doris, quiere tener una ganadería y también espera darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doris is 33 years old and has a high school education. She is married, and her husband has a job at a funeral home. They have four children together.

For the past two years, Doris has worked buying and selling cattle. She learned the trade from a neighbor who also has livestock. She used to work for him taking care of the animals and then decided to start her own business. She tends to the cattle, and then her husband sells it.

Doris needs this loan to buy materials to build coffins, as well as to purchase cattle.

Doris' dream is to run a cattle ranch. Her goal is to give her children an education.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build coffins, as well as to buy cattle.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Most of the Kenyan people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Veronica, 41, who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is a mother of 3 adorable and lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been from goat milk, eggs, and crops, as well as from some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet.

Veronica passionately loves dairy goat farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about goat farming, she stated “feeding my goat." Her hobby is grazing her goat. She sells goat milk and skins to her neighbors and at the local market. But demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy another dairy goat, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The goat she plans to buy is not just an ordinary goat; it’s a quality breed of goat that will produce more milk. This will immediately translate into more profits and increased income levels.

The profits from selling her goat milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Veronica is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her dairy goat business by packaging the milk before selling it. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Speaking with Salome, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the village of Karara in the Kitale area of Kenya, along with a handsome husband and their angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

Salome has been practicing agriculture for 7 years now. She earns money from selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her along with poor productivity.

Salome is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With this loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase her farm's soil fertility and productivity. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards.

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use her increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way towards changing Salome and her family's life. With your help she will be able to fulfill her dreams. Go ahead, make a loan, and keep her smile big!

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Farming is one of the most difficult jobs today due to the great effort that one must put forth to progress. Esther has done so and she is a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Milimani in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with two lovely angelic-looking children. 

For the last 10 years, Esther has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back. She really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs and crops as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet. Esther finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs. 

She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels. Esther is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. 

She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Dinah (pictured above with her husband) from the Nguruki, Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Dinah is 31 years old and a proud mother of three angel-looking children whom she really adores and cherishes. Other than doing some small business, Dinah is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Dinah practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows.

Although Dinah has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Dinah will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins.

Through this loan, Dinah will be able to expand her farming business. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the money to push the positive change. With your loan, Dinah will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. Dinah has many dreams. The main one is to make her farming business successful so that one day her children can inherit it and keep it so they have something to provide for themselves. You can help Dinah to accomplish this dream and all her goals with just a loan.

loans.use: To buy farm implements.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is ambitious, admirable, and a hard-worker who wants to triumph. She wants to leave her mark on the world. At 29 years old, she is independent and runs her own mixed farming business. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hard working than others. Priscah owns a 1 acre piece of land that she uses to grow maize and keep dairy animals. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. The land provides her with not only capital for her business but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have two children and a husband she has stayed married to for five years.

Priscah is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for her food and her business. The demand for cereals in the market, only a few kilometers from Priscah's home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. Your loan will directly elevate Priscah’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in.

loans.use: To buy cereal seeds

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale.
She was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Because of how much she likes farming she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. 

Ruth also practices crop and vegetable farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Ruth is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Ruth believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Ruth’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a rural smallholder farmer in Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has 3 children. Andrew does mixed farming for food and income. He also does some side hustle business. He enjoys farming for it is his means of securing the basic necessities of life for his family. 

Andrew is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before the planting season starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest. 

The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith, at the age of 31, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own small farm that she began due to the need to generate income to support her family. In spite of all the obstacles, she had the strength and the determination to pick herself up and keep on going, and thanks to this she's been doing farming for the past seven years. She works every day for 10 hours by herself.

Faith is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. Your loan will help Faith construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare feed rations and feed the cow. The shed will also ensure the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment. Your loan will bring untold benefits to Faith. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life with fulfilled basic needs. Help her out!

loans.use: To construct a modern cowshed

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, who is 42 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. Susan is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Susan makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships, because reputation is everything in her line of work. 

Given that Susan can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from farmers to resell at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Susan’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood. Support her dream by giving Susan a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a mum dedicated to her work. At age 51, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, in her mixed farm, tirelessly working. Mary is one of the most hardworking and dedicated mums on planet earth. She is based in Ntugi, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is happily married to Marete, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four lovely children.

For the past 10 years she has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests. Although Mary makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Mary comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity." Mary faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health.

Mary is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but Mary wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan, Mary will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. Mary is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Mary’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The above picture presents Mary, a practical, intelligent, and ingenious woman. She has always liked everything related to farming.

Mary is a young farmer from Kitale in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Mary is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been from planting crops, milk, eggs and a variety of vegetables. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Mary passionately loves farming. She got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security, which remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Kitale and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she faces is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereal. Demand for cereal is overwhelming in Kitale and through this loan she will buy different varieties of cereal. This will help her satisfy the demand in her village and local market.

With this loan, Mary will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereal.

Mary has been practicing agriculture with youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will grow in leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through this loan, Mary's life will change permanently. It will ensure her school-going children have a secure future.

You can help Mary to accomplish all her dreams, and a loan will do that for her.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Anybody listening to Sammy referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound would think that he has been doing dairy farming all her life, which is not the case. Sammy is from Litein, a remote town in Kenya, and is an active and progressive farmer in his locality. He has a wife and together they live on a small piece of land.

Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops, a personal business, and he has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Having done farming he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village.

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Nandi tribe (Sammy’s tribe) - where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high and Sammy wants to take advantage of the market.

Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Sammy has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. He has planted so many trees on his farm that food for the cattle will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge, because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms.

Through the loan, Sammy will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer.

Sammy has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, are there to make his dream come true. Sammy chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Sammy underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season, he learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions.

Through accumulated profits, Sammy plans to permanently improve his living conditions and to secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. He plans that through increased income, he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow

loans.name: Files

texts.en:
Files is a very hard-working and helpful mother who does all that she can for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with her family.

She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. Files has been in agriculture for 4 years. She sells milk,vegetables, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Files is seeking a loan to buy seeds. She plans to buy good-quality seeds to increase her productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards.

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, Files has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way to permanently change the life of Files and her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as  good-quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Introducing Sabina, who is a tireless worker who works seven days a week, 12 hours per day. This is all because she wants to achieve her dream of giving her children a good education. Sabina is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandihills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpments. Sabina has been farming for the past 10 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business venture that help her make ends meet. Sabina is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Sabina could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Sabina, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Sabina believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Sabina to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children. Like Sabina, many smallholder women farmer await for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Dania Iveth

texts.es:
Dania, es propietaria de un chalet en el que vende bebidas, pupusas, boquitas y otros productos comestibles, ella tiene una familia integrada por su esposo y dos hijas menores de edad, su pareja trabaja como motorista de carga. Dania trabaja cada día desde muy tempranas horas, el negocio lo inicio hace dos años por lo que ya tiene experiencia en su administración.
Para tener un mejor establecimiento solicita un préstamo, el cual utilizara en la compra de una plancha industrial para pupusas y mesas, será de ayuda para tener un negocio más productivo y para que sus clientes puedan degustar sus alimentos en un lugar más cómodo, espera atraer nuevos clientes.
Sus sueños son mejorar su vivienda, tener un negocio más rentable para salir adelante con su familia y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Dania is the proprietor of a food stand which sells beverages, pupusas, snacks, and other food products. Her family is made up of her husband and two daughters who are still minors. Her husband works as a delivery person on his motorcycle.

Dania works every day starting very early in the morning. She started her business two years ago, which means she now has experience running it. In order to improve her business establishment, she is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase tables and an industrial grill for pupusas. It will be helpful to have because it will make her business more productive, and her customers will be able to enjoy their food more comfortably. Dania hopes to attract more customers.

Her dreams are to improve her home and have a more profitable business in order to move forward with her family and pay back her loan.

loans.use: purchase tables and an industrial grill for pupusas, which will help to make her business more productive.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is an ambitious, 46-year-old young lady from the Muthege location, which is a luxuriant maize producing region in the central province of Kenya. Jane is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and take on new challenges. These qualities have propelled her to become one of the most respected farmers in her village. 

She sells milk, poultry, crops and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Jane is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows that she has named them, which makes Jane very proud and she feels fulfilled. 

Jane is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for her child. She believes that the knowledge and skills her child will get from school will help her child in the future, because her child will have a brighter future. Donate $25 towards this loan and empower a child’s life.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Daniela Fernanda

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven visionaria de tan solo 20 años de edad la cual se dedica a la confección a terceros, no tiene hijos, solo unas ganas inmensas de progresar y salir adelante.
Hoy esta grandiosa joven quiere solicitar tu apoyo, necesita un capital para la construcción y adecuación de un local, donde contara con oficina.
Daniela es muy organizada, quiere contar con un local óptimo, que refleje seriedad y seguridad a sus clientes.
Con el dinero comprara cemento, adobe, tejas, muebles para la oficina, cerámica y realizara adecuaciones con el sobrante.
texts.en:
Daniela is a young visionary who is only 20 years old. She works making clothes for third parties. She has no children, just an immense desire to progress and succeed. Today this great young lady wants to seek your support. She needs capital for the construction and modification of a locale, where she can have an office.

Daniela is very organized. She wants to have the optimal locale, that reflects reliability and security to her customers. With the money she will buy cement, adobe, corrugated roof sheeting, furniture for the office, and ceramic tiles. She will make the renovations with the remaining funds.

loans.use: to buy cement, adobe, corrugated roof sheeting, office furniture, and ceramic tiles, and to complete the renovations with the rest.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina (pictured above with her handsome husband) is married and has six children. In addition to her family, she has devoted her life to farming. Ten years ago, Regina started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of six children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions. 

Regina believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.
Have a positive impact on the lives of Regina and her family of six children: Make a loan!

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro es un productor agrícola de 40 años de edad el cual vive en unión libre con su pareja con la cual tiene un pequeño de 2 años de edad que ha cambiado totalmente su vida, su bebe lo ha impregnado de felicidad, es su motor de vida y por él quiere ser un mejor empresario y llevar excelente recursos a su hogar, que goce de calidad de vida, que tenga un juguete para divertirse, educación, amigos y el amor de una familia que siempre lo apoyará.
Se dedica principalmente a la cría de cerdos, el cliente quiere solicitar un préstamo pensando en crecer y generar mayores ingresos por ello con el dinero busca construir una porqueriza y comprar cerdos, con el único objetivo de contar con mmás animales para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Álvaro is an agricultural producer. He is 40 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner. Together they have a 2 year old son who has completely changed Álvaro's life. The baby has permeated him with happiness and is the driving force in his life. For his son's sake, Álvaro wants to be a better businessman and bring excellent assets to his home. He wants his child to enjoy a good quality of life, to have a toy to entertain him, to have education, friends, and the love of a family that will always support him.

Álvaro works primarily in breeding pigs. He wants to seek a loan with the idea of growth and generating greater income. To that end, with the money he plans to build a pigsty and buy pigs, with the sole objective of having more animals to increase his sales.

loans.use: to construct a pigsty and buy pigs.

loans.name: Hanah

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Hanah, 44, a young, energetic, hardworking and focused farmer. She hails from the Kagema, Thika area, one of the most remote, rural regions in Kenya. The condition of her village speaks for itself, as basic requirements such as clean water and electricity are missing. However, despite these challenges, Hanah loves farming. She practices mixed farming, which has enabled her to take care of her aging parents. Not everything has been good for this humble and hardworking mum.

The Kagema area has a ready market for poultry products and eggs, and Hanah, being an enterprising person, wants to take advantage of this and earn profits. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to start poultry farming. Hanah has enough space on her farm and wants to make use of it through poultry farming. Other than income from selling eggs and poultry products, poultry will also provide manure to use on her farm, thus saving Hanah money that would have been used to buy it. Hanah projects that, after a few months, she will have more income to buy more poultry and also to repay the loan.

Hanah is a family mum, so her dreams revolve around her family, and she wants to pay for her children's education so that they grow up to be good people. You can help Hanah to achieve her goals; a loan will get her a lot closer.

loans.use: to buy poultry to expand her farming activities.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y junto a ella tiene 4 hijos. 

Roberto, tiene 12 años de trabajar en un Ingenio de azúcar como motorista de carga dentro de las instalaciones, pero también tiene dos años de trabajar para otra persona como motorista particular, halando caña y su horario de trabajo es variado. 

Roberto, necesita el préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora, porque iniciará un nuevo negocio y para ello necesita comprar pan, salchichas, papas, salsas, vegetales, entre otros insumos para preparar hot-dog, papas fritas, hamburguesas.

El sueño de Roberto es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Roberto is 37 years old. He went to school until the ninth grade. He is married, and his wife takes care of the home. Together they have 4 children. For 12 years Roberto has worked in a sugar plant, as a cargo driver within the facilities. He has also worked for two years as a personal driver for another person, hauling sugar cane. His work hours vary.

Roberto needs the loan to buy a refrigerator because he started a new business. For it, he needs to buy bread, hot dogs, potatoes, salsas, and vegetables among other supplies, to prepare hot dogs, french fries and hamburgers. Roberto's dream is that his business grow and that his children finish school.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
For ten years, Ruth has been doing a side hustle business (motorbike business) and also worked on her mixed farm. This is a skill that she learned from her parents and, little by little, has perfected her techniques and abilities in farming.

She is a 30-year-old farmer from Matunda village, situated in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She lives with her family on a small piece of land where she keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops. For ten years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs.

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to educating her children. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming expensive, especially in the rural areas such as Matunda, Kitale. With your loan, Ruth’s children and siblings will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

Help this smallholder farmer to fulfill her dreams and improve her horticulture farming! A loan will certainly push her one step closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Honest, dedicated, hardworking, and a go-getter are four words that perfectly describe Betty, a loving woman and a farmer. Kiva lenders! Introducing to you Betty, a 24-year-old, youthful, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling farmer. She lives with her parents and siblings in a remote village in Litein in the Rift Valley region of Kenya.

Betty passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her parents and siblings. Feeding the large family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets, but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living.

Betty has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and the price of milk in the recent past has been going up, so Betty, being a visionary and entrepreneurial farmer, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow, but also manure; this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms.

Betty said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Betty hopes that through the accumulated profit, she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products.

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 27, is a smallholder farmer based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. The mother of five has been doing farming for the last eight years. Her primary income sources are milk, maize, and other crops. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is dairy farming. Her hobby is milking. However, her biggest challenge is rearing of animals. She feels she still has a lot to learn about rearing.

Sarah is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders for a dairy cow. The new cow she will purchase is projected to produce over ten litres of milk each day. This additional volume of milk will fulfill the growing demand in the market and boost her returns. With those returns, Sarah will be able to make the loan installments on time. She will also be in a better position to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Elvia Luz

texts.es:
Elvia es una mujer soltera cabeza de familia, una persona emprendedora que gusta del trabajo independiente, ella tiene un negocio de tienda, enfocado principalmente a niños y niñas, con el cual genera los ingresos para el pago de sus deudas y la educación de su hija adolescente. 
Elvia ha demostrado gran carácter, fortaleza mental y espíritu combativo, sacar a su hija adelante, construir un futuro para ella, generarle oportunidades, resalta la responsabilidad y compromiso que pone en sus deberes.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual complementara el dinero que necesita para el pago a proveedores de ropa y abastecerse de un completo surtido de ropa para niño y niña como pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otros, pensando en la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Elvia is a single mother, and the head of household of her family. She is an entrepreneurial person, who likes independent work. Her business is a store, focused primarily on boys and girls, from which she generates earnings to pay her debts and to pay for the education of her teenage daughter.

Elvia has demonstrated great character, mental strength, and a fighting spirit, to move her daughter forward, build a future for her, and generate opportunities for her. The responsibility and commitment she evidences toward her duties are notable.

She currently is seeking a loan which will supplement the money she needs to pay to suppliers of clothes and will supply her with a complete assortment of clothes for boys and girls, such as pants, shirts, and blouses, among others, with the holiday season in mind.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes for boys and girls, such as plants, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana es un mujer responsable y trabajadora que tiene que suplir las necesidades de su hogar, es madre soltera de dos jóvenes de 18 y 19 años de edad, los cuales son totalmente dependientes de ella, manifiesta no tener ayuda de remesas, su negocio es vender comida, lo inicio aproximadamente hace 18 años por motivación personal y con ayuda de una empleada, el oficio lo aprendió gracias a su familia, no presenta dificultades para trabajar.
Se decidió a trabajar con créditos para fortalecer su negocio, comprara carnes, aceite, arroz, condimentos, bebidas, verduras, etc., con los cuales tendrá oportunidad de diversificar el menú que ofrece a sus clientes, sus esfuerzos son para tener más ganancias con las que piensa ir pagando sus deudas y darle a su familia un vida más confortable.
La visión de Ana es tener un negocio más competitivo y darles a sus hijos educación universitaria para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ana is a responsible and hard-working woman who has to supply the necessities of her household. She is the single mother of two teenagers, ages 18 and 19, who depend on her completely. She states that she has no help from remittances.

Her business is selling food. She began it approximately 18 months ago through personal motivation and with the help of an employee. She learned the work thanks to her family. Working doesn't present any difficulties for her.

She decided to work with loans to strengthen her business. She will buy meats, oil, rice, condiments, beverages, vegetables, etc., with which she will have the opportunity to diversify the menu that she offers her customers. Her efforts are made in order to have more earnings, with which she is thinking of paying her debts and giving her family a more comfortable life.

Ana's vision is to have a more competitive business and give her children a university education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy meats, oil, rice, condiments, beverages, vegetables, etc., with which she will have the opportunity to diversify the menu that she offers her customers.

loans.name: Khusniddini

texts.ru: Самостоятельный парень Хусниддини. Ему всего 23 года. Он живет вместе с тетей. Его родители находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Хусниддини имеет источник доход. Он занимается таксистом в городе. Хусниддини городской парень, он хорошо знает свой родной город. Хусниддини трудится, зарабатывает и помает тете обеспечить семью. Хусниддини родился и вырос в воспитанной и трудолюбивой семье. Он хочет отремонтировать  свою автомашину, и купить зимние шины. Потому что у него летные шины на машине. Хусниддини надеется в деньгах. С такими планами он запрашивает не большое количество сумма денег.
texts.en:
This independent guy is Khusniddini. He is 23 and lives with his aunt. His parents are working in Russia. He has a source of income - he works as a taxi driver in the city. He is an urban guy and knows his home city well. He works hard to earn money and help his aunt take care of the family. He was born and raised in a well-mannered and hardworking family.

Khusniddini wants to fix up his car and buy winter tires, because he currently has summer tires on the car. He is hoping for money and with this in mind he is requesting a small amount of money.

loans.use: to buy car parts and winter tires

loans.name: Saidmahmud

texts.ru: Простой парень из района Хамадони, Саидмахмуд. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одну дочку. Саидмахмуд живет вместе с отцом, матерью, братом, женой и дочкой. Он воспитанный и самостоятельный парень. Саидмахмуд на жизнь зарабатывает сам, и он помогает родителям обеспечить семью. Он занимается таксистом. Саидмахмуд около 2 года перевозить пассажиров в город Душанбе и Хамадони. Он днем и ночью за рулем. Саидмахмуд не боится трудностей, и он идет вперед. У Саидмахимуд ест автомашина марки «Opel». Он решил капитально отремонтировать автомашину и потом продвигать свою работу. Для купли автозапчастей и на оплаты за услуги мастера нет денег. По этой причине Саидмахмуд обратился за кредитом. Он надеется, что ему не откажут на помощь.
texts.en:
This simple guy from the Khamadoni region is Saidmahmud. He is 26 and has one daughter. He lives with his father, his mother, his brother, his wife and his daughter. He is a well-mannered and independent guy. He earns a living himself and helps his parents take care of the family by working as a taxi driver. He has been transporting passengers in the city of Dushanbe and in Khamadoni for about two years. He is behind the wheel day and night. He is not afraid of difficulties, and just goes forward.

Saidmahumud has an Orel brand car. He has decided to do major repairs to his car so he can continue to work, but he doesn't have the money to buy car parts or pay a mechanic. For this reason he is looking for a loan. He hopes that he won't be turned away in his request for help.

loans.use: to buy car parts and pay a mechanic

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque la escuela estaba demasiado lejos, es madre soltera de dos hijos, que ya son mayores de edad.

Carmen, se dedica al destazo de cerdos, pero también tiene una pequeña tienda y cuida a su padre quien enfrenta una enfermedad que le ha hecho olvidar la memoria y se encuentra muy delicado de salud y su madre también es una anciana y también la tienen que cuidar.

Carmen, necesita el préstamo para comprar de cerdos, porque el dinero con el que trabaja lo invirtió en la agricultura para poder obtener granos básicos para el consumo familiar.

Carmen, sueña con que su padre se mejore y que toda su familia tenga mejores condicoines de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 40, didn’t have a chance to go to school because the school was too far away.  She is a single mother to two children who are already adults.

Carmen mainly works butchering pigs.  She also has a little store and cares for her father, who is facing an illness that has caused him to lose his memory; his health is very delicate.  Her mother is also elderly, and she also has to care for her.

Carmen needs this loan to buy pigs because the money she works with will be invested in agriculture in order to get basic grains for her family’s use.

Carmen dreams that her father would improve and that all her family would have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Nicolas De Jesus

texts.es:
Nicolás es un joven soltero de 23 años de edad, trabajador, sonriente, inocente, una persona responsable y comprometida con su futuro.
Desde pequeño trabajo en las actividades agropecuarias junto con sus padres, aprendió todo de ellos, y ahora gracias a su visión y sus ganas de ser un empresario importante del municipio de Sonson monto su propio negocio de producción de lácteos, las cuales ordeñan en la finca y traslada en caballo hasta el sitio de entrega   (ver foto).
Este joven quiere cada día más, producir, tener dinero, quiere ser el pilar económico de su familia, quiere comprar sus propios terrenos, plantar frutas, verduras, tiene proyectos que espera en un futuro poder cumplirlos.
Actualmente el joven Nicolás solicita un préstamo el cual será para la compra de una vaca con el único objetivo de aumentar su producción para generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a single young man, age 23.  He is hardworking, smiling, and innocent: a responsible person committed to his future.

From a young age he has worked in farming activities alongside his parents.  He learned everything from them and now, thanks to his vision and his drive to be an important businessman in the town of Sonson, he started his own business producing dairy products.  He does the milking on the farm and carries his products by horse to the delivery site (see the photo).

This young man increasingly wants to be productive and have money.  He wants to be the financial foundation of his family.  He wants to buy his own plots of land, plant fruit and vegetables, and have projects that he hopes to be able to complete in the future.

Currently young Nicolás is asking for a loan, which will be for the purchase of a cow with the sole objective of increasing his production in order to generate a greater income.

loans.use: to buy a cow with the sole objective of increasing his production in order to generate a larger income.

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es: María es una empresaria agropecuaria de 28 años de edad la cual está solicitando de tu apoyo para comprar una vaca, la principal razón de la solicitud radica en la problemática ambiental y el problema del bajo precio de venta de leche que ha afectado su economía, ella busca a toda costa regular sus ingresos para mantener su hogar, no permitir que pasen necesidades, gozar de una vida digna y seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Maria is a 28-year-old agricultural entrepreneur who is requesting your support to buy a cow. The principal reason for the request is rooted in the problematic environment and the problem of the low price from the sale of milk, which has affected her economy.

She is seeking at any cost to keep her income stable to maintain her household, not experience needs, enjoy a dignified life, and continue growing as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a cow to make her production of milk more stable.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer based in Karie village in the central region of Kenya. She is married to a lovely husband, and they have three sweet children. Lucy may be new to motherhood, but she is a farming veteran. She has been doing this work for one decade.

The vegetables and crops that she grows on her one-acre farm provide her with a reliable income. She also sells milk and eggs from the animals she keeps. Lucy enjoys looking after her cow. She also spends a lot of time on her farm.

Lucy is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 for buying fertilizer and other farm inputs. Since she will be scaling up, she will rely on the loan to buy farm inputs that do not come cheap, such as fertilizer.

When asked how this loan will be of benefit to her family, Lucy replied, "My nuclear family will have a chance to enjoy better standards of living because of enhanced cash flows."

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Monicah, a 34-year-old mother of four children, who resides in the Nandihills area in Kenya. She is very humble and a go-getter. Monicah has been practicing farming for the last three years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. Monicah enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Having the traits of a go-getter, Monicah has always dreamed big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is seeking a loan of KES 25,000 to start the shop and make her dream come true.

With your loan, Monicah will be able to improve her income level and to comfortably take care of her family. Monicah’s projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

Please support a working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with six children who are her greatest motivators. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Mary was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation in her family. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 7 years. 

Mary has always had an affinity for farming. She has even nicknamed one of her cows and is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day which helps her support her family. Mary also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs. 

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seed, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits. 

Mary is very visionary, and her goal for this December holiday is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Mary believes that through the loan, she will be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will lift Mary out of poverty.

Make a $25 loan or more, and push Mary’s dream closer to reality and keep her big smile

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Beatrice has never set foot in any higher learning institution, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya, and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with six adorable children. 

For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, farmers from her village seek advice from her on the best dairy farming techniques. 

Beatrice is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard, so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Although she makes a profit from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. 

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Beatrice could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Beatrice, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Beatrice believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Beatrice to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Be inspired make a loan to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Abnel

texts.en:
Abnel is an energetic and handsome young 32 year old man. Born in Kobos, a rural village in Kitale, he has lots of enthusiasm and is very resourceful. Since he was a little boy he has demonstrated his talents and knack for farming. Kobos is a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya where people live in mud houses and in dismal conditions.

But within the remote village of Kibos, Abnel is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Abnel as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that he has despite personal challenges, and his passion to support his four children as a primary caregiver. Abnel started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her wife, who dedicated his time and effort, he has grown the business dramatically. He has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. He keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. He takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Abnel is seeking a loan to buy farm implements such as modern farming tools and seeds. His operations are growing consistently. With your funding, Abnel will expand his farming through buying good quality seeds and using modern farming inputs. The additional income will enable him to repay the loan, buy food for his family, and pay fees for his four children who are in public school. He feels blessed to have the support of her wife, through all his undertakings.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
This is Christine (with one of her children above). She is a 28-year-old woman who lives in the area of Miruirui, Nkubu. It is a thriving area full of people like Christine, who, with hard and honest work, make this town a very productive town. Christine is a woman eager to get ahead. She is married and lives with her family. She is blessed with three lovely children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide for them a better future.

Christine was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family.

Christine also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore, using high quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Christine is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through the lenders’ help and goodwill. Christine believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Christine’s way out of poverty. Lend to her to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, who is 37 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. 

She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Christine makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. 

Given that Christine can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Christine’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Christine a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a 32-year-old farmer from a remote village in Sango in the Kitale area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the past 5 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Celestine passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Celestine is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

In addition to profits, Celestine will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Celestine will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Tecla has no academic papers to show off but she is an accomplished farmer who hails from the remote village of Chepkinyuk, in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with four adorable children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers come to seek advice from her. Tecla is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Although she makes a profit from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Tecla could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Tecla, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Tecla believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Tecla to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud countrywoman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nandihills, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Irene is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps cows. Irene has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states,: "I have to do something for my family."

Irene joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Irene is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes), which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Irene to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

For smallholder women in Kenya, accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle, but Irene feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their large scale counterparts. The benefits of this loan are many because Irene will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase.

Irene is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Irene will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her four children of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is an enterprising man, intelligent, responsible, and capable. He lives in a rural area in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area high in poverty but full of enterprising people who, with knowledge and attitude, will, and enthusiasm want to be successful. He is 31 years old and a proud father of four angelic-looking children who he really adores and cherishes.

Other than doing some small business, Timothy is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. He has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Timothy practices mixed farming. That is, he grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities he has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion he has for farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows. He really enjoys taking care of his cows and sheep.

Although Timothy has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious man. His farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why he is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Timothy will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, he will increase his profit margins. Through this loan, Timothy will be able to expand his horticulture business. He sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the funds.

With your loan, Timothy will make enough income to take care of his family and other farming expenses. He wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give his family a decent living and afford his children a proper education.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty, who is 40 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. Betty is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Betty makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Betty can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Betty’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood. Support her dream by giving Betty a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Eldoret, Kenya is a town that is famously known for producing the “creme de la creme” when it comes to athletics. It also has a lot of smallholder farmers who work the land and raise animals. Unfortunately, the people who do this farm work face many problems, like the high costs of the farm inputs, the weather or bad seasons. Margaret has full knowledge of this but always finds a way to come through.

Margaret is from a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya and she is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her two children as their primary caregiver. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and vegetables and also keeping dairy cows. Margaret has been able to provide nutritious food for her family

Margaret is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Margaret believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Margaret waits for your kindness.

Be inspired to loan to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José invirtió el crédito anterior en su negocio de cultivos de granos básicos, está satisfecho por los resultados positivos que ha  tenido, pues así se ha mantenido trabajando y generando los ingresos de subsistencia para él y su familia, misma que en la actualidad ha crecido, comenta no tener problemas para desarrollar sus actividades.
Considerando que debe invertir constantemente en su negocio para mantenerlo funcionando, hace una nueva solicitud de más capital para poder comprar abono, herbicida e insecticidas, al tener estos materiales para cuidar los cultivos de granos básicos sus cosechas serán más abundantes.
texts.en:
José invested his previous loan in his cereal cultivation business. He is satisfied with the positive results that he has had. Thus, he has stuck with working and generating subsistence income for himself and his family. He says he is currently growing and not having problems developing his business.

Considering that he should constantly invest in his business to keep it functioning, he is making a new application for more capital to be able to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticides. His harvest will be more abundant upon having these materials to care for his cereal crops.
