loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide, as having the

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Rift Valley. Sarah and her husband are blessed with eight children.

Sarah has been a farmer for more than four years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the fluctuation of prices in the Kitale market, Sarah is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kitale.

Sarah is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Sarah seeks to continue growing a variety of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my eight children.”

loans.use: to expand her farm business by purchasing good quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Practicing mixed farming is what keeps Rose’s hopes alive, because her dream is to succeed, improve her economic situation, and be able to support her family. She considers working hard and perseverance to be the most important things in life. She works tirelessly for eight hours every day to earn her livelihood.

Rose is a small dairy, crop, and poultry farmer. She has a lovely family and has been doing crop farming for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cows. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and grow her banana business on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for bananas has grown steadily in Nkubu in recent years. As much as bananas have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand.

Rose is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial instalments of the loan, but in no time, the banana farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her banana business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith’s young age hasn't stopped her from fighting for her dreams. She is a happy mother because just a few years ago, the greatest joy arrived at her home, her infant child whom she loves and gives everything for.

Judith is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley. The adversity that has followed her hasn't kept her from wanting to get ahead and reach her goals. She achieves what she sets out to do.

Judith has been farming for the past seven years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, maize farming and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet.

Judith is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although Judith makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandi Hills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that she could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Judith, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Judith believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Judith to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

With your support, this woman will be able to make her dreams a reality. Get motivated and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereal for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Meet Janet, a rural smallholder farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. Janet is married to a fellow farmer and has seven children. Her family's main income source is milk from their dairy farm. However, they are involved in other agricultural activities such as growing maize, vegetables, fruits, and cereals.

The biggest problem being faced by farmers from Kitale is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers from Kitale like Janet now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Janet is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Catherine, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. For the past ten years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. She is able to get between 10-15 litres of milk a day from her dairy cows, and this helps her support her family.

Catherine also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit. Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Catherine believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Catherine’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Sophy, a young farmer from the Kwanza, Kitale area of Kenya, who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture.

Sophy is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and some varieties of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Sophy passionately loves farming. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hardwork and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Kwanza, Kitale, and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local markets. With your loan, Sophy will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals.

Sophy has been practicing agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds.

There is no doubt that through your loan that Sophy's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future. Lend to her today!

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Clara Isabel

texts.es: Clara es una microempresaria de 45 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos y vive en compañía de su cónyuge en una urbanización de Cartagena de Indias, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa y tiene un almacén misceláneo en su vivienda donde comercializa productos de aseo personal, de peluquería, accesorios y regalos para toda ocasión. Con esta actividad Clara ha logrado incrementar el ingreso familiar y dedicarse a lo que más le gusta, las confecciones, arte que aprendió desde joven.  En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar el surtido de la miscelánea; accesorios, esmaltes, papelería, ropa interior, productos de aseo y belleza y telas para las confecciones. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados en las profesiones que deseen.
texts.en:
Clara is a 45 year old micro-entrepreneur. She is the mother of four children and she lives with her spouse in a housing development in Cartagena de Indias. She works sewing clothing and she has a general goods store in her home where she sells personal use and hair products, accessories and gifts for all occasions. With this activity Clara has managed to increase the family income and work at what she likes the most, sewing an art she learned when she was young.

She is currently making a request for a loan from Kiva, an opportunity to access the financial world through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to improve her stock of general goods: accessories, nail polish, stationary, underwear, personal use and beauty products and fabric for sewing.

Her dream is to see her children graduate in the professions they want.

loans.use: to improve her stock of general goods: accessories, nail polish, stationary, underwear, personal use and beauty products and fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Bornes, a young farmer from Nandi Hills County in Kenya, who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Bornes is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some variety of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet. Bornes passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming because she wanted to meet the growing demand for farm produce. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination.

Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is the lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandi Hills and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals to be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. With your loan, Bornes will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. Bornes believes that her cereal-selling business will increase in leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through your loan, Bornes's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married mother of four who lives and farms in the Kitale area of Kenya. She makes good use of her one-acre farm to keep dairy and poultry animals, and grows maize and trees.

To improve her income, Gladys is a broker in the cereals trade. Her job is to arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to its buyers. With over ten years of experience in farming, Gladys is well-connected and well-equipped to make this brokerage business a success.

What Gladys needs is to secure a large stock of cereals, which will make the investment worthwhile. She is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy cereals and pay for more from local farmers.

This loan investment not only benefits Gladys and her family, but also local farmers. By buying their produce at competitive prices, Gladys enables the local farmers to focus on what they are good at, which is production rather than sales.

Be inspired, and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy more cereals so as to expand her brokerage in this commodity.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina’s story is of an honest, hardworking, warrior woman; a woman who left everything to raise her 7 children. With very few resources, she has pulled through. Paulina is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Lolduka village, who is involved in dairy and maize/corn farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. She gets help with the work from her family members. 

Paulina is seeking a loan to purchase quality farm inputs. Paulina will use the money from your loan investment to buy important supplies such as herbicides and pesticides to manage weeds and preserve the harvested produce. She also plans to use part of the money to pay laborers, loaders and transporters. 

Paulina is optimistic that this year's harvest will be better than last season's. Income from the dairy will be used to make initial loan repayments until the crops are harvested and sold.

Most microfinancers, particularly in the Nandihills area of Kenya, don’t give loans to smallholder farmers, but Juhudi Kilimo is different. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan smallholder farmers. 
Be inspired; make a loan!

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Alexandra Milena

texts.es:
Alexandra es una trabajadora incansable, una mujer que dedica 14 horas diarias a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, su perseverancia y empeño en su trabajo ha dado sus frutos pues cuenta con un completo surtido de estos productos y solo la falta de capacidad de almacenamiento ha sido el problema para seguir creciendo.
Ella es una mujer de 34 años de edad, casada, que actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual será destinado en la compra de congeladores para solucionar su problema de almacenamiento de productos.
Para ella este préstamo será el detonante de un crecimiento, por ello espera tu apoyo, quiere que seas participe del crecimiento de una empresaria que con sueños y trabajo humilde ha montado un completo negocio de venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a tireless worker, a woman who spends 14 hours per day at her business selling fruit and vegetables. Her perseverance and effort in her work have borne fruit as she has a full stock of these products. The lack of storage capacity has been the only problem to her continued growth.

She is a 34 year old married woman who is currently finds herself requesting a loan which will be used to buy freezers to solve her problem storing products.

For her this loan will be the spark for growth, so she hopes for your support. She wants you to be a participant in the growth of a businesswoman who with dreams and humble work has developed a complete business selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy freezers to solve her problem of storing her product.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Meet an amazing, honest and charming woman by the name of Florence. She is a small-holder farmer based in Kiminini village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Florence has been practicing livestock farming for seven years. She has raised two cows on the farm.

Florence is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred while gaining a profit. Florence is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard working and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards. Florence just needs a little help that she can get from you; a loan that may change her life.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of three from Nandihills, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Evaline is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart.

Evaline wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Nandihills area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Evaline will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Evaline is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal-selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Evaline awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер молодой талантливый мастер. Он ремонтирует автомашин. Алишер делает шпаклевку, грунтовку потом покрасит автомашин. Он работает один. Алишер 26 летный парень района Яван. Он не женат. Алишер живет вместе матерью и братом. Алишер 3 года назад научился у друга. Сейчас он имеет постоянную работу и источник доход. Алишер хочет приобрести инструменты для ремонта автомашин и путем это хочет расширить деятельность. Для купли инструменты у него нет денег, по этой причине Алишер запрашивает кредит. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему улучшить место работы и расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
Alisher is a young gifted mechanic. He repairs cars. He fills cracks, applies primer and then paints cars. He works by himself. Alisher is 26 years old and lives in the Yavan region. He is single and lives with his mother and brother. He learned this trade from a friend three years ago. Thanks to this work  he now has a constant source of income.

Alisher would like to buy auto repair tools in order to expand his business. He lacks the funds needed to buy tools, which is why he is applying for a loan. This loan will allow him to improve his shop and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for auto repair.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар 46 летный сильный и энергичный мужчина. Он на районе Носири Хусрав живет вместе женой и сыновьям. Сыновьям 27 и 1 лет. Жена занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Акбар на районе опытный и авторитетный дехканин. Его все знает. Он занимается животноводством и земледелием. Акбар настоящий дехканин. Он любить работать на земле и ухаживать за скотам. Акбар выращивает крупнорогатого скота около 3 лет. Акбар мечтал о расширения животноводческой деятельности, и иметь больше скота. Он планирует взять кредит и за счет кредита приобрести пару голов скота и расширить животноводческую деятельность. Акбар  ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Akbar is a strong and energetic 46-year-old man from the Nosiri Khusrav district of Tajikistan. He lives with his wife and his sons who are now 27 years old and 1 year old. His wife works in agriculture. Akbar is an experienced and trustworthy local farmer. Everyone knows him. He is involved in animal husbandry and crop farming. Akbar is a true farmer. He loves to work the land and to take care of his livestock. He has been raising cattle for about three years now.

Akbar's dream is to expand his animal husbandry activity and increase the size of his herd. He is taking this loan to buy a couple head of livestock and expand his animal husbandry activity. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand his animal husbandry activity.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place en Octobre 2015. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture en période hivernale.

Madame Aissatou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle  s’active dans l‘agriculture et le petit commerce.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs d’arachide, 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Les bénéfices serviront à aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et les soins médicaux des enfants
texts.en:
This group was created in October 2015. It is composed of women who are determined to improve their life conditions. They all live in the same village and help each other in a spirit of solidarity. Their mainly work as vendors and, in rainy season, as farmers. Ms. Aissatou (the one standing on the right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has two children. She does farming and works a a vendor. 

With this loan, Aissatou plans to buy two bags of peanuts and one 20-liter [21 quarts] bottle of refined oil to retail in her village. Her revenues will allow her to help her husband with everyday expenses and their children's healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy two bags of peanuts and one 20-liter bottle of refined oil for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se acerca nuevamente a Padecomsm para solicitar más capital, que utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas con los cuales desarrollara sus actividades agrícolas en el tiempo justo, pretende tener cosechas abundantes  de granos básicos y sin problemas de plagas, espera seguir progresando para cumplir con todas sus obligaciones.
Al utilizar créditos y administrarlos bien ha logrado que su negocio tenga mejores cosechas, con lo que sus ventas y ganancias han aumentado, actualmente su grupo familiar se mantiene igual y hasta la fecha no presentan problemas económicos ni de salud.
texts.en:
María comes to PADECOMSM to request another loan which she will use to purchase fertilizers. She will use them to accomplish her agricultural work in a timely manner. María hopes to have an abundant harvest of basic grains, without pest problems. She plans to continue making progress towards meeting all of her obligations.

By taking out loans and managing them well, she has succeeded in ensuring her business has better harvests with which her sales and earnings have increased. Currently, her family is the same, and to date they have not had any economic or health problems.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers with which she will accomplish her agricultural work in a timely manner.

loans.name: Luz Emiliana

texts.es:
Responsable, entregada a su trabajo y familia, una mujer sonriente que persevera para alcanzar sus metas, es la mejor manera de describir las cualidad de la señora Emiliana, una mujer de 53 años de edad la cual tiene un restaurante, es casada y tiene un hijo de 13 años que ama con todo su corazón.
Al acercarse la temporada de fin de año, la cliente siempre realiza adecuaciones a su negocio, no solo por sus clientes, sino pro recibir el año nuevo de la mejor manera, es algo que se ha convertido para ella en tradición y quiere continuar con ella.
Emiliana solicita un préstamo para la compra de pintura, también comprara insumos para la elaboración de almuerzos como; grano, fruta, verduras y por ultimo surtido de bebidas alcohólicas y refrescos.
texts.en:
Responsible, dedicated to her work and family, a smiling woman who perseveres to reach her goals -- this is the best way to describe the qualities of Señora Emiliana, a woman of 53 years of age who has a restaurant. She is married and has a 13-year-old son whom she loves with all her heart.

On approaching the end-of-the-year season, this client always makes adaptations in her business, not only for her customers but also to receive the new year in the best way. It is something that has become a tradition for her and that she wants to continue.

Emiliana is applying for a loan for the purchase of paint. She will also buy supplies for the preparation of lunches, such as grains, fruit, vegetables, and finally, a stock of alcoholic beverages and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make lunches, as well as alcoholic beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora de 53  años de edad es madre soltera y  vive con sus  hijas  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 11  años al negocio de venta de rosquillas y tortillas, sus clientes son personas de la zona y también amigos y conocidos de su comunidad.
Doña Isidora vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, cuajada, leña, aceite, etc. para poder seguir elaborando sus productos, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando  con Prisma.
Su sueño es que Dios le de muchos años más de vida y seguir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Isidora is 53 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her daughters in their own home. For 11 years she has devoted herself to her business selling rosquillas (Nicaraguan pastry treat) and tortillas. Her ciw años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus hijas en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 11 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas y tortillas, sus clientes son personas de la zona y también amigos y conocidos de su comunidad.
Doña Isidora vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, cuajada, leña, aceite, etc. para poder seguir elaborando sus productos, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es que Dios le de muchos años más de vida y seguir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, curds, firewood, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, es un hombre que se dedica a trabajar en la venta de pescado, camarones, conchas, etc., para tener mejores oportunidades de desarrollo en su hogar, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos, uno de ellos ya está estudiando, en cuanto a su negocio comenta que lo aprendió con ayuda de sus padres y otros parientes, el negocio lo tiene desde hace siete años, en sus inicios vendía en las orillas de la calle, posteriormente obtuvo un puesto fijo en el mercado municipal, el cual había sido remodelado.
El capital le será de ayuda para comprar pescado y camarones en diferentes tipos y tamaños, tiene  planeado tener en su inventario nueva mercadería para atender a sus clientes mucho mejor, aumentar  ventas  y ganancias para subsistir.
Tiene la fe de convertir su negocio en uno de los más reconocidos en su localidad, ofrecerles nuevos productos a sus clientes y darle a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
José is a man who works selling fish, shrimp, clams, etc., to have better opportunities for development at home. He lives with his life partner and two children, one of whom is in school. 

He states that he learned about his business from his parents and other relatives, and has had his business for the past seven years. In the beginning he sold on the sides of the street. Later, he obtained a fixed space in the town market, which has been remodeled.

The money from the loan will be helpful to buy fish and shrimp of different types and sizes. He has planned to have new merchandise in his inventory, to better serve his customers. He also wants to grow his sales and profits to survive. He has faith that his business will become one of the most well-known in his area, and that he will offer new products to his customers and give his family a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp of different types and sizes. He has planned to have new merchandise in his inventory, to better serve his customers.

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.ru: Нурзада успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто отозвался и помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Нурзады на сегодня есть корова, 20 овец и лошадь. Также есть земельный надел, 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает кукурузу, перец и клевер для реализации. Совокупная прибыль Нурзады составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS). Нурзада обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для работы на поле и по хозяйству. Доходы от кредита Нурзада будет вкладывать в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurzada successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who responded and helped her get this financing.  Nurzada now has one cow, 20 sheep and one horse on her farm.  She also grows corn, pepper, and clover for resale on one hectare of her own land.  She makes a total income of about 11,000 som (KGS).

Nurzada has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one horse to work in the fields on her farm.  She will use the earnings from her loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase one horse to work on her farm.

loans.name: Dúo La Chiripa Group

texts.es:
DUO LA CHIRIPA
Rubén de 22 de años de edad es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de discos de musica y video desde hace 2 años, Rubén solicita un crédito para comprar más productos en discos y así tener más variedad para sus clientes los cuales lo visitan muy seguido para comprar sus discos. El sueño de Rubén es tener un local donde pueda ofrecer videojuegos a sus clientes y así poder ampliar su negocio y ayudar al sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
DUO LA CHIRIPA

Rubén is 22 years old. For 2 years he has had a small business selling music and video discs.

Rubén is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and this way have greater variety for his customers, who frequent his business to buy his discs. Rubén's dream is to have a shop where he can offer video games to his customers and this way be able to expand his business and help support his family.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Andry Paola

texts.es:
Ella es Andry es una joven de tan solo 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con al cual tiene dos hijos de 2 y 3.
Ella acarrea una gran responsabilidad, mantener sus hijos y un hogar con una pareja joven es difícil.
La necesidad de generar recursos llevo a la joven a montar un negocio de confección directa, aprovechando los conocimientos que adquirió en la infancia.
Actualmente la joven busca impulsar su marca y más ahora que es temporada navideña, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una máquina fileteadora e insumos principalmente telas para sacar a relucir su estilo, imponer su marca y ganar clientes.
texts.en:
Andry is a young woman, only 21 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has two children, aged 2 and 3. She carries a great responsibility: caring for her children and home with a young couple is difficult.

The need to bring in income has led the young woman to start a sewing business, using knowledge that she acquired in childhood. The young woman hopes to promote her business, now that it is the holiday season. For that, she would like to apply for a loan for the purchase of a serger and supplies, chiefly fabrics, to bring out her style, promote her business, and earn customers.

loans.use: to buy a serger sewing machine and supplies, chiefly fabrics.

loans.name: Shemila

texts.en:
Shemila, 28, has been farming for the past six years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Simbi, Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Shemila could increase her profits by satisfying the demand. Shemila believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. Shemila also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Shemila to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children. Her dream is to build a modern house.
You can be part of the story of this beautiful family; a loan can change many of their lives.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Lessos in the Nandihills area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Ruth is happily married and the proud mother of two children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs and milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good-quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Ruth to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future. She patiently waits for your help.

loans.use: To buy farm implements.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, 56 years old, lives in the Simbi, Nandihills area of Kenya. She has eight children who are everything to her, the reasons she wants to succeed in life and to accomplish great things. Teresa has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Teresa is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. She has been able to earn a decent income from farming, and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business.

The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. There is no doubt that through your loan, Teresa's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future. You can help Teresa to accomplish all her dreams and to become a great cereal seller; a loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Monica, 74 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kiroge, a remote village in Chuka. She is happily married and has six children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 23 años es un joven emprendedor ya que desde muy temprana edad se dedica al cultivo de café en la comunidad de Copan, Honduras. Esta actividad le permite poder aportar a los gastos de la casa y además seguir estudiando, ya que  actualmente con mucho esfuerzo estudia a distancia para poder finalizar su carrera de Administración de Empresas  y en un futuro aspira a poder tener un negocio que le genere mayores ingresos. Pero debido a que en la comunidad donde vive  no cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica él está solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema Solar el cual le ayudara no solo en sus labores diarias si no también al momento de realizar sus tareas ya que tiene que hacerlo de noche debido a que la mayor parte del día se dedica a las actividades agrícolas.
texts.en:
Jorge is 23 years old and a young entrepreneur, being that he has been working as a coffee farmer in the community of Copan, Honduras since a very young age. This line of work has allowed Jorge to tend to his household expenses, as well as pursue his studies. His is currently, and with great effort, pursuing a degree in business administration via distance learning, and in the future he hopes to have a business that generates higher profits.

However, because in the community where he lives there are no electricity services, he is requesting a loan through Soluz Honduras to purchase a solar energy system. This will help him not only in his daily work, but also at the moment to complete his assignments. Jorge has to complete them at night because most of the day he is busy with his agricultural work.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system which will improve the quality of life in his home and help him in his agricultural work.

loans.name: Casty

texts.en:
Casty is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud smallholder woman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kigogo, Chuka, which is in the central region of Kenya. Casty is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps dairy cows and goats. Casty has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states "I have to do something for my two children."

Casty joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Casty is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Casty to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

For smallholder women in Kenya, accessing a financial solution is tough, but Casty feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women. The benefits of this loan are many and one of them is that Casty will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase.

Casty intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Casty will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future. You can help Casty with the loan she needs and get her closer to accomplishing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jochebed

texts.en:
Practicing mixed farming on her farm is what keeps Jochebed’s hopes alive since her dream is to succeed, improve her economic situation, and be able to support her family. She considers working hard and perseverance to be the most important things in life. She works tirelessly for eight hours every day to earn her livelihood.

Jochebed is a small dairy, crop and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She has a lovely family and has been doing crop farming for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cows. She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Nkubu in recent years.

Jochebed is very excited to start selling horticulture produce. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial instalments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scolastica, who is 38 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Scolastica makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Scolastica can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Scolastica’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to raise their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Scolastica a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is kind-hearted, well-organized, honest, industrious and entrepreneurial. Catherine is a mother who makes sure her five children never go to bed hungry. She hails from the Kiracha, Chuka area of Kenya. Catherine never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life.

Catherine has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and learned important farming techniques. Catherine practices dairy and mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education. Catherine believes that education is the only key to success.

She is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to buy seed and start horticulture farming on her farm. Catherine wants to take advantage of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Catherine to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Catherine hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Catherine's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Catherine is not a self-centered woman who only thinks of herself. She will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for on her horticulture farm and have an impact on society. Be part of this beautiful dream by helping Catherine with the loan she needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and  start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a wife, mother, and farmer with 10 years of experience in mixed farming. She lives in Mitheru, Chuka Kenya with her three children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Her family is her most important thing in her life, and the main reason to wake up every morning and work really hard. Mary completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors.

She passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say, “poultry is close to my heart.” Although this humble and ever-smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good-quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Mary has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity.

She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in Mary’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children. With your contribution, this mother will invest in a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
For 20 years, Albina has worked in agricultural production. This is a skill that she learned on her own and, little by little, has perfected her techniques and abilities in this field. She is a 58-year-old farmer from Kamuramba village, situated in the central province of Kenya. She lives with her family on a small piece of land where she keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops. For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, banana and produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs.

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm. This will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to educating her children. With your loan, Albina’s children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future. Help this smallholder farmer to fulfill her dreams and to improve her horticulture farming! A loan will certainly push her one step closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Rosalid

texts.en:
Five years ago, Rosalid started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of one child sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions.

Rosalid believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 51-year-old farmer. She is a mother who is hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. She is a smallholder farmer based in Nandihills, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Rift valley escarpment. Sarah and her husband are blessed with a lovely family.

Sarah has been a farmer for more than 10 years. She keeps poultry for eggs, cows for milk, and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses (grocery selling) on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Sarah is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Sarah is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Sarah seeks to continue growing a variety of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nandihills and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Joyce is happily married. Together with her husband, they are blessed with two children. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming. Because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek advice on the best farming practices. Joyce has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow.

Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture. In the recent past, milk prices have been going up, so Joyce, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy-processing firms.

She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Joyce hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. It is clear that this smallholder farmer is determined to reach her goal, and her request should be considered. Her positive attitude and desire to get ahead reveal the immense desire in this smallholder-farmer Kenyan mum to better herself and get a favorable response to her loan request.

loans.use: to buy another quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in a humble home in the town of Nandihills, along with her husband and their two children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. Agnes works with a great deal of determination, for many hours, on her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support. Agnes has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize.

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Agnes is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Agnes is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer.

Agnes dreams of a good life and being able to offer a good education to her children, because she wants to see them become professionals and successful people. You can help Agnes with a loan; support her and watch her do great things.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Five years ago Jane started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Njato, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this mother of two children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Chuka area. Jane has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market--the demand is very high.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Jane can achieve their dreams and goals. Jane believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Josyline

texts.en:
Josyline, at the age of 53, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own small farm that she began due to the need to generate income to support her family. In spite of all the obstacles, she had the strength and the determination to pick herself up and keep on going, and thanks to this she's been doing farming for the past 20 years. She works every day for 10 hours by herself.

Josyline is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. Your loan will help Josyline construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare feed rations and feed the cow. The shed will also ensure that the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment.

Your loan will bring untold benefits to Josyline. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life with fulfilled basic needs. Help her out!

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en:
Despite the importance of agriculture in Kenya and Africa as a whole, field partners and microfinances view lending to fund agriculture as risky. But this is not true for Juhudi Kilimo, a field partner that is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Elosy, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mom. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya. She loves and treasures her family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Elosy earns an income through selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income.

She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for the past 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble mom has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Chuka area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Elosy’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mom has been making great improvements in life, and she believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Elosy has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with her finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business.

Elosy is a visionary, and with her accumulated profits, hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

Be inspired--make a loan to support a Kenyan!

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a young farmer from Kwanza, a remote village in Nandihills, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. Julia is happily married and together with her husband they are blessed with four children. Her primary source of income is milk and she also plants maize on her farm.

Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge and that is high prices in fertilizers, seedlings and inputs. This is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro vet shop in her area. She is requesting a loan to start an agro vet shop. Kwanza area has only one agro dealer who is catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a big profit from farmers by charging them extra amounts since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys a monopoly.

Julia wants to change this and seize the business opportunity. Through your loan she will start an agro vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. Julia will also help the smallholder farmers in her area who for a long time have been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan Julia will change from the poor smallholder farmer she is right now to an agro dealer. Through increased income from the loan she will improve her living conditions. Her future plans are to purchase a truck which will help in buying farm inputs from wholesalers in bulk and transporting them to her shop. Julia believes that there is no doubt that youths like her can find rewarding employment in farming. You can be part of this dream. Go for it, make a loan.

loans.use: To start an agro vet shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Irene, a 38-year-old, youthful, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Chuka, in the central region of Kenya.

Irene passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets, but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living.

Irene has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture. In the recent past, the price of milk has been going up, so Irene, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow, but also manure; this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms.

Irene said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Irene hopes that through the accumulated profit, she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products.

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
As a mother of four lovely angels, Joyce’s great desire is to see her children grow to become professionals. It is what encourages Joyce and fills her with enthusiasm. Joyce has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize, has four dairy cows and keeps pigs. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns.

Joyce's biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Because of this challenge, Joyce formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. Joyce is seeking a loan to buy pigs and is planning to become a full-fledged pig farmer. Through the loan she will sell pork meat, which is in high demand in her remote area. With this loan, Joyce is going to grow into a very successful pig farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood. Joyce hopes to succeed, thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people that support smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 27-year-old farmer from a remote village in Chebomoo in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Joan passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Joan is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

In addition to profits, Joan will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Joan will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Juan Camilo es un joven de 20 años de edad que se dedica a prestar servicios de barbería, dedica a su trabajo 12 horas diarias, se esmera y se esfuerzas por triunfar y sostenerse en el tiempo.
El humilde sueño de este joven es ayudar a su madre, no piensa en lujos, en satisfacer sus deseos, solo quiere apoyar incondicionalmente esa mujer que le dio la vida.
Juan Camilo quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar un kit de barbería, el cual viene integrado por silla, tocador, espejo y lava-cabezas).
texts.en:
Juan Camilo is a young man of 20 years of age. He works as a barber for 12 hours daily. He takes great pains and makes an effort to succeed in life and support himself.

This young man's humble dream is to help his mother. He is not concerned with luxury or fulfilling his own wishes. He only wants to unconditionally help the woman who gave him life.

Juan Camilo is asking for a loan to buy a barbershop kit which includes a chair, vanity, mirror, and shampoo chair.

loans.use: to buy a barbershop kit, which includes a chair, vanity, mirror, and shampoo chair.

loans.name: Doren

texts.en:
Meet Doren, an ambitious woman who always seeks her horizon. Since she was little, she showed a strong passion for independent work, but when she became pregnant, she left behind many of her dreams to focus completely on taking care of her little ones.

Since her children are at a good age, she wants to take up her dreams again and create work to maintain herself, since she doesn't know when her husband might be lacking or when they would go through a very complicated situation. Her primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Doren's upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Doren has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Doren is quite a visionary and, with her accumulated profits, she hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Emily, 30 years of age and a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kajiana, a remote village in Chuka. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling goat milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en:
Fancy, 24 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kamobo, a remote village in Nandi Hills. She is happily married and is blessed with two children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. The Nandi Hills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a rural smallholder farmer in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He is married and has five children. He does dairy and horticultural farming. Farming he does to produce food, and the rest for income. He enjoys working for it is his means of securing the basic necessities of life for his family.

Michael is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest.

The impact this loan will have on his family is increased food security and improved livelihood. His future plan is to build a modern house.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Dorcas started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble single mother of one child sells dairy cow milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions.

Dorcas believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Dorcas' only purpose is to get ahead, not to depend on anyone, support her family unconditionally and for them not to suffer hardships and to progress each day.

You can be part of the story of this beautiful single mum; a loan can change her life.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty and the will to get ahead and to secure the future of her five children are some of the reasons that made Mildred start practicing mixed farming. Mildred is a youthful, 27-year-old farmer from Kwanza, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya where people live in shanties. According to residents, the people of Kwanza are forgotten or ignored by the county government of Nandi Hills. But within the remote village of Kwanza, Mildred is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most smallholder farmers view Mildred as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her five children as a primary caregiver.

Mildred started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his five acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize and beans. She takes so much pride in being independent, self-reliant and being involved in a sector that feeds the population of Kenya.

Mildred is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Mildred will have more space to expand her business output. The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her five children who are in public schools. She feels blessed to have the support of her husband, through all her undertakings.

Make a $25 loan, and push Mildred's dream closer to reality. Mildred can buy more land and succeed with your help!

loans.use: To purchase more land for farming.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, along with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married, has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her six children, she has been selling eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland.

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is an experienced 48-year-old woman. She is based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the north rift of Kenya. Petronila and her husband have been blessed with a lovely family.

For 10 years, Petronila has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening.

Petronila, however, is taking this a little step further. Petronila is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. In the long run, with the increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Danaya-Ton Group

texts.fr:
SEYDOU est un malien âgé de 40 ans non scolarisé, c’est lui qui a la corde du bœuf à la main sur la photo.
Il est marié père de 04 enfants, 2 garçons et 2 filles. Les enfants sont âgés de 2 à 9 ans et ne fréquentent pas l’école. 
Sa femme est ménagère,SEYDOU fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité, il fait l’embouche des bovins.Très courageux il mène cette activité depuis très longtemps et rembourse tous les crédits qu'il empruntent au RMCR cette activité lui plait car il trouve beaucoup de bénéfice en moyenne 25 000 fca par mois. 
Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés environnants et revend dans le marché  de la commune ,le profit lui permettra de faire face aux charges de sa famille. 
Dans l’avenir, il veut avoir un prêt plus élevé pour pouvoir augmenter le volume de son activité.
texts.en:
Seydou is forty years old, from Mali and father to four children, two boys and two girls. The children are between two and nine years old and none of them attends school. His wife looks after their home. Seydou didn't have the opportunity to attend school. He is seen holding the cow in the photo.

Seydou works with the field partner, RMCR, to improve his business of rearing and fattening up cattle. He is a courageous man and has been successfully running his business for a very long time. He earns an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA a month. All his previous loans with RMCR have been repaid on time.

Seydou buys his livestock from local markets and resells them at his Commune's market. His profits allow him to provide for the needs of his family. In the future, he would like to take a larger loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to rear and fatten up.

loans.name: Songtaaba Karim Group

texts.fr:
Mr  KARIM est le  responsable du groupe SONGTAABA KARIM.  Il  est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07 ans et le moins âgé a 04  ans.  01 enfant  va  à l’école et il a 02  personnes en charges.
Mr  fait du maraîchage  depuis 05 ans et l'agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 07 sacs d’engrais  et 05 boîtes d’herbicides.
