Dorcas is requesting a loan to purchase high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Dorcas is very visionary, and her goal for this season is to boost her crop production. She believes that, with her loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Dorcas's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín requiere de un nuevo crédito para continuar teniendo a su alcance los materiales necesarios para trabajar y salir adelante con su familia, invertirá en abono para cuidar mejor del cultivo de maíz y frijol, pues así su cosecha será abundante, con el resto comprara hilos de colores para elaborar hamacas, matates, entre otros trabajos de jarcia.
El efecto que ha tenido en su negocio después de utilizar el crédito anterior ha sido positivo, pues sus ingresos son un poco mejor gracias a que ha elaborado artículos de jarcia en mayor cantidad y con mucha calidad, en cuanto a sus cultivos la cosecha no fue la esperada debido a la sequía que afecto más que todo al oriente del país, pero a pesar de ello sus expectativas son que está nueva cosechas que espera sean mejores, ya que se tiene mayor presencia de lluvia.
texts.en:
Efraín needs a new loan to continue having the needed materials on hand in order to work and to get his family ahead. He will invest in fertilizer to better care for his corn and bean crops. This way his harvest will be abundant. With the rest he will buy colored thread to make hammocks and canvas bags, among other works with fiber.

The effect from using the previous loan has been positive. His earnings are a little better thanks to having made fiber items in greater quantity and with a lot of quality. The harvest of the crops was not what he hoped for due to the drought that mostly affected the eastern part of the country. In spite of this, his expectations are that these new crops he is waiting for will be better because there is more rain.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to better care for his corn and bean crops so that the harvest will be abundant.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор очень благодарно за Вашу искреннюю поддержку. Она параллельно начала заниматься земледелием. Гулбахор хорошо научилась заниматься земледелием, она параллельно выращивает скота.  Гулбахор выращивает растение во дворе. Свободное время Гулбахор занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. Ей на работе помогает невестка. Гулбахор много трудится, чтобы обеспечить семью и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она хочет купить минеральные удобрения, чтобы обработать землю для посева урожая. Минеральные удобрения помогает получить качественный урожай, по этой причине Гулбахор обратилась за кредитом. Ей нужно больше количество минеральных удобрений и семена урожай. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей зарабатывать больше и обеспечить семью. Гулбахор очень важен это кредит.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is very thankful for your sincere support. She has begun working in agriculture as well. She has learned well how to grow crops while at the same time she raises livestock. She is growing crops on her property. In her free time she sews women's clothing from her home with the help of her daughter-in-law. She works very hard to take care of her family and improve their living conditions.

Gulbahor wants to buy mineral fertilizer so she can fertilize the soil before planting her next crops. The fertilizer will help improve the quality of the crops and for this reason she is looking for a loan. She needs more fertilizer and seeds. The loan amount will help her to earn more money and take care of her family. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds to plant

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Rose, a 37-year-old hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Lunyu, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and has four children. Rose has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained much experience. To provide a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. Like many farmers from her region, Rose finds poultry farming very enjoyable and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest business challenge is meeting demand, which is really high. Rose lacks funds to increase her poultry farm.

Rose is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy poultry. Her loan will help her to sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and the local market. This will translate into increased profit and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, Rose intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. She will use the profit from her loan to repay her loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her four school-going children. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Christine started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of one child sells maize, cow milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. Christine is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions.

Christine is requesting a loan to build a good dairy unit. She believes that her loan will help improve her living conditions because she will be able to increase her milk production and save money on treating her cows. Christine’s only purpose is to get ahead and to not to depend on anyone and support her family unconditionally. She does not want her family to suffer hardships and hopes they progress each day. You can help Christine with the loan she needs and get her closer to accomplishing her dreams.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Dúo Esmeralda De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es: Dúo Esmeralda de Santo Tomas Este dúo está formado por doña Edna Rosaura ella tiene 50 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos en su comedor ubicado en su domicilio, y de la misma manera venta de churrascos, chuchitos, atol de plátano, panes con pollo los martes, jueves, y domingos en el parque de Santo Tomas Milpas Altas desde ya hace varios años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de carnes, platos y vasos desechables, verduras, frutas, abarrotes para preparar sus alimentos, su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo su negocio, y seguir sacando a su familia adelante sobre todo en la educación.
texts.en:
Edna Rosaura, age 50, is a member of the Dúo Esmeralda de Santo Tomas. She sells breakfasts and lunches at her eatery, which is located at her home. She also sells steaks, tamales, 'atol de platano' [ drink made with ripe plantain], and bread with chicken. For several years she has been selling these on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays at the Santo Tomas Milpas Altas park.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, plates, disposable cups, vegetables, fruit, and groceries in order to prepare her food. Her biggest wish is to continue growing her business and to continue getting her family ahead, most of all in their education.

loans.use: to buy food products to make refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
People who live in Kieni, Chuka area, struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Frida who is 28 years old and the mother of two adorable lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Frida’s primary source of income is selling milk, eggs, crops, and running some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Frida’s hobby is milking. She sells milk to her neighbors and the local market but she cannot meet the overwhelming demand. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, Frida will also benefit from free training and links to markets.  

Frida is requesting a loan to buy an extra dairy cow. The cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 10-15 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Frida is very ambitious and she will use the profits of her loan to repay her loan and expand her business enterprise. In the near future she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. Be part of this beautiful dream by helping Frida with the loan she needs which will also keep her big smile.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 31-year-old dark skinned smallholder mixed-farmer from Kapsowar, Kenya. She has three children. She has been selling milk, eggs and food crops from her farm for 5 years. These primary income sources have sustained her and her family for all this time. However, the income is not enough to fulfill her family’s basic needs. This has forced her to venture into other numerous side businesses.

There is no denying that Emmy loves what she is doing. She names all the animals on her farm. She spends her free time planting and weeding vegetables. Her passion enables her to overcome her biggest challenge, which is marketing her products.

Emmy is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. She is planning to use these farm inputs, which include cereals, to prepare for the coming season. Farming costs are increasingly becoming expensive for small scale farmers who rely on the income they generate from their previous harvest. When farmers experience a loss or small profits from their harvest, they become incapable of footing farming costs for the next season.

Your loan will help Emmy to purchase necessary inputs. By supporting her economic activity, you are empowering her.

Emmy plans to continue farming in order to make money for her children's welfare and education. She said, "This loan will help me boost my cereals business."

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Lizzy, a 25-year-old mother who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking mum on this planet Earth. Lizzy is a mother of one lovely child who she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that she never goes to bed with a hungry stomach.

Lizzy hails from the Kobos, Kitale area of Kenya. Lizzy never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Lizzy started farming and has been farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Lizzy practices mixed farming on her farm. Through her profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her child a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”. Lizzy is a mum who is very enterprising.

She is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Lizzy wants to take advantage of these and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring mums, like Lizzy, to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing.

Lizzy hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Lizzy’s dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her child of a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Lizzy is not a selfish mum and also wants to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Rasoarimalala

texts.fr:
Rasoarimalala a 51 ans, elle est mariée, le mari est un agriculteur. Le couple a une fille unique de 14 ans en classe de seconde. Le couple est propriétaire du local où il habite.
Elle a créé le magasin général en 1989, elle vend des produits de première nécessité, des amuses gueules et des friandises pour les revendre et les livrer dans les grandes surfaces. Ses parents qui l’ont formée travaillaient dans une société produisant des caca-pigeons et des chips. Les produits sont très prisés par les clients en raison de leur qualité et du respect de l’hygiène. Les prêts antérieurs (six prêts ) ont été investis dans l’activité. 
Elle exploite également une activité de traiteur. La réalisation d’une  telle activité nécessite des efforts physiques, elle souhaite aussi transmettre ses expériences à sa fille car c’est une activité rentable,  le marché étant sûr.
texts.en:
Rasoarimalala is 51 years old and married to a farmer. This couple have one daughter who is 14 years old and is currently attending school. They own the premises of their shop, which is where they also live.

She started this general store in 1989. She sells household essentials, snacks and sweets to customers all over town. Her parents used to work for a company which made "caca-pigeons", a kind of crispy fried snack, and potato chips. These items are highly sought-after due to their quality, as well as Rasoarimalala's high standards of hygiene. Her previous six loans have been invested into her business.

She also works as a caterer. This activity requires a lot of physical strength. She would also like to pass down her experience to her daughter because this business is profitable and it is always in demand.

loans.use: to purchase household essentials, dried vegetables and hygiene products.

loans.name: Voahangy Nirina

texts.fr:
Voahangy Nirina a 47 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple a trois enfants (24-22-19 ans), les deux premiers travaillent comme maçon et aide chauffeur. La fille de 19 ans vient de réussir son baccalauréat, et a poursuivi ses études dans le domaine paramédical  mais elle a arrêté ses études faute de moyens financiers. 
Avant elle vendait de la viande à partir d’un fonds octroyé par sa belle-mère, l’activité a été abandonnée  car sa belle mère est allée vivre à la campagne. Après cette première activité, elle vendait des gouters aux étudiants. De 2008 à ce jour, elle gère une activité de gargote car elle dispose des expériences dans le domaine et l’activité n’exige pas de déplacements car le lieu d’exploitation et de vente se situe à son domicile. Son mari l’aide dans son activité et il pratique la maçonnerie quand l’occasion se présente. Le couple vit dans une maison louée lugubre ne répondant pas aux normes sanitaires.
texts.en:
Voahangy Nirina is 47 years old and is married. The couple have three children (aged 24, 22, and 19). The two eldest work as masons and assistant drivers. The 19-year-old daughter has just received her bachelor's degree was continuing her studies as a paramedic until she had to stop because of a lack of financial resources.

Previously, Voahangy Nirina sold meat using funds received from her mother-in-law, but the business was abandoned when her mother-in-law went to live in the country. After this first business, Voahangy Nirina started selling snacks to students. Since 2008, she has been running a canteen, because she has experience in this area and the business does not require travel as it is located in her home.

Her husband supports her with her business and does masonry work when the opportunity presents itself. The couple live in a dismal rental house which does not meet health standards.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, pastas, flour, vegetables, and coal.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Sheila, a 28-year-old mother of four children, who resides in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is very humble and a go-getter. Sheila has been practising farming for the last 3 years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming.

Sheila enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. Having the traits of a go-getter, Sheila has always dreamed big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES to start the shop and make her dream come true.

With your loan, Sheila will be able to improve her income level and to comfortably take care of her family. Sheila’s projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Saholy

texts.fr:
Saholy a 39 ans, elle est mariée. Le conjoint travaille comme contrôleur aide intérim, le salaire est insuffisant pour couvrir les dépenses familiales. Le couple a 3 enfants (15-9-3 ans) dont tous scolarisés dans une école privée et la famille vit dans leur propre maison. 
Elle vendait des fruits depuis 1999 : achat et revente. Suite aux conseils d’un ami , elle a décidé de créer l’unité de mûrisserie de bananes. Au début, la quantité de bananes vertes achetée était encore limitée en raison du fonds disponible, en outre, le nombre de clients était encore réduit. Mais actuellement, devant l’augmentation du nombre de clients, l’augmentation de la quantité de bananes vertes à acheter s’impose dans l’objectif de satisfaire les besoins des clients d’où cette demande de fonds à l’approvisionnement. En outre, l’unité emploie 3 personnes. Presque tous les revendeurs de bananes mûres dans son quartier s’approvisionnent auprès d'elle.
L’objectif de Saholy est l’extension du marché du produit, le but étant la réussite des enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Saholy is 39 years old and married. Her spouse works as an interim assistant controller, and his salary is not enough to cover the family expenses. The couple have 3 children (aged 15, 9, and 3), all of whom attend a private school, and the family lives in its own house.

Saholy has been buying and selling fruit since 1999. Following the advice of a friend, she decided to build a banana-ripening facility. At the beginning, the amount of bananas she bought was limited due to the amount of available resources, and the number of customers she had was also small. But now, facing an increase in customer numbers, she needs to increase the number of bananas she buys in order to satisfy her customers' needs, which is why she is requesting these funds for procurement purposes. Her business also employs 3 people. Nearly all of the ripe banana resellers in her district get their supplies from her.

loans.use: to buy tonnes of green bananas.

loans.name: Gervais

texts.fr:
Gervais a 35 ans. Elle vit en concubinage avec un bijoutier. La fille unique de 14 ans est en classe de seconde. Elle vit dans une maison louée. C’est une femme qui aime étudier toutes les opportunités de création d’une activité génératrice de revenus sans négliger le développement de sa première activité ( vente de friperies)  , principale source de revenus.
La vente des produits de friperie a été créée en 2006. Elle s’adonne également à la livraison des produits artisanaux. L’emploi salarié ne lui convient pas, elle a choisi cette activité car elle a une facilité de communication qui est l’un de ses atouts dans le secteur. Les prêts antérieurs ont servi à développer l’activité et diversifier les produits.
texts.en:
Gervais is 35 years old. She cohabits with a jeweller. Their only child, a 14-year-old girl, is in high school. Gervais lives in a rental home. She is a woman who likes to consider new opportunities for business without neglecting the development of her first business (second-hand clothing sales), which is her principal source of income.

Her second-hand clothing business was created in 2006. She also delivers artisanal products. Working for others does not suit her, and she has chosen this business because she is very good at communicating, which is an advantage in her line of work. Her previous loans have been used to develop her business and diversify her product range.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand shirts, belts, hats, sneakers, and sandals.

loans.name: Yosimar

texts.es:
Yosimar pertenece al banco “SILKINCHANY”, el   trabaja en una taller mecánico, donde realiza planchados de carros y estructuras metálicas.
El socio es una persona luchadora y desea tener un taller propio donde pueda laborar mejor.
Yosimar tiene 20 años  y  solicito el crédito para el mantenimiento de sus maquinas y herramientas de trabajo, ya que para su trabajo es necesario tener todos los implementos en buenas condiciones.
El socio está agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en él y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas del crédito puntualmente.
texts.en:
Yosimar belongs to the “SILKINCHANY” communal bank. He works in a mechanic's workshop, where he presses cars and metal structures. He is a hardworking person and wants to have his own workshop where he can do better work.

Yosimar is 20 years old and is asking for the loan to do maintenance on his machines and work tools, since it is necessary to have all the implements in good condition for his work. He is grateful to the KIVA investors for trusting in him and he promises to make his loan payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his machines and work tools

loans.name: Alvaro Alexander

texts.es:
Álvaro vive con su compañera de vida y una pequeña hija de tres años de edad, su pareja es empleada de un colegio y él por su parte se dedica a vender calzado, la idea de tener su propio negocio surgió al ver que su primo se estaba superándo, la zapatería la fundo hace 4 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado, con un horario de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, es así como puede reducir las necesidades familiares.
Se decidió por trabajar con créditos para comprar sandalias, chancletas, zapatos, agujetas de repuesto y pastas para lustrar calzado, la inversión le será de ayuda para tener un inventario surtido durante la época de fin de año, el objetivo de Álvaro es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener la ayuda de Padecomsm para crecer con su negocio y que sea reconocido a nivel departamental, pero lo más importante es apoyar lo más que pueda a su familia para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Álvaro lives with his partner and three-year-old daughter. His partner works in a school and he sells shoes. After seeing his cousin succeed, he decided to set up his own business, and opened his shoe store four years ago. He works Monday to Saturday from 7am to 5pm and manages to provide the basics for his family.

He is requesting a loan to be able to expand his stock for the end-of-year holiday celebrations, and will use the funds to buy sandals, slippers, shoes, shoelaces and shoe polish. He is eager to be able to meet his customers' needs.

His dream is to be able to grow his business with the help of Padecomsm (a Kiva field partner), and that it his shop will become well known throughout the region. Most importantly, he wants to be able to support his family and ensure a better quality of life for them.

loans.use: to expand his stock by purchasing sandals, slippers, shoes, shoelaces, and shoe polishes.

loans.name: Rafael Enrique

texts.es: Rafael es un chef profesional que laboró por años en la armada nacional de Colombia y decidió emprender su propio negocio en el año 2013.  Él ofrece servicio a domicilio para empresas y particulares con  una variada carta de comidas, aunque la mayoría de sus pedidos son de comidas típicas de la región, también elabora comidas internacionales. Habitualmente despacha desayunos y comida corriente que le garantizan un ingreso seguro. En la actualidad se encuentra separado de su compañera sentimental y sus proyectos están encaminados a tener un restaurante bien organizado. Rafael necesita un capital para comprar víveres al por mayor; arroz, aceite, carnes, verduras y hortalizas, así logrará disminuir sus costos, por ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Con esta inversión trabajará más cómodo y con utilidades más significativas.
texts.en:
Rafael is a professional chef who worked for years in the national army of Colombia and decided to start his own business in 2013. He offers delivery service for companies and individuals with a varied menu of food. Although the majority of his orders are typical dishes of the region, he also makes international food. He usually sends breakfasts and staple food that guarantees himself secure income. Currently, he is separated from his girlfriend and his projects are designed to have a well organized restaurant.

Rafael needs capital to buy supplies at wholesale: rice, oil, meat and vegetables. In this way, he will diminish his costs so he made an application for a loan, a credikiva, an opportunity to be linked to financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this investment, he will work more comfortably and with more significant profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale: rice, oil, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Yuranis Bianeth

texts.es:
Yuranis es una empresaria de 33 años de edad la cual se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar activos y utensilios destinados únicamente a su actividad de preparación de alimentos (arequipe que en pocas palabras es un dulce de leche).
Ella inicio su negocio por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, aprendió a realizar este producto gracias a que asistió a unas clases.
Ahora con su negocio ve una fuerte oportunidad de progreso y de mejorar las condiciones de vivienda para ella, su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad.
El préstamo será usado para la compra de un horno grande, una mesa, utensilios y capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yuranis, aged 33, is requesting a loan to buy materials for her business, which is making arequipe (caramelized milk and sugar, also known as 'dulce de leche').

She decided to start her business because she enjoys what she does, and prefers to work independently. She learned how to make arequipe by going to classes.

She sees a good opportunity to develop her business and improve living conditions for herself, her husband and her two children, aged 6 and 4.

The loan will be used to buy a large oven, a table, kitchen utensils and to provide working capital for the business.

loans.use: to buy a large oven, a table, utensils and provide working capital for her arequipe (caramelized milk and sugar) business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar along with her husband and their seven children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. Rose works for many hours on her farm with a great deal of determination to bring decent food to her home and to support her family. Rose has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize. She also has a side hustle business (shop).

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Rose said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products!" Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Rose is seeking a new loan to buy a chaff cutter, which is a mechanical device used by farmers to cut hay into smaller pieces for easy digestion by cows. With this loan, Rose is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer.

Rose dreams of a good life and being able to offer a good education for her children, because she wants to see them become professionals and successful people. You can help Rose with a loan that will support her and help her to do great things.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a mother dedicated to her work. At age 46, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, tirelessly working on her mixed farm.

Violet is one of the most hard-working and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Kwanza, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is happily married to Anthony, who provides additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four lovely children.

For the past ten years, Violet has been engaged in mixed farming and, through selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops, she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Violet makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Violet comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this 'precious commodity.' Violet faces the challenge carrying water on her back because of her failing health.

Violet is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture, but Violet wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan, she intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river, directly to her farm.

With your loan, Violet will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Violet is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Violet’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place en Octobre 2015. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aminata (debout à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est   mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la cafeteria. Elle achète en gros ses produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la préparation de son petit déjeuné.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 tablette d’œuf, 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné, 01sac de 50 kg de sucre et d’autres condiments pour la préparation de son petit déjeune.

Les bénéfices sont destinés à la prise en charge de sa famille (habillements, soins médicaux habillement etc.…)
texts.en:
This group was created in October 2015 and is made of women who are determined to change their living conditions. They all live in the same village and have a solid, united and mutually supportive relationship with one another. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Aminata (who is standing on the right of the photo with a hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother to seven children. She has a cafeteria business. She buys her wholesale products from the weekly markets in order to prepare her breakfasts. With this loan she is planning to buy one tray of eggs, one 20-liter bottle of refined opil, one 50-kilo sack of sugar and other condiments for preparing her breakfasts. The profits she makes are used to take care of her family (clothing, healthcare, etc.).

loans.use: to buy a tray of eggs, one 20-liter bottle of refined oil, one 50-kilo sack of sugar and other condiments for the preparation of her breakfasts.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Florence, a 39-year-old farmer from Giitho village in Central Kenya. She is married with three children. She started farming five years ago on a 3-acre plot she acquired. On the farm, she has two dairy cows and a small garden equipped with an irrigation kit.

Florence is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to pay for farm inputs and to hire labor to grow more crops on the farm.

It takes a lot for a small-holder farmer to risk limited resources to expand a farm business. With your help, Florence will be able to cover the high cost of farm inputs necessary for expansion.

A significant portion of the profit will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth as she sets a good foundation for her future responsibilities as the head of the family.

loans.use: to grow more crops on her farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, age 31, is hopeful that she can change her future and that of her family. She resides in Kitale, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 10 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming.

Jane enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Jane has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Jane will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

You can help this strong-willed woman to do great things in her farming business and her life. A loan can do a lot for her.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The dream of getting out of poverty is the reason behind Mary starting to practice mixed farming. Mary is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past ten years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents.

She is based in Alakara, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy and maize farming. The region's staple food is “Ugali”, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from maize.

Mary’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for ten years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Kitale area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income. Mary’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Mary has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Mary is quite visionary, and with her accumulated profits, hopes that she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

You can help Mary to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Meet Miriam a young farmer from Nkubu in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about farming. Miriam is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and also she keeps dairy goats.

Miriam passionately loves farming. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes a profit, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business.

The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal to sell. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nkubu and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market.

Miriam has been practicing agriculture by employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training. There is no doubt that through your loan Miriam’s life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 30 years old and never attended a higher learning institution, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and is blessed with six children.

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, farmers from their village seek technical advice from her on the best dairy farming techniques.

Margaret is the breadwinner of her family and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Although she makes a profit from farming, she has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals to sell.

Kenya's Kapsowar area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Margaret, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Margaret believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will bring about a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Margaret to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Esnas

texts.en:
Esnas is a tireless worker who works seven days a week, 12 hours per day. She wants to achieve her dream of giving her children a good education. Esnas is a very industrious, honest and hard-working woman from the Kitale area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Elgon.

Esnas has been farming for the past five years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet.

Esnas is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow the fields. Although she makes a profit from farming, she has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereal. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereal to sell .

Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Esnas could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Esnas, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Esnas believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereal. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Esnas to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Like Esnas, many entrepreneurs are waiting for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Meet Leah, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mom. She hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. She loves and treasures her family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Leah earns an income through selling milk, crop farming and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income.

She is a very determined and dedicated farmer, who has been farming for the past two years, and she has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble mom has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". She faces financial challenges, and because the Kitale area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Leah’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mom has been making great improvements in life, and she believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Leah has received training, and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with her finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business.

Leah is a visionary, and with her accumulated profits, hopes that she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

The difficult circumstances that have befallen this woman, as well as her push to overcome them, make her deserving of the help she is requesting. Be inspired; make a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar, along with her husband. She is a rural farmer from an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Josphine works with a great deal of determination for many hours on her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support. Josephine has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry.

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Josphine said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge, however, is inadequate funds.

Because of this challenge, Josphine formed a group and is seeking a new loan to buy a dairy cow and increase her milk vending business. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Josphine is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer.

Help out this humble smallholder farmer with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and increase her milk vending business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
When smallholder farmers come together they are powerful. This idea led Rose to join the Mkulima self-help group. For the past year, Rose has been actively involved in mixed farming. Muthegene, Nkubu is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and a market.

Rose has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is the lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming.

Through the Mkulima self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure loans, Rose joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan, Rose intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes.

The proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport her produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Rose's living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis (a dark-skinned lady) is a 56-year-old smallholder farmer from a small, rural town in Kitale, Kenya. She is married and has seven children. Her husband runs a small personal business, and she does dairy and crop farming to produce food and generate a bit of income for her family.

Philis is seeking a loan to buy important farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, and pesticides. With your loan, she will have enough supplies for the coming crop season. Certified-quality seeds and fertilizers will reduce the odds of crop failure due to diseases and climatic conditions, just as quality herbicides and pesticides will reduce destruction of crops and produce due to weeds and pests.

Income generated from this business will help grow her business and settle household expenses. Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Philis!

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith  pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” , ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, su sueño de la socia es salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos, ella trabaja para una institución pública , su trabajo es sacrificado y pesado , además ella también se dedica a su ferretería. 
Edith solicito el préstamo para comprar clavos y alambres, para incrementar sus productos en su ferretería.
 La socia está contenta y complacida con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
The member Edith belonga to the “SILKINCHANY” communal bank. She is a very responsible and hard-working person. She is 37 years old and has two children. Her dream is to get ahead and have a higher quality of living for her children. She works in a public institution. Her work is demanding and heavy. She also works in her hardware business.

Edith is requesting the loan to buy nails and wire to increase her hardware products.

The member is happy and satisfied with the loan as she will be able to continue to progress. She promises to comply with her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy nails and wire.

loans.name: Preselina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inharrime província de Inhambane tem 43 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 2 são maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2014, este e o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku com qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos como: feijão e amendoim apara satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes. 
Futuramente pretende reabilitar a sua residência e adquirir um mini bus para transporte de passageiro como forma de  reforçar os seus negócios. O seu maior desafio e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos ate ao nível superior.
texts.en:
She was born in Inharrime, Inhambane province. She is 43 years old, and a single mother of four children. Two of them are adults, and all go to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She started to work iwth Hluvuku in 2014. This is her second loan from Hluvuku. She is planning to use it to expand her business by buying products such as beans and peanuts to fulfill her customers' needs.

In the future, she plans to remodel her house and buy a mini bus to transport passengers and strengthen her business. Her biggest challenge is to guarantee her children's education up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy beans and peanuts to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra, adquirir uma viatura e casar-se oficialmente.
texts.en:
He was born in Inhambane. He is 36 years old, and the father of two underage children, who go to school. He lives in a common-law marriage, and is not responsible for anyone else.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2012. This is his fourth loan from Hluvuku, and he is planning to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, metal sheets, and other materiales to continue building his house.

In the future, he is planning to finish the construction works, buy a vehicle, and get officially married.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, metal sheets, and other materials to continue building his house.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una ama de casa responsable, entregada a su familia, por conflictos con su pareja se separó de esta, quedando como como cabeza de familia.
Ella inicio un negocio pro necesidad económica de venta y cría de carneros, quería innovar en la zona, donde es muy común la venta de aves y cerdos.
Dicha actividad la aprendió de sus padres, gracias a este negocio ha podido solventar sus necesidades económicas, ahora trabaja por pagar la educación de sus hijos y en un futuro comprar una vivienda, quiere ser independiente, vivir con sus hijos, plantar cultivos y seguir con sus actividades.
Con el ánimo de incrementar sus ventas la señora Diana solicita un préstamo para la compra de carneros, espera lograr mejorar sus ventas para el fin de año con el objetivo de gozar junto a su familia de una feliz navidad.
texts.en:
Diana is a responsible housewife, dedicated to her family. Because of conflicts with her partner she separated from him and she is left as the head of the family.

She started a business out of economic necessity buying and selling sheep. She wanted to be innovative as in the area the sales of chickens and pigs are very common.

She learned this activity from her parents and thanks to this business she can pay for her economic necessities. Now she is working to pay for her children's education and in the future to buy a house. She wants to be independent, live with her children, plant crops and continue with her business.

With the intention of increasing her sales Diana is requesting a loan to buy sheep. She hopes to manage to increase her sales for the end of the year with the goal of having a Merry Christmas alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep; Diana hopes to increase sales for the end of year season in order to enjoy a happy Christmas with her family.

loans.name: Alex

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo, tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu sobrinho que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende construir outras residências, iniciar uma criação seja ela bovino, suíno ou caprino, abrir uma machamba e adquirir uma viatura para facilitar os seus negócios.
texts.en:
He was born in Maputo. He is 38 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He is the father of an underage son. He is responsible for his nephew, who lives with him.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2012. This is his second loan from Hluvuku, and he is planning to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and metal sheets to continue building his house.

In the future, he plans to build more houses, start raising cows, pigs, or goats, start growing vegetables, and buy a vehicle to support his businesses.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and metal sheets to continue building his house.

loans.name: Loforte

texts.pt:
O sr Loforte tem 34 anos de idade,trabalha numa empresa como motorista é  solteiro e pai de dois filhos que frequentam o ensino primário. Para além de sustentar os seus filhos, sustenta ainda dois irmãos e a sua mãe.
Com o valor de empréstimo pretende comprar sacos de cimento, aros, varoes para dar continuidade a construçao da sua casa, pois, ainda vive em casa dos pais.
Ele sonha em concluir a sua casa e sair da casa dos seus pais, todavia, enfrenta dificuldades financeiras para concretizar o seu sonho e o desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Loforte, 34, works for as a driver for a company. He is single, and the father of two children who go to primary school. Besides maintaining his two children, he also maintains two brothers and his mother.

With the requested amount, he is planning to buy bags of cement, ferrules, and beams to continue building his house; he is still living with his parents.

He dreams of finishing building his own house and leave his parents'. He still faces financial difficulties to realize his dream, and his challenge is to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, ferrules, and beams to continue building his house.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es: Johana tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hijo Elián de 6 meses de edad, hace dos años se dedica a la crianza de pollos, gallos y gallinas este pequeño negocio le ha permitido alimentar y pagar el lugar donde viven con su hijo. Johana necesita el dinero para poder construir un galpón para pollos evitando que se pierdan en el campo, incrementando sus ingresos para poder seguir pagando los gastos básicos de ella y su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: Johana is a 22 year old single mother who lives with her 6 month old son Elián. Two years ago she started working raising chickens, roosters and hens. This small business has allowed her to provide food and pay for the place where she lives with her son. Johana needs the money to be able to construct a shed so her chickens don't get lost in the fields and increase her income to be able to continue to pay the basic expenses for herself and her son.

loans.use: to construct a chicken shed.

loans.name: Sinate

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane, tem 29 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 1 filho menor de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013, este é o seu quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku, com qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende dar continuidade com os seus estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
He was born in Inhambane. He is 29 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He has an underage son, and is not responsible for anyone else.

He started to work with Hluvuku in 2013. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku, and he is planning to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, metal sheets, and other materials to continue building his house.

In the future, he plans to continue studying up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, metal sheets, and other materials to continue building his house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and lives in Kibuitu village in the mountainous Nkubu area of Kenya. She practices horticultural and dairy farming for a living. For the last two years, she has made a living selling crops and engaging in seasonal businesses.

Joyce is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. In order to scale up this business, she needs more land. With this loan, Joyce will use part of the money to rent land and the rest to pay for farm inputs and labour.

This expansion will guarantee a better harvest for the young diligent farmer. Income from this investment will offset other farm-related expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Joyce replied, "Even though I am a smallholder farmer, the investment will put food on the table at least daily."

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her two children, she has been selling bananas, milk, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

The Igoki, Nkubu area is very populated, and the demand for banana products is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds banana farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she likes best is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her banana farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more banana seedlings to plant. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more banana seedlings.

As a result of the loan, she will sell banana products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her banana sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy more banana seedlings.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Meet Magdalina, an ambitious woman who always seeks her horizon. Since she was little, she showed a strong passion for independent work, but when she became pregnant, she left behind many of her dreams to focus completely on taking care of her little ones.

Since her children are at a good age, she wants to take up her dreams again and create work to maintain herself, since she doesn't know when her husband might be lacking or when they would go through a very complicated situation. Her primary sources of income has come from selling milk, potatoes, crop farming and dairy farming. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming.

She is kindly seeking a loan to buy seeds and increase her potato business. Her village has high demand for potatoes, but the supply is low.

Magdalina's upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Magdalina has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Magdalina is quite a visionary and, with her accumulated profits, she hopes she will be able to increase her potato farming business and this will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy seeds and increase her potato business

loans.name: Bercelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Bercelia es una mujer de 47 años que junto a su familia fue víctima del desplazamiento forzoso en el municipio de Córdoba y encontraron apoyo en su familia residente en Cartagena de Indias, allí se instalaron y emprendieron una nueva vida. Una tía le cedió su negocio de venta de mecatos a Bercelia  y en el ha trabajado a partir del año 2008 con buenos resultados. Ella es madre de dos hijos a quienes ofrece bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo, es por ello que su compromiso es muy grande y realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y surtir con dulces, empacados, bebidas y jugos su minitienda de comestibles. Su meta es agrandar su negocio y tener mayores beneficios económicos.
texts.en:
Bercelia is 47 years old and, along with her family, was a victim of forced displacement in the Cordoba municipality. She found support in her family in Cartagena de Indias. The family moved there and started a new life. An aunt gave Bercelia her business where she sells cakes, and Bercelia has been working there with good results since 2008.

Bercelia is a mother to two children, whom she provides well-being with the fruits of her labour. Bercelia therefore has important commitments. She is applying for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to have a credit record, through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. Bercelia wants to stock up her small shop with sweets, packed goods, soft drinks and juices. Her goal is to expand her business to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to stock up her small shop with sweets, packed goods, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 50 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kiangothe, a remote village in Kerugoya. She is happily married and is blessed with four children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Kerugoya area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 100,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Sarah feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

Please help this responsible, hard-working woman to fulfill her dreams and help her family. A loan would bring her very close to achieving it.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Rispah

texts.en:
Rispah is 29 and a very industrious, honest and hardworking mother from the Kitale area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Elgon, an area known for maize production. Kitale is always referred to as the bread basket area of Kenya.

Rispah has been farming for the past nine years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and crops. Rispah is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that Rispah could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

She now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with the wonderful Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Rispah believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Rispah to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 53-year-old go-getter, with two children, from Kapsigoria, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has bad terrain and to survive, you must have tough skin. Joan has defied all the odds and has farmed for five years. Her primary sources of income are growing crops and raising animals.

Joan is content with the farming way of life and is a very enterprising woman. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, which is why she seeks a loan to buy seeds to start horticulture farming. Because of good climate and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and increase her business.

Joan feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women. She is well disciplined with finances, and she plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Joan so that her horticulture farm can flourish!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Kiangothe can be considered a hardship area. Despite this, Jane lives there and is a hardworking farmer and loving mom who has been in her line of work for ten years. She loves dairy farming, as proven by the fact that she knows her cows individually because she works with them 365 days a year. Because she also loves her cows, she makes sure to feed and breed them well too. Her main sources of income are selling milk, eggs, and vegetables, but the money she earns is insufficient so she is struggling to keep hope alive and believe that things will improve.

She is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a motorbike. Juhudi Kilimo serves poor farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to these people, we help them acquire assets like dairy cows, motorbikes, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses. Jane's sources of income come from selling perishable items that require timely delivery to market. That is why Jane is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike to deliver products on time, and she will reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver products to the market when they are freshest.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Martha, a 48-year-old farmer from the remote village of Gitimbine, situated in the central province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections.

For ten years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and horticultural produce. Martha’s biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Martha made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

The additional income from the expansion will go to Martha's children’s education. The cost of education in Kenya has skyrocketed. With your loan, Martha’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 33-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kerugoya, which is a small agricultural center near Mount Kenya. She owns a small piece of land together with her husband, and they have been blessed with three children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown maize for five years.

From Kiva lenders, Agnes is seeking a loan worth KES 40,000 to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Juhudi has teamed up with KIVA to offer Agnes access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector.

This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. She counts on help from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders.

Help this mother and wife make her dreams a reality so that she can provide a great life to her family. Donate now.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 28 years of age. She has dedicated her body and soul to her farming business and to her husband. 

Beatrice has been characterized by her neighbours and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began five years ago. 

Beatrice, tired of working just to survive, wishes to request a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Beatrice’s family, and a commodity for trade. 

Enterprising farmers usually buy cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers, like Beatrice, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.
Be inspired and lend to Beatrice!

loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting, and for feeding her family.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
With three children to raise, Lilian who is an ever-smiling woman has limited time or sometimes no time at all to make money to provide financial support for her family. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in. Lilian is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Lilian access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business. With your loan, Lilian’s family will benefit. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Lilian!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married mother of two children. She keeps cattle and poultry for milk, eggs, and meat respectively. On her two-acre piece of land, you will also find a granary, cereals, and over 50 trees.

To make better income, Sarah engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the ten years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Since she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, Sarah prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy more cereal produce from local farmers at competitive prices. She will use her understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell later at a profit.

Your loan will help local farmers selling to Sarah to focus on production, rather than sales. Sarah’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 47 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kaguthi, a remote village in Kerugoya. She is happily married and is blessed with three children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. The Kerugoya area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging. She feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Circuncision Livia

texts.es:
La socia Livia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora ella se dedica a la crianza y venta  de gallinas. con esta actividad saca adelante a su familia.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” , tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, su sueño de la socia es  progresar y tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos. 
Livia solicito el préstamo para comprar  maíz y comida para aves, y así garantizar el alimento a sus gallinas para que le produzcan más. La socia está contenta y complacida con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas previamente
texts.en:
The member Livia is a busy hard-working woman. She is breeding and selling chickens. With this work she is bringing forward her family. She is a member of the communal bank "SILKINCHANY", is 45 years old and has three children. She dreams of making progress and having a better quality of life for her children.
Livia is requesting the loan to buy corn und food for birds and thus to guarantee the nourishment for her chickens, so that they will produce more.
The member is content and glad about the loan, because with it she will move forward and she promises to comply with the previously established rates.

loans.use: to buy corn and food for birds

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 37, has been farming for the past 10 years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Ann could increase her profits by satisfying the demand. Ann believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. Ann also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Ann to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Anah

texts.en:
The lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Anah, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. For the past 10 years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming.
Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 litres of milk a day, and this helps her support her family.

Anah also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality beans, potato and vegetable seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production.

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; and therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Anah believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Anah’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mary, a young farmer from Giitho, Nkubu in Kenya, who has defied the common thinking most Kenyans have about agriculture. Mary is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years.

Mary passionately loves farming. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income through selling milk and crop farming, and she attributes all this success to hardwork and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business.

The main challenge she has is a lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nkubu and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals to be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market.

Mary has been practicing agriculture by employing her youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training. There is no doubt that through your loan, Mary’s life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children and grandchildren a secure future.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
