Caroline is a 25-year-old smallholder farmer from a small rural town in central Kenya. She is married and has no child. Her husband runs a small business and she does dairy and crop farming to produce food and generate a bit of income for her family.

Caroline is seeking a loan to buy important farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, herbicides and pesticides. With your loan, she will have enough supplies for the coming crop season. Certified quality seeds and fertilizers will reduce the odds of crop failure due to diseases and climatic conditions just as quality herbicides and pesticides will reduce destruction of crops and produce due to weeds and pests.

Income generated from this business will help grow her business and settle household expenses. You can be part of the story of this beautiful family; a loan can change their lives.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a mother of 5 from Nangili, a rural village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She has been involved in farming for 10 years. Her primary income sources are maize, dairy and eggs. From her experience, dairy farming is not only profitable but also enjoyable. The challenge, however, is that growth is constrained by limited funds/capital.

Mary is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been keeping poultry for fun for many years. Recently, however, she was taught how poultry is a big business if made commercial. She feared the high costs involved in setting up a commercial poultry farm at first, but after looking at the projections, she sees the point. The income she will generate from her poultry farm alone is enough to facilitate timely loan repayments and savings. The loan will help Mary’s family improve their quality of life. Support this woman who wants to offer her 5 children an excellent education and also build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Josphina

texts.en:
Hello world, meet an amazing woman by the name of Josphina. She is a smallholder farmer based in Chebiemit village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is married to Joseph, whom she has been together with for almost a decade. She has seven children who commute to school from home every school day.

Josphina has been practicing livestock farming for seven years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise cows and poultry on the farm. She also makes extra money doing a side hustle business.

Josphina is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to use your money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred plus profit.

Josphina is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hardworking and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education.

To do this she is counting on the lenders on the Kiva website.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Linety

texts.en:
Linety at 40 years old works as a smallholder farmer. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nangili, Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 15 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Linety has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Linety mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Linety is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Linety is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Linety feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are big because Linety will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future. Like Linety, many poor smallholder farmers await your help.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of her farm produce to market

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 31 years old, strong, full of energy, and hardworking. She hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. Hellen has a handsome husband and four children that she really admires and would do anything so that they never lack anything. Through practicing dairy and crop farming, she has always been able to provide food for her family and also meet their basic needs. She has acquired much experience over the last 10 years, and this has helped her earn profits.

She is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy poultry. Through the loan, she is sure that she will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Kitale, which is densely populated and has ready markets for eggs and poultry. Because of the immense knowledge that Hellen has and also because of the good will she enjoys with the villagers, she will not have any challenge in selling her products. She also believes that through word of mouth, she will be able to get more customers and increase her customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Hellen and her family, and this will also allow her to make permanent changes to her life and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a mother of two from Kerugoya, a remote town in Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet.

Winfred is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she is involved in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed them.

Winfred wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but her biggest challenge is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 65,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With the loan, Winfred will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Winfred is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Winfred dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor  pertenece al banco “SILKINCHANY”, el   es transportista de carga pesada, son muchos años que se dedica a esta actividad.
El socio es una persona luchadora y quiere trasportarse seguro y necesita darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabaja que es el vehículo donde hace el trasporte.

Victor tiene 49  años  y tiene 3 hijos por quienes lucha a diario. 
El Solicito el crédito para el mantenimiento de su auto y repuestos, el necesita comprar llantas y aceite de carro.  ya que para su trabajo es necesario tener todos los implementos en buenas condiciones.

El socio está agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en él y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas del crédito puntualmente.
texts.en:
Victor is a member of the "Silkinchany" communal bank. He has been working as a truck driver for many years.

This member is a persistent person, and he wants to feel safer when he drives. He needs to perform maintenance on his working tool, i.e., the truck he uses to transport goods.

Victor is 49 years old and has three children. He fights every day for them.

He requested a loan to perform maintenance on his vehicle and buy spare parts. He needs to buy tires and lubricants. His job requires that all his tools are in good shape all the time.

This member is grateful to Kiva lenders for trusting in him, and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy tires and lubricants for his vehicle.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
As a mother of two lovely children, Glady's great desire is to see her children grow to become professionals. It is what encourages Gladys and fills her with enthusiasm.

Gladys has been practicing mixed farming for the past twelve years. On her farm, she grows maize, has dairy cows, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns. Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" she says.

Gladys biggest challenge is limited funds. Because of this challenge, Gladys formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance organization that supports small rural farmers. Gladys is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Gladys is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood. Gladys hopes to succeed thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people who support smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 30 years of age, and very passionate and diligent about farming. Having done mixed farming for the past eight years, she has gained much experience and offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. Kamobon is a remote village in Nandihills area of Kenya where people live in dismal condition.

. But within the remote village of Kamobon Hellen is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Hellen as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her two children as a primary caregiver.

Hellen started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 0.5 acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize, beans and vegetables.

Hellen is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. The money from the investment will be plowed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her two children who are in public schools.

loans.use: to buy more land and expand her farming.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old Susan has never set foot in any higher learning institution, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya, and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with two adorable children.

For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming and sheep farming. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, farmers from her village seek technical advice from her on the best dairy farming techniques.

Susan is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard, so that her children will have a bright future and her ageing parents will have a comfortable life. Although she makes a profit from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Susan could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Susan, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Susan believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Susan to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Dorothy, 29 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Tombe, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and has two children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, su hija y sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa interior por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 54 years old and is living in her own house with her life companion, her daughter and her two grandchildren. She is selling underwear. Her business is located in the municipal market. She has many regular customers because of the clothing´s quality and the good prices. With the earnings from her sales she manages to settle some expenditures of her household. She is requesting a loan to buy more underwear in bulk to continue with her sales and thus to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy underwear in bulk

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old farmer who is also hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a child, she learned the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' support. She lives in Kitale, Kenya, a town near Mount Elgon, with her husband and children.

Rose has been a farmer for more than ten years and raises poultry, eggs, cows for milk, and maize and vegetables. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity arises. Despite rapid prices changes for the goods she sells, Rose is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya. She is seeking a loan to expand her farm by buying farm implements. This move a big deal for her because with this loan, Rose can growing a variety of crops, but on a larger scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will help her overcome the high farming expenses she has to deal with and satisfy her family’s basic needs. She puts it this way: “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my six children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Vinic

texts.en:
Vinic is a 24-year-old farmer from a remote village in Bigogo in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Vinic passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Vinic is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

In addition to profits, Vinic will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes' young age hasn't stopped her from fighting for her dreams. She is a happy mother because just few years ago the greatest joy arrived at her home. She loves and gives everything for her infant child.

Agnes farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Konate, Nyamira, in the Nyanza region of Kenya. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows and has a side business. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, Agnes is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of her produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. She mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Agnes is from a remote village (konate) that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Through this loan Agnes is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Agnes feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are many because Agnes will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market, and also she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.

Make a loan now and be a part of Agnes dreams.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Joyce, a 39-year-old farmer from the remote village of Ekerenyo, situated in the Nyanza province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been dairy goat milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Joyce’s biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Joyce made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

The additional income from the expansion will go to Joyce’s children's education. The cost of education in Ekerenyo is becoming prohibitive for smallholder farmers. With your loan, Joyce’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Josilet

texts.en:
Josilet has no higher education or work experience, but lives on her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote area of Kenya. The area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. Josilet is happily married, the proud mother of five children, and lives with her family on a small piece of land that she treasures. Her primary sources of income are vegetables, eggs, and milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of meeting customer demand in the local market. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farm. This loan will help Josilet realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer con 22 años de edad,de estado civil soltero, vive en casa familiar de material rústico,junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café,de la variedad Catimor, resistente a enfermedades y plagas,contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas,plantación está en segundo y cuarto año de producción. Cultivo de café lo realiza en terreno propio ubicado en el caserío de San Jose del distrito de Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza hace 3 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, cerdo) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) siendo estos tres últimos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta. Ademas trabaja como peón agrícola en el mismo caserío y caseríos aledaños. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1,5 hectáreas de café en producción, de las 2 hectáreas que cuenta y así asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar calidad de vida de él y de su familia.

Elmer es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma con aval.
texts.en:
Elmer is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a house built with rustic materials in the Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department of Peru. Locals can give very good personal and professional references of him. Locals work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.

He works in agriculture, more specifically growing "Catimor" coffee, a variety that is resistant to diseases and plagues. He has now two hectares planted with coffee, which have produced coffee for two and four years, respectively. He grows coffee in his own land, which is located in the San José village, Santo Tomás district. He has been doing this for three years. He also raises farm animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs) and grows vegetables such as cassava, plantain, and taro. His family normally eats the vegetables he grows, but sometimes he sells them. He also works as a day laborer locally, and in some nearby villages.

He will use the loan to perform maintenance on 1.5 hectares of coffee plantations, out of the two he owns. This will guarantee a good production in 2016, which will result in more sales and thus a better income for the improvement of his and his family's living conditions.

Elmer has been a member of Edpyme Alternativa before. He has a guarantor to back up this loan.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on 1.5 hectares of coffee plantations.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
While many young people in the Kerugoya area of Kenya dream of getting well-paying white collar jobs, Beth, from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, has never secured one and she opted to become a full-time smallholder farmer. Beth is totally a life warrior - despite not securing a formal job she goes out every day to work in her small farm, showing that women are also involved in farming. Beth decided that she would be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming.

Beth is married and blessed with one lovely child who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are selling milk, pig farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice pig farming was not a difficult decision for Beth. She has earned a decent income from pig farming for six years. The demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase the number of pigs, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds, so she seeks a loan to purchase additional pigs.

Pig farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya, because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that will always be needed. Pig farming is a less strenuous activity and it is profitable. Many pig farmers find a sense of fulfillment having pigs all over their homestead. If taken seriously, pig farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for pork products is always high. With your loan, Beth is going to earn more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. Beth is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Three out of ten farmers in the Siongiroi area of Kenya struggle to make their way in this world because of a lack of financing from microfinancing and financial institutions. This is true for Edna, 38, who is based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya and is a loving mother of four.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 8 and 12 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Edna is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married mother of seven lovely children. To help her husband provide for the family, Agnes ventured into farming five years ago. Currently, Agnes keeps cows and poultry on her farm for milk, meat, and eggs. She also makes extra money arranging the logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers. She understands that for this business to be successful, she needs to rely on two things: relationships and capital. She has been able to build strong relationships in the five years she has been farming, but what she seems to be lacking is capital to secure cereal. Agnes is seeking a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy cereals. She plans to use the money to buy more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. The impact of your loan will be twofold: smallholder farmers selling to Agnes will be relieved the burden of selling, which will help them to focus more on production. Agnes’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and this will go a long way to elevate their livelihood and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Cintia Mishell

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha se encuentra ubicado el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos el mismo es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros por su gran variedad de cascadas, ríos y hosterías que ofrecen buena atención y comodidad para el descanso de las personas.
En este bello Cantón vive la señora Cintia una joven mujer luchadora soltera de 20 años se encuentra embarazada pero recibe el apoyo incondicional de sus Padres, actualmente trabaja en un restaurante del sector pero solicita este préstamo para emprender en su propio restaurante comprará activos como una refrigeradora u utensilios de cocina, también cuenta con el local que le facilitaran sus Padres y solo tendrá que pagar los servicios básicos además su clientela le pide que se independice ya que tiene mucha acogida y experiencia,  ella le dedicará un promedio de 8 horas diarias a su negocio.
La señora Cintia agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas ya que con este crédito  podrá dar un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Northwest of Pichincha is the Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos. It is frequently visited by foreign and national tourists due to its large number of waterfalls, rivers and inns that offer good service and comfort for people's relaxation. Cintia lives in this beautiful canton. She is a 20 year old fighter, who is pregnant, but has the unconditional support of her parents.

She currently works in a restaurant in the area, but seeks this loan to start her own restaurant. She will buy assets like a refrigerator and cooking utensils. She also has a locale that her parents are supplying. She will only have to pay for basic services. In addition, her customers have asked her to become independent, since she has lots of experience and is well received. She will work an average of 8 hours a day in her business. Cintia is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and opportunities offered, since with this loan she will be able to provide a better future to her child.

loans.use: to start her own restaurant, in order to be able to pay the costs of the birth of her child, with the support of her parents.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a very hard-working and helpful mother who does all that she can for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar, along with her family.

She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. Josphine has been in agriculture for 10 years. She sells milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Josphine is seeking a loan to buy seeds to start horticulture farming. She plans to buy good-quality seeds to increase her productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, Josphine has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way to permanently change the life of Josphine and her family.

loans.use: to buy good-quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.es:
La socia Calixta es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora ella se dedica a ala confección de ropas. Con esta actividad saca adelante a su familia.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” , tiene 61 años de edad y 6 hijos, su sueño de la socia es  progresar y tener una mejor calidad de vida .
Calixta solicito el préstamo para comprar  telas e hilos de cocer, para poder seguir confeccionando ropa y mejorar su negocio cumpliendo las expectativas de sus clientes. La socia está contenta  con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas previamente
texts.en:
Calixta is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She makes clothes. She makes headway for her family through this activity.

She is a member of the "Silkinchany" communal bank. She is 61 years old and has six children. Her dream is to progress and have a better quality of life.

Calixta requested the loan to buy fabrics and threads to be able to continue making clothes and improve her business by meeting her customers' expectations. She feels happy for receiving the loan because she will continue to get ahead. She promises to pay the installments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is an honest and eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. She lives in Kombim, a remote village in the lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. As the key breadwinner for her family, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and various crops. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Although she has been making profits from her farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is lack of funds to get started. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy different varieties of cereals — maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet — to sell in the local market. Selling these cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that. Also, because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to do her selling by word of mouth, and use her profits to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Margaret’s life will take another positive turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of eight from Kwanza, Kitale, a remote village in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Benedetta is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart.

Benedetta wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals to resell. The Kwanza area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Benedetta will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Benedetta is very concerned about her eight children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Benedetta awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Maria Abelina

texts.es:
La señora María una mujer luchadora de 59 años, es madre soltera de su anterior relación tienen 12 hijos, tiene una casita humilde en la que vive junto con sus ultima hija, es su tercer préstamo y se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas los fines de semana aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia. Cuando se separó de su esposo tuvo que luchar duro para salir adelante junto con sus hijos, al negocio le dedica un promedio de 8 horas, ella viene de familia de bajos recursos económicos por lo que no pudo estudiar, pero gracias a su esfuerzo sus hijos tendrán una vida mejor ya que estuvo apoyándolos para que se preparen y sean profesionales 
Solicita este crédito para comprar sillas y mesas para el negocio, con esta nueva inversión atraerá más clientela y les dará un mejor servicio de esta manera podrá continuar ayudando a la preparación de la última de sus hijas, la señora María agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza brindada.
texts.en: María is a tenacious 59 year old woman. She is a single mother and has 12 children from her previous relationship. She has a humble little house where she lives with her youngest daughter. This is her third loan. She makes a living by selling fast food at the weekends. She learned this business using her own initiative.  When she and her husband separated she had to struggle hard to get ahead with her children. She spends an average of 8 hours a day at her business. María comes from a low income family and was unable to go to school. Her children will have a better life thanks to her hard work  and support to prepare them to become professionals. She is asking for a loan to buy chairs and tables for her business. This new investment will attract more customers and provide a better service, allowing her to continue helping with her youngest daughters education. María is grateful for the support and trust that Kiva has placed in her .

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to attract more customers and grow her business.

loans.name: Andrea Cristina

texts.es: Andrea vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella posee una venta de antojitos: papas fritas, yuca frita entre otros desde hace varios años, también se dedica a la venta de pescados, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como: aceite, papas, yuca, entre otros ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Andrea is living in her own house with her husband and her two daughters. She owns a food stall with antojitos (mexican snacks): potatoe chips, fried yuca, among others, for many years. She is also selling fish.
With her earnings she manages to settle some expenditures of her household. She is requesting a loan once again to buy more raw material such as: oil, potatoes, yuca, among other ingredients, which she uses for the production of the foodstuffs so that she can have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, yuca, among other ingredients

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La socia Dina  es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora ella continua dedicándose al reciclaje de plásticos y metales. Con esta actividad sustenta su hogar.
Dina  solicito el préstamo para comprar guantes ,barbijos y ropa adecuada para que realice su trabajo de reciclaje de forma segura y sana.
La socia está contenta  con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas previamente
texts.en:
Dina, the member, is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman. She continues making a living by recycling plastics and metals. With this job she supports her household.

Dina requested the loan to buy gloves, face masks and appropriate clothing in order to be able to carry out her recycling work in a safe and healthy manner.

The member is happy with the loan because this way she will forge ahead, and she promises to make her agreed upon payments.

loans.use: to buy gloves, face masks and clothes.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a young farmer from Cheptiret, a remote village, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. Eunice is happily married and with her husband blessed with three children. Her primary source of income is milk and maize she grows on her farm. Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge — high prices for fertilizers, seedlings and inputs caused by the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agricultural shop in her area. She is requesting a loan to start a new vet shop to serve the thousands of small farmers who need agricultural supplies. Eunice wants to seize this business opportunity and through your loan she will start a new shop to tap into the potential of the large market in which she lives.

loans.use: to start an agro vet shop.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime con 27 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijo, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Jaime se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café,de variedad Catimor,con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 10 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola.El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de abonos y para el mantenimiento de su finca.De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Jaime es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jaime is 27 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children in Pomahuaca, Jaén province, Cajamarca department of Peru. Locals can give very good personal and professional references of him. Locals work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.

Jaime works in agriculture, specifically growing "Catimor" coffee. He has been working in this activity for more than ten years. He also works as a day laborer.

He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and perform maintenance on his farm. In this way, he will make acceptable profits and his living conditions will improve.

Jaime is a regular member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and perform maintenance on his land.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 53 years old. She is very clear about what she wants in life and determined to get ahead and have a good life. Christina is a married mother of two children. She runs a 1-acre mixed farm. She has dairy goats, poultry, cash crops, and over 50 trees. With all these activities, however, Christina could not make enough income to meet her family's basic needs. Therefore, she started a cereal trading business. Basically, she arranges the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers.

The borrowed money will be used to buy more cereal produce from local farmers; the larger the stock, the more the income.

The impact of your loan will be felt by both her family and other farmers in her village. By using her better understanding of the market conditions and prices, she will be able to sell much easier, and this will free her to focus more on production. Income from this trade will help Christina to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Chuka, Kenya is a town that is famously known for producing the “creme de la creme” when it comes to athletics. It also has a lot of smallholder farmers who work the land and raise animals.
Unfortunately, the people who do this farm work face many problems, like the high costs of the farm inputs. Margaret has full knowledge of this but always finds a way to come through.

Margaret is from a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya and she is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her three children as the primary caregiver. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and vegetables and also keeping dairy cows. Margaret has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Margaret is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Margaret believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Margaret waits for your kindness.

Be inspired to loan to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her 2 children. Kiva lenders! Meet Ruth, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 31 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Maua, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Ruth has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past ten years.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Ruth is content with the farming way of life. Ruth is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Maua area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a smallholder farmer and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Ruth feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising smallholder women like her.

Ruth is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in school. Please help Ruth so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her  children.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Mary, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill, has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Her primary sources of income are from the sale of milk and eggs and some personal business that she engages in.

Mary is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. With your loan, Mary’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Mary!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 27-year-old farmer. She is a mother who is hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. She is a smallholder farmer based in Gaci, Nkubu Kenya, which is a town near the famous Mount Kenya. Sabina and her husband are blessed with a lovely family.

Sabina has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs and cows for milk and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Sabina is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Sabina is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Sabina seeks to continue growing a variety of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nkubu is very high.
In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Flavio Edmundo

texts.es: Edmundo tiene 20 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, es una persona  responsable y dedicada,  pues trabaja muy duro para ayudarle a su madre con los gastos de su casa. El se dedica a la producción de leche hace dos años, esta es su única fuente de ingresos, Edmundo solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca de leche, y así seguir creciendo su pequeño negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Edmundo is 20 years old. His civil status is single. He is a responsable and devoted person, since he is working very hard to help his mother with the expenditures of her home. He is producing milk for two years. This is his sole source of income. 

Edmundo is requesting the loan to buy a cow for milk production and thus to continue expanding his small business to obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian pertenece al banco “SILKINCHANY”, y  su negocio es  crianza y venta de animales menores.
La socia tiene 27 años de edad  y 2 pequeños hijos, es por ellos que ella lucha a diario.
Mirian  solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y pasto, para dar de comer a sus animalitos, que luego los vende en el mercado.
La socia está contenta y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mirian is a member of the "Silkinchany" communal bank. She works raising and selling farm animals. She is 27 years old and has two small children. It is for them that she fights every day.

Mirian requested the loan to buy corn and fodder to feed her animals. She will sell them at the marketplace.

She feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan. She promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy corn and fodder to feed her animals.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su hijo Cristian de 19 años de edad él estudia en una unidad gratuita del sector,   vino de Colombia hace 25 años a buscar trabajo como empleada  en un restaurante buscando oportunidad para mejorar la calidad de vida desde hace 3 años empezó a vender ropa para dama, caballeros, niños visitando a sus clientes en sus casas o lugares de trabajo. Rosa con el dinero comprara  ropa incrementando sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old. She lives with her 19 year old son, Cristian. He studies at the free unit in the area. She came from Colombia 25 years ago to look for work as a restaurant employee, searching for an opportunity to improve her quality of life.

Three years ago she started to sell clothes for women, men and children, visiting her customers in their homes or work places. With the money, Rosa will buy clothes, increasing her sales and her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her supply of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de finos muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles, el joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is blurred out is 22 and lives in a high-risk zone. He owns a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells a variety of fine furniture. He has had this business for several years and many people like it since he offers quality furniture at good prices.

The young man lives in his own house with his parents. He is asking for a credit through Integral to invest in his business and buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane and more. This way, he can attract more clients and be able to achieve his goal of improving quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane and more.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, who is 29 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Julieta is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Julieta makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over five years. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Julieta can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Your loan will help Julieta’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Julieta a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Despite the importance of agriculture to Kapsowar and its environs, many microfinance institutions shy away from lending to smallholder farmers. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Joyce, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 46 years of age. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of four lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Joyce’s primary sources of income are selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been a bed of roses. She faces financial challenges, and because the Kapsowar area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. Joyce’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Joyce has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Joyce is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

Be inspired and support a smallholder farmer!

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a simple woman, hardworking and full of life. She is a 48-year-old woman with a great future ahead of her.

For the past ten years, Agnes has been actively involved in mixed farming. Because she comes from a remote area, gender roles are observed and women are left to do the heavy work of farming. This has not been a setback because Agnes has been making great profits in dairy farming.

Kinoru, Nkubu is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soil, a transport system, and a market. Agnes has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.

Through the Kinoru young generation self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Agnes joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With this loan, she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, enabling her to make more money.

This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. It is clear that this mrembo (beautiful woman) is determined to reach her goal, and her request should be considered. Make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
For many years, Loise has been engaged in mixed farming in the remote town of Ishiara, Chuka. In this way, she supplements her meager income which has helped her 4 children get ahead in the world. Her tenacity and perseverance have enabled her to strive tirelessly, always looking for a way to get ahead.

Her major sources of income are selling milk and eggs, growing crops, and engaging in personal business to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. Because of the high-quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming. 

To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used to improve her living conditions. 

She plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from the poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish and provide a solid education for her 4 children. Support a Kenyan woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry to increase her business and support her 4 children.

loans.name: Handson

texts.en:
Handson, a husband and father of two children, is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Ekerenyo, Nyamira. He has been practising agribusiness for the past 10 years and has never looked back. For a living, Handson sells milk and food products from his farm to the local market. He also does some side hustle business (motorbike business). He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products and he really feels satisfied.

Although Handson has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. Handson is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Nyamira and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Handson does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. With this loan, Handson is confident that his income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Handson will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his large family of a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina, who is 29 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Penina is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Penina makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Penina can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy more cereal produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Your loan will help Penina's clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Penina a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre trabajador, una persona activa, inquieta, curiosa, la cual se dedica a vender madera, pero también tiene cultivos.
Verano de mil batalladas de 52 años de edad que trabaja arduamente por pagar la educación de su hijo que tiene 15 años de edad, por mejorar diariamente las condiciones de su hogar, por ser mejor trabajador, mejor empresario, mejor esposo, mejor padre, en pocas palabras es un hombre completamente comprometido con su familia y negocio.
Actualmente su cultivo se encuentra en etapa de maduración y necesita ciertos insumos para apoyar el proceso.
Por este motivo el señor Nelson quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abonos, insumos restante en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Nelson is a hardworking man, an active, restless, curious person who works selling wood, but also has crops. A veteran of a thousand battles, he is 52 years old. He works diligently to pay for the education of his 15 year old son, to daily improve the conditions of his home, to be a better worker, better businessman, better spouse, better father. In other words, he is a man completely devoted to his family and his business.

Currently his crop is at the ripening stage, and he needs certain supplies to assist in the process. For that reason, Nelson wants to seek a loan to buy fertilizers and remaining supplies for his fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and remaining supplies for his fields.

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
Huehuetenango, in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, is located on the ridge of the Sierra de los Cuchumatanes, a majestic mountain range that is the highest mountain chain in Central America.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” or “Hard-working Mothers” was formed here by 7 women who want to expand their small businesses (clothing sales, cosmetics, perfumes, snacks). The majority of them have had some amount of formal education.

The President of “Madres Trabajadoras” is 54 year old Liilian, who has 4 children. Lilian attended school until the 3rd grade. Like mothers throughout the world, Lilian saw that there were unmet needs in her household and decided that she needed to have a business. She began to sell new clothing, as well as cosmetics and perfume. As the years passed, her business made a profit but she needs to expand it even more. She is requesting a loan to acquire more clothing and take advantage of special holiday gatherings and end of year celebrations. Her customers are more apt to buy at this time of the year.

Education is an essential part of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge (loans+education). It is one of the critical factors that differentiates the organization from other microfinance institutions. Education is essential in helping the ladies empower themselves and gain financial stability. At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge creatively shares beneficial information with the women on a variety of subjects.

With the support of Friendship Bridge and partners like Kiva lenders, Lilian and her friends in the “Madres Trabajadoras” Trust Bank are making strides towards empowering themselves and eliminating poverty. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to acquire more clothing and take advantage of special holiday gatherings and end of year celebrations when her customers are apt to buy more.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 39 years old, married, and has children. She is a smallholder farmer, which she has been doing for 10 years. When she started, her husband was supportive and even allowed her to use their land as capital. Today, she has achieved great milestones in terms of diversifying from vegetable farming by introducing farm animals such as dairy cows and hens. She also does a side hustle business to supplement the meager income she earns from farming. However, a large portion of the land is still dedicated to maize farming. 

Everline is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase farm implements. After years of use, her farm tools have become old and worn out. This makes Everline’s work on the farm very slow and tedious. With the loan, she will be able to acquire new farm implements that are in good condition, better designed, durable, and more efficient. The overall effect will be a better quality of farm work and better yields at the end of the season. Her biggest dream is to become a large-scale farmer, which she believes she can achieve slowly with the help of Juhudi.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Angeline, one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Mugoiri, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. She is happily married. She is blessed with five lovely children. For the past 10 years she has been engaged in mixed farming. She has earned a decent income selling milk and a variety of food crops. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Angeline makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and lack of water for home consumption. Angeline comes from an area where there is no water connection, and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity.” Being 57 years of age, she faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health.

Angeline is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture, but Angeline wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan, she intends to harvest rain water, which always goes to waste, and store it in the tanks. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan Angeline will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boast productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Angeline is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income, and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Angeline’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to store rain water, water pipes, and a pump.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet James, a 28-year-old father who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking man on this planet earth. James is a father of one lovely child that he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that he never goes to bed with a hungry stomach.

James hails from the Nyamuronga, Nyamira area of Kenya. James never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. James started farming and has been doing crop and dairy farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, he has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. James practices mixed farming on his farm and through the profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs and give his children a good education because he believes that education is the only “key to success”. James is a man who is very enterprising. He is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, James wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like James to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. James hopes that through the loan, he will improve his living conditions. James' dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, he will be able to assure his child a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Help this father and husband make his dreams a reality so he can provide a great life to his family. Lend now.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 48 years old and blessed with a lovely family. She resides in the Chuka area of Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 10 years on her small plot, where she does dairy goat, cow, and crop farming. Olive enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Olive has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 60,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, she will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that by the end of the first year, she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her family. With your support, this hardworking woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Please make the decision to give her a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Alfayo

texts.en:
Many people dream of getting a good job after finishing college but Alfayo has never secured one. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years. Alfayo decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. Alfayo is blessed with six lovely children who he refers to as his "heart beat.” His primary sources of income are milk, maize and poultry farming, as well as some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income.

Deciding to practice poultry farming for Alfayo was not difficult. Alfayo has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry, but the biggest challenge is the lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Nyamira because it creates a business opportunity for the smallholder farmer. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Alfayo is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Alfayo is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa una mujer luchadora de estado civil soltera, tiene una hija mayor de edad e independiente, se dedica a arrendar locales comerciales en la casa que su madre les heredó pero debe compartir las ganancias con sus otros hermanos, desea emprender en el negocio de venta de toda clase prendas de vestir para niños cuenta con el local y el conocimiento necesario para esta actividad e inclusive tiene ya pedidos de ropa ella sabe que lo mejor es tener su propio negocio al mismo le dedicará un promedio de 8 a 10 horas diarias. 
Ella vive  en el Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón muy hermoso y de un maravilloso clima su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con mucha amabilidad 
La señora Rosa agradece a Kiva por el gran apoyo que se le está brindando para poder iniciar en este negocio y así obtener un mejor y mayor ingreso económico
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a born fighter, single, and has a daughter who is of legal age and self-sufficient. She makes a living renting commercial retail space in the house their mother left them, but she has to share the profits with her siblings. She would like to start a business selling all kinds of children's clothing. She already has the space and the necessary knowledge for this business and she has even ordered some clothes already. She knows having her own business would be best and she will devote to it an average of 8 to 10 hours daily.

She lives in the Pedro Vicente Maldonado district. A very beautiful district with a wonderful climate. Its people are very kind and hard working. This district is the destination of many tourists given that around it we have many inns where one can rest and be treated very kindly.

Mrs. Rosa thanks Kiva for the great support it's providing her in order to be able to start this business, and this way get a better and bigger income.

loans.use: to start her business selling children's clothing, so she can break off and be an entrepreneur.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su hija Bertha de 21 años ella ayuda a su padre cuidando  los animales  que no se venden en la feria semanal, muy humilde y trabajador se dedica al  comercio de animales menores  cuyes, gallinas, ovejas, chanchos con los pocos ingresos que recibe por esta actividad puede satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar. Miguel utilizara el dinero como capital de trabajo  incrementando sus ganancias para poder seguir satisfaciendo los principales gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Miguel is 50 years old and is single. He lives with his 21-year-old daughter Bertha, who helps her father care for the animals that aren't sold at the weekly market. Very humble and hardworking, he makes a living by selling small animals like guinea pigs, hens, sheep, and pigs. With the small income he receives from this business, he is able to satisfy his basic household needs. Miguel will use the money as working capital, increasing his earnings to be able to keep covering his primary household expenses.

loans.use: to be able to increase his purchases.

loans.name: Yudy Helena

texts.es:
Yudy es una mujer separa de 40 años de edad, una mujer muy luchadora, con los pantalones bien puestos, una mujer decidida, la cual su instinto de madre la llevo a triunfar a sacar un negocio de cafetería adelante, con el cual alimento y ahora brinda estudio a 5 hijos adolescentes, un verdadero ejemplo de verraquera y de amor de madre.
Actualmente la cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de surtido de refrescos, snack, productos fritos y abarrotes para su negocio, tiene como objetivo seguir pagando la educación de sus hijos y llevar el alimento a su casa.
texts.en:
Yudy is separated and 40 years old. She is a hard worker, determined and stands by her convictions. Her motherly instinct carried her to succeed in moving a cafe business forward with which she feeds and now provides an education for her 5 adolescent children – a true example of Colombian will and motherly love.

The client is now requesting a loan to buy an assortment of refreshments, snacks, fried foods and groceries for her business. Her goal is to continue paying to educate her children and to bring food to her home.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of refreshments, snacks, fried foods and groceries.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer De Los Angeles (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles   de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Renacer de Los Ángeles.
