Este grupo está formado por  11 mujeres que esperan con la ayuda de los créditos ir mejorando su vida, ellas se dedican a diversas actividades con la finalidad de ser útiles a la sociedad y a sus familias que son lo más importante para ellas. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Hilda, tiene 20 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 17  meses  de edad. Su marido es guardia de seguridad.
Doña Hilda es una joven  mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ganar sus propios recursos para mejorar su calidad de  vida, para esto ella hace ya 3 años surtió en su casa una pequeña  tienda donde vende víveres de primera necesidad, ella espera con la ayuda de los créditos comprar más variedad de productos y de a poco ir aumentando su negocio, ella también vende ropa de todo tipo en su negocio y en ciertos días sale a vender puerta a puerta, con esto ella logra ganarse algo extra que siempre lo invierte en su hogar y su bebé el cual requiere de muchas cosas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres  y ropa para sus ventas. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y espera seguir por mucho tiempo recibiendo la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio y darles lo mejor a su familia.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the area known as Los Ángeles in the city of Portoviejo the members of the Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Renacer de Los Ángeles (Credit Group New Awakening of Los Ángeles) meet every five days. This group consists of 11 women who, with the help of the loans, are going to improve their lives. They´re following various businesses with the aim to be helpful for the society and their families, who are the most important thing for them.
One of the members of this group is Hilda. She is 20 years old and is living in a free relationship. From this partnership she has a 17-month-old son.
Her partner is a security guard.
Hilda is a young woman and a fighter. She likes working to earn her own funds for improving her living quality. That´s why she is running a small shop in her house for three years now, where she is selling basic food supplies. With the help of the loans she hopes to buy a greater variety of products and to expand her business little by little. In her shop she is also selling clothing of all kinds and on certain days she is going out to sell from door to door.
This way she manages to have some extra earnings which she always invests in her home and her baby who needs many things.
She will use this loan to buy food and clothing for her sales. This is her first cycle in the Credit Group and she hopes that she will recieve the help of the loans for a long time. She dreams of improving her business and give the best to her family.
The small foto shows a member who could not be present when the foto of the group was taken.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a father, husband, and farmer with 10 years of experience in mixed farming. He lives in Nyaranga, Nyamira, Kenya with his two children on a small piece of land that he inherited from his parents. Charles completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of his parents.

He has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors. He passionately loves poultry farming, and as he likes to say “poultry is close to my heart.” Although this humble and ever smiling father makes a profit selling poultry, he lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and to expand his farm. He requests a loan to buy more poultry. He has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Charles has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity.

He chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that he can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in his life since he will improve his living standards and secure the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty, the will to get ahead, and to secure the future of his children, are some of the reasons that made Philip start practicing mixed farming. Philip is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although he has only farmed for the past 10 years, he is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits he makes, he has been able to take care of his family and provide basic needs for his parents. He is based in Koilot, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming. The region's staple food is mursik, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk.

Philip has been selling eggs and milk, and this has earned him a decent income. He also engages in another business to make ends meet. Philip passionately loves dairy farming and taking care of his cows gives him great joy. He wakes up every morning to milk his cows. While this humble father has been making a profit by selling milk to his neighbors and the local market, he is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. He is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to his farm for milk. Philip is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With this loan, he will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand.

Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, he attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help him save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve his living conditions. You can help Philip to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get him closer to his goals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 51 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 12 años y una hija de 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de muebles prefabricados.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘senkata’ caracterizada por encontrarse cerca al cruce de villas, de donde se puede conseguir transporte a la mayor parte de las zonas.
Antonia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado y forma de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y trabajan en el negocio, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de muebles prefabricados, actividad que realiza con ayuda de sus hijos que se encargan de ensamblar el mueble ajustando todos los tornillos para exponerlos a la venta, “inicie mi negocio hace 2 años vendiendo muebles en otra ciudad, ahora trabajo con mis hijos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra ubicado en un lugar comercial y aprovecha los días de feria, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar más muebles. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio abriendo nuevas tiendas, ella desea comprar muebles prefabricados por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Antonia solicita un préstamo para comprar muebles prefabricados por mayor para vender en la feria.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 51 year old woman. She is single and has two children: a 12 year old son and a 20 year old daughter. Her business is the sale of prefabricated furniture. She is an entrepreneur, and is independent and a fighter. She works in the "Senkata" area, known for being close to the intersection of villages, where transportation is available to most areas.

Antonia has brown skin; long, black, braided hair; and uses traditional dress (a hat, shawl and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish in her business. She lives with her two children, who go to school and work in the business. They live in a rented room made of brick, that has potable water, electricity and plumbing.

Her business is the sale of prefabricated furniture, a job she does with the help of her children who are in charge of assembling the furniture, tightening all the screws so that it can be displayed for sale. "I started my business two years ago, selling furniture in another city. Now I work with my children," she says. The advantage of her business is that she is located in a commercial site and takes advantage of the festival days. The disadvantage of her business is the lack of capital to buy more furniture. Her dream is to expand her business, opening new stores. She wants to buy prefabricated furniture wholesale. This is the first round of loans with the institution in the two years she has worked at this job. For these reasons Antonia seeks a loan to buy prefabricated furniture wholesale to sell at the fair.

loans.use: to buy prefabricated furniture wholesale to sell at the fair.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La señora Natalia de 53 años de edad,ella se ha dedicado por varios años a la elaboración y venta de refacciones, y también a la venta de bebidas, ella ha luchado juntamente con su familia para sacar adelante su negocio y gracias al apoyo de ellos y a el apoyo de Kiva lo ha logrado, en esta oportunidad ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas productos comestibles para la elaboración de sus comidas y también para la compra de bebidas, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Natalia is 53 years old. She was worked for several years making and selling snacks, and also selling drinks. With her family she has fought to move her business forward. Thanks to their help and the help of Kiva, she has succeeded.

Currently she is seeking a loan to buy more food products to make her dishes, and also to buy drinks. She is hopeful that you can help her with the loan she seeks.

loans.use: to buy food products to make dishes to sell.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
Ángel, de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, juntos tienen 4 hijos pero ninguno vive con ellos porque ya se casaron.

Ángel, es agricultor y se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, ajonjolí, verduras y algunas hortalizas, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 44 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre.- Ángel, no tiene otra actividad económica, pues solo con la agricultura ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante; el lugar donde siembra está cerca de su casa, en el trabajo se involucra un nieto de él y su horario de trabajo es de 5 a 6 horas al día aproximadamente.

Ángel, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, para tener otra fuente de alimentación para su familia y aprovechar los residuos de la cosecha agrícola.

Ángel, sueña con tener un negocio que provea de lo necesario a él y a su familia; y también desea que sus dos nietos estudien y se gradúen de u una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ángel is 69 years old and studied up to the third grade. He is married and his wife dedicates herself to domestic tasks. Together they have four children, but none of their children live with them because they are already married.

Ángel is a farmer and makes a living by selling corn, beans, sesame, greens and some vegetables. He has made a living from this business for the last 44 years; he learned this business from his father. Ángel does not have any other businesses, as only with agriculture has he been able to get his family ahead. The place where he plants is close to his house. One of his grandsons is involved in his work, and his work schedule is approximately 5 to 6 hours a day.

Ángel needs the loan to buy a milk cow to have another source of food for his family and to take advantage of what is left over from his agricultural production. Ángel dreams of having a business that provides him and his family with what they need, and he also wants his grandchildren to study and graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, 28, started farming approximately six years ago, and although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His one and a half-acre of land is located in the Kitale area of Kenya, and houses poultry and dairy cows. Erick passionately loves poultry farming. The Kitale area is populated, and has a ready market for poultry products.

However, Erick's biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry. Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large-scale farmer to benefit from it. Through the loan, Erick will be able to sell eggs, meat, and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people. This can be proved when you visit fast food joints in his area.

Erick has been facing challenges accessing finances, but he feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Erick chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low, and is on a reducing basis. He underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, Erick's income will increase and his life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for his family and a positive impact to the community.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Wyclif

texts.en:
Wyclif is an enterprising 29-year-old, farmer from the Magwawa, Nyamira, area of Kenya. He is the hardworking, energetic father of three children. For the past five years he has been a farmer, gaining a lot of practical experience in doing so. Through his farming income he has always assured his family of a decent meal and other basic needs.

Wyclif is now applying for a 40,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy seeds and to move into horticultural farming. Magwawa area has good weather patterns and conditions that support farming activities. It has good roads and a good transportation network. With these favorable conditions, he is sure that he will be able to increase his business and reap the maximum in profits.

Being a smallholder farmer and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Wyclif feels relieved knowing there are institutions that help enterprising men like him. He is very disciplined with his finances and hopes that through his accumulated profits he will be able to improve his living conditions, and also secure the future of his children. Lend to him to keep his big smile!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Zoila Noemi

texts.es:
El Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el mismo existe el Recinto Unión Bolivarense un lugar  tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy unida y trabajadora. 
En este Recinto vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos la señora Zoila una mujer luchadora que junto a  su esposo trabajan por sacar adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la producción de cerdos tienen varios años de experiencia en esta actividad a la misma le dedican un promedio de 6 horas diarias también se dedican a la producción de leche son una familia muy unida.
La señora Zoila solicita este crédito para ampliar y dar mantenimiento a sus chancheras ya que tiene mucha demanda y necesita ampliar su negocio. 
Desea con esta inversión mejorar sus ingresos económicos para poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y por sus hijos quienes son su razón de seguir adelante.
La señora Zoila agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando para salir adelante y poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The San Miguel de los Bancos district is located in the northwest of the Pichincha province. In it, is the Unión Bolivarense enclosure, a calm place of warm humid climate. Its people are very close and hard working.

In this enclosure lives Mrs. Zoila with her husband and her five children. She is a born fighter who, along with her husband, works to sustain her family. She makes a living from pig production. They have several years of experience in this work, in which they spend an average of 6 hours daily. They also make a living from milk production.

They are a very close family. Mrs. Zoila requests this loan to expand and maintain her pigsty given she has high demand and needs to expand her business.

With this investment, she would like to improve her income so she can help her husband with the home expenses, and for her children who are her reason to get ahead. Mrs. Zoila thanks Kiva for the support and the opportunity that they are giving her to get ahead and be able to have a better future.

loans.use: to expand the pigsty and buy feed so her income will grow and she will be able to help her kids with their studies.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado desde hace 13 años, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también vende pan y juntos tienen 3 hijos.

Juan, se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce y francés, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 17 años y este trabajo lo aprendió cuando trabajo en una panadería familiar, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia, antes era agricultor pero los ingresos no eran sufrientes; su pequeña panadería está a 4 cuadras de su casa.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura y latas para la elaboración de pan para mejorar las ventas.

Juan, sueña con tener un lugar propio donde tener su negocio, porque actualmente está alquilando; y aparte de eso también desea que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en: Juan is 31 years old, he studied up to the sixth grade. He has been married for 13 years, his partner looks after the housework and also sells the bread. They have 3 children. Juan makes a living from baking baguettes and pastry. He has been in this business for the past 17 years and he learned his trade working in a family bakery. He decided to go into this business because he could not find other means to support his family. Previously he worked in agriculture but his income was inadequate. His small bakery is located 4 blocks away from his house.  Juan needs this loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast and tins for baking bread to increase sales. Juan dreams of having a place of his own to run his business, he is renting at the moment. In addition he wants his children to be able to study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and tins for baking bread which will improve sales.

loans.name: Edy Marisol

texts.es: Edy es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a cuidar de su tienda de productos básicos, actividad que lleva realizando durante muchos años. Ella es madre soltera, pero eso no le impide sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos dos varones de 16 y 11 años y una niña de 11 años de edad, a los que apoya en sus estudios. Edy desea aumentar los productos que ofrece en su tienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a  FUSAI para invertir en: lácteos, embutidos, granos básicos, detergente, huevos, entre otros productos para su tienda.
texts.en: Edy is an enterprising woman who makes a living with her store selling staple products. She has had this business for many years. She is a single mother, but this has not prevented her from getting her three children ahead; she has two sons, ages 16 and 11, and an 11-year-old daughter, who she supports in their studies. Edy wants to increase the products she offers at her store, so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in dairy products, sausages, basic grains, detergent, and eggs, among other products for her store.

loans.use: to invest in dairy products, sausages, basic grains, detergent, and eggs, among other products for her store.

loans.name: Marcelino Manuel

texts.es:
Marcelino es veterano de 63 años de edad un hombre que toda su vida ha estado ligado al campo, trabajando desde muy joven en las actividades agropecuarias, vive en unión libre con su pareja, se dedica principalmente al cultivo pero también tiene unos animales para vender.
Este hombre humilde, carismático, pujante, sale diariamente a trabajar a primera hora, dedica 8 horas a su cultivo, su propósito es mejorar las condiciones de vida, tener un alimento en su mesa y más importante no pasar necesidades.
Marcelino solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agropecuarios, los cuales necesita con urgencia para abonar sus terrenos, no lo ha podido hacer ya que no cuenta con el dinero, para él es muy importante este paso ya que le permitirá tener una cosecha abundante y de calidad. 
Marcelino desea tener buena salud, que sus manos no le fallen, ya que con ellas seguirá trabajando hasta el final de sus días por llevar el alimento a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a 63 year-old veteran, a man who has been linked to the fields for all his life, working in agriculture from a very young age. 
He is living in a union with his partner. Primarily he is cultivating but he also has animals to sell.
This humble, charismatic, vigorous man is leaving early in the morning every day to mind his crops for 8 hours. His goal is to improve the living conditions, have food on his table and, most important, not to lack basic necessities.
Marcelino is requesting a loan to buy agriculture inputs, which he needs urgently to manure his fields. He hasn´t been able to do it yet, because he didn´t have the money. This step is very important for him, because it will allow him to have a rich harvest with a good quality. 
Marcelino wishes to remain in good health, that his hands may not fail, since with them he will go on working till the end of his days to bring home food for his family.

loans.use: to manure his fields, which is very urgent

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a rural smallholder farmer in Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has 14 children. Peter does dairy, poultry, horticulture and tree farming for food and income. He enjoys farming for it is his means of securing the basic necessities for life for his family.

Peter is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest.

The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Esmeralda Marisabel

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 41 años de edad, está casada, tienen dos hijos, uno de 17 años que estudia bachillerato y uno de 8 años que estudia segundo grado, ella se graduó de licenciatura en laboratorio clínico, gracias al apoyo de sus padres y su esposo tiene un cafetín donde vende comida rápida. 

Esmeralda, tiene un laboratorio clínico donde realiza exámenes básicos y tiene 8 años de dedicarse a prestar este servicio, por eso ya tiene una buena clientela.- Ella nunca pensó en ser empleada, siempre tuvo como visión tener su propio laboratorio y fue con mucho esfuerzo que lo logró; el laboratorio lo tiene en su casa y paga a una asistente para que le ayude con el trabajo y su horario de atención al público es de 8:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. 

Esmeralda, necesita el préstamo para comprar equipo clínico para el laboratorio, porque ha firmado contratos para realizar exámenes a un grupo de niños y necesita tener todo lo necesario para poder realizarlo; con esta ayuda podrá  comprar equipo moderno, con el cual podrá realizar de manera más eficiente los trabajos del laboratorio. 

Los sueños de Esmeralda son, poder tener un laboratorio de referencia, donde puedan realizar exámenes a otros laboratorios; pero también sueña con que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales al igual que ella.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 41 years old. She is married and has two children. One is 17 years old and is in high school. The other is 8 years old and is in the second grade. Esmeralda graduated with a license as a laboratory clinician, thanks to the support of her parents. Her husband has a cafe where he sells fast food.

Esmeralda has a clinical laboratory where she does basic testing. She has worked at this job for 8 years, and now has a good clientele. She never envisioned herself as an employee. Her vision always was to have her own laboratory, and with great effort, she achieved it. The laboratory is in her home, and she pays an assistant to help her with the work. She is open to the public from 8:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

Esmeralda needs the loan to buy clinical equipment for her laboratory, because she has entered into contracts to do testing for a group of children, and needs everything necessary to carry them out. With this help, she will be able to buy modern equipment to do her lab work in a more efficient manner. Esmeralda's dream is to have a reference laboratory, where she can do testing for other labs. She also dreams that her children will be able to be professionals like she is.

loans.use: to buy clinical equipment for her laboratory.

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en: Mahasen is 50, married, and has 2 sons and one daughter. Her husband works in one of the farms in the neighboring villages with a very small income. She started a small grocery store project to help her husband with the family income. She previously requested 3 consecutive loans and successfully repaid all of them on due dates. She is requesting another loan 12,000 EGP to start a small fattening project because she has good experience in this field and because it is easy for her to run both projects at the same time. She will use the milk, cheese and butter for sale and for domestic use.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
La socia Rosmery  sigue  dedicándose al negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ladrillos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosmeri continues in her business selling construction materials. She is an entrepreneurial woman, who through her business hopes to obtain more earnings in order to continue supporting her family. She has worked in this business for years, and things are going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. In this way she moves her family forward.

Rosmeri seeks a loan to buy bricks among other things. She is grateful for the loan offered to her and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy bricks among other things.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina continua con su negocio de materiales de construcción, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ladrillos entre otros.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Las Hormiguitas communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. Paulina continues in her construction materials business. She is an entrepreneurial woman who through her business hopes to to be able to obtain greater income in order to continue supporting her family.

Paulina has worked at her business for years, and things are going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is thankful for the loan offered to her, and promises to comply with the required payments. She seeks the loan to buy bricks among other things.

loans.use: to buy bricks among other things.

loans.name: David

texts.en: Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet David, a 25-year-old father who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth. David is a father of two lovely children who he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. David hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. David never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. David started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, he has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. David practices mixed farming on his farm, and through the profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs and give his children a good education because he believes that education is the only “key to success”. David is a man who is very enterprising. He is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, David wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like David to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. David hopes that through the loan, he will improve his living conditions. David's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, he will be able to assure his children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives in a humble home in the town of Siongiroi, along with her husband and four children. She is a rural farmer from an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Mercy works with a great deal of determination, for many hours, on her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support. Mercy has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry.

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Mercy said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back." Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Because of this challenge, Mercy formed a group and is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Mercy is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer.

Help out this humble smallholder farmer with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 23 years old, strong, full of energy, and hardworking. He hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. Through practicing dairy and crop farming, he has always been able to provide food for his family and also meet their basic needs. He has acquired much experience over the last three years, and this has helped him earn profits. He is seeking a loan for KES 40,000 to buy poultry and, through the loan, he is sure that he will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Nyamira which is densely populated and has a ready market for eggs and poultry. Because of the immense knowledge that Evans has, and also because of the good will he enjoys with the villagers, he will not have any challenge in selling his products. He also believes that through word of mouth he will be able to get more customers and increase his customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Evans and his family, and this will also allow him to make permanent changes to his life and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is an ambitious, 43-year-old lady from the Nganga location, which is a luxuriant maize producing region in the central province of Kenya. Harriet is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and take on new challenges. These qualities have propelled her to become one of the most respected farmers in her village.

She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Harriet is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows that she has named them, which makes Harriet very proud and she feels fulfilled.

Harriet is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for her child. She believes that the knowledge and skills her child will get from school will help her child in the future, because her child will have a brighter future. Donate $25 towards this loan and empower a child’s life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her 9 children. Kiva lenders! Meet Jane, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 47 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Chepchoina, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Jane is content with the farming way of life. Jane is a very enterprising woman and, although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and has always provided her children and family with a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. With good roads, good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Being an elderly woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Jane feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Jane is well disciplined with finances and she plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children with her accumulated profit.

Please help Jane so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, 38, has been farming for the past 10 years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. 

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Julia could increase her profits by satisfying the demand. Julia believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. Julia also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Julia to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married mother of four children. She keeps cattle and poultry for milk, eggs, and meat. On her piece of land, you will also find a granary, cereals, and trees.

To make better income, Esther engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the ten years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Since she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, Esther prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to build her inventory by buying more cereal produce from local farmers at competitive prices. She will use her understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell later at a profit.

Your loan will help local farmers selling to Esther to focus on production, rather than sales. Esther’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 38-year-old, mixed-farmer, based in Chebunyo, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Richard is a proud father of three school-going children whom he truly loves and greatly adores. Richard describes his upbringing as challenging, so he is doing everything in his power to provide a good foundation for his children and to help secure their future. Richard has been farming for over ten years. Over the years, he has gained much experience and is now considered to be one of the best farmers in his village because of the immense knowledge he possesses. Since he has excess food for dairy cattle and enough space on his land, Richard has always wanted to buy another dairy cow, but his challenge is a lack of finances. That is why Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men, like Richard, to turn their dreams into reality. Richard believes the loan will help him to satisfy the demand for milk in his area and enable him to realize his dream of developing his business into a large enterprise. Many men in Siongiroi are responsible for not only producing food, but also feeding their family and parents. Richard wants to provide all of the basic needs that his children and parents require. Richard is very disciplined with his finances and he knows that, with the accumulated profits, he will be able to fully repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 46, is a charismatic, hardworking woman who has always enjoyed working independently, managing her time and being on her mixed farm. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained a lot of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and have extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and stated that the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Jane's biggest challenge is meeting the very high demand. She lacks funds to expand her poultry farming, and is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Accessing funds is very challenging for a woman, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Jane feels relieved knowing that she will be able to buy more poultry and achieve her dream. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profits and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profit and expand her poultry market to other markets, increasing her income and allowing her to improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

This loan will help Jane in her poultry business and in her personal life. This is a great opporunity for her family. Please select this loan now.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty, the will to get ahead and the desire to secure the future of his three children are some of the reasons that made Joseph start practicing mixed farming. Joseph is a youthful, 38-year-old farmer from Saiwa, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya where people live in mud houses.

According to the smallholder farmers, the people of Saiwa are forgotten by the county government of Kitale. But within the remote village of Saiwa, Joseph is working hard to pull himself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Joseph as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that he has despite personal challenges and because of his passion to support his three children as a primary caregiver. Joseph started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of his parents, who were dedicated to their farm, he has grown the business dramatically. He has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. He keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize and beans. He takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population. Joseph is seeking a loan to purchase more land. His operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Joseph will have more space to expand his business output. The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable him to repay the loan, buy food for his family, and pay fees for his three children who are in public schools. He feels blessed to have the support of his wife, through all his undertakings.

Make a $25 loan, and push Joseph's dream closer to reality. Joseph can buy more land and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Verónica sigue con su negocio de venta de ladrillos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar  cemento entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the Las Hormiguitas communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. Verónica continues in her business selling bricks. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes through her work to be able to increase her earnings in order to continue supporting her family. She has worked in the business for years, and things are going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.

Verónica is grateful for the loan offered to her and promises to comply with the required payments. She seeks the loan to buy cement among other things.

loans.use: to buy cement among other things.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is blessed with two children who are her greatest motivation in life. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Catherine was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

Catherine has always had an affinity for farming. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her dairy cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day and this helps her support her family. Catherine also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Catherine is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year and also build a modern house. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Catherine believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Catherine's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Gitimbine in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Hellen is happily married and the proud mother of four children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs and milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available.

Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Hellen to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud countrywoman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Loice is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps cows. Loice has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: "I have to do something for my family."

Loice joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Loice is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Loice to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

For smallholder marginalized women in Kenya, accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle, but Loice feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help smallholder women farmers. The benefits of this loan are many because Loice will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase.

Loice is a smallholder woman who is making a change for herself and for others and she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Loice will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Debulah

texts.en:
Debulah is a married mother of five lovely children. To help her husband provide for the family, she ventured into farming five years ago. Currently, she keeps cows and poultry on her farm for milk, meat, and eggs.

She also makes extra money arranging the logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers. She understands that for this business to be successful, she needs to rely on two things: relationships and capital. She has been able to build strong relationships in the five years she has been farming, but what she seems to be lacking is capital to secure cereal.

Debulah is seeking a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy cereals. She plans to use the money to buy more cereal produced by local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. The impact of your loan will be twofold. Smallholder farmers selling to Debulah will be relieved of the burden of selling, which will help them to focus more on production. Debulah’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and this will go a long way to elevate their livelihood and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Kapsanai is a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya where most of the villagers suffer from poverty. Regina is a smallholder farmer from Kapsanai who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal businesses.

The Kapsanai area has a high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from her region, Regina finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farm, so she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being from a marginalized community, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and she will be able to buy more poultry.

With the loan, she will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

The extra income will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children. Her adorable children mean everything to her, and she dreams that one day, when the business gets more successful, she can leave it to them so that they keep with the tradition.

You can help Regina to achieve all the goals that she has with a loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 33 years of age. She has dedicated her body and soul to her farming business and to her husband.

Joan has been characterized by her neighbours and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began five years ago.

Joan is tired of working just to survive and wishes to request a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Joan’s family, and a commodity for trade.

Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers, like Joan, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.

loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting and for feeding her family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is an energetic, smallholder farmer; a person who always has a smile drawn on her face. Fifteen years ago Jane started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Ngeria, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of six children sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and also to build a green house. Through the dairy unit loan, she will have a humble time milking and feedingher cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. The greenhouse loan will enable her to plant vegetables and tomatoes under controlled conditions, hence increasing productivity on her farm.

Jane believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change, because she is going to have an increase in milk production, vegetables and tomatoes. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows, because she lacked a good dairy unit. With your support, this mum will be able to fulfill her dreams. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit and a green house.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 3 children, she has been selling eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland.

The Saiwa, Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Cecilia finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

Cecilia is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and she looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her poultry farm.

Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en:
Vibian is on the verge of establishing one of her most cherished dreams of increasing her poultry business. She is a very hard-working, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Ndorio, a remote village in the Nandihills area of Kenya. Vibian is happily married and is blessed with two adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, Vibian has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and to earn extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Vibian finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is "the increased profits I enjoy". Vibian’s biggest challenge is meeting the high level of demand.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and is therefore seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. As a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she is relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, Vibian will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market. This will translate into increased profits and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, Vibian intends to accumulate more profit and increase her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she earns will be used to fully repay the loan, to permanently change her living conditions and to secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Meet Martina, a young farmer from Nandihills County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been sales of milk, eggs, and a variety of crops that she plants.

Martina passionately loves farming and has been able to earn a decent income through hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills, and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and the local market. With your loan, Martina will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. She believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds.

There is no doubt that through your loan, Martina's life is permanently going to change, and she will ensure her school-going children have a secure future.

Help Martina with the loan she needs and allow her to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, (a dark skinned lady) is a 29-year-old, farmer from a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family of four children. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Rosa passionately loves dairy farming.

She is seeking a loan to pay tuition fees for her children. Education in Kenya has become expensive and it’s now considered a thing for the rich people, but through caring partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, Rosa is assured that she will be able to send her children to school. Education is key in succeeding, and through this loan Rosa will assure her children of a brighter future. Thanks to your support, Rosa’s children will succeed in making their dreams come true. Take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to pay school fees for her four children.

loans.name: Dúo Prosperidad Y Victoria Group

texts.es: Dúo Prosperidad y Victoria la Señora Esperanza de 28 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos vive en la comunidad de patzun Chimaltenango es confeccionista y tiene otras personas que la ayudan además vende telas para mantel, para cortinas y mas le gusta la venta y además tiene que cubrir sus gastos ya que sus hijos son pequeños necesitan para sus estudios su meta es darles todo lo que necesiten darles sus estudio y cuando sean grandes ellos también sean responsables y trabajadores, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
From the Prosperidad y Victoria duo, Esperanza is 28 years old. She is single and has 2 children. She lives in the Patzún community in Chimaltenango. She is a seamstress and has other people who help her. She also sells fabrics for table cloths and curtains, and prefers sales. She has to cover her family's costs, as her children are young and need money for schooling. Her goal is to provide them everything they need, give them schooling, so that when they are grown they will also be responsible and hard workers.

She is seeking this loan to buy raw materials to make items of clothing.

loans.use: to buy raw material for sewing.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
The majority of young people struggle to make their way in this world because they lack employment and money. This was true for Lena, who is based in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She has now been practicing mixed farming for the past three years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet.

Lena passionately loves dairy farming and, when asked what is most enjoyable about it, she stated, “Feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. Lena sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed that will produce between ten and twenty liters of milk a day.

This extra production will immediately translate to higher profit margins and increased income levels. The profit from selling the extra milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase Lena's business enterprise.

Lena is very visionary and she intends, in the near future, to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling it. She also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, Lena will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

Please help her now with the loan and see how her dreams become reality.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Improving her quality of life is the simple desire that motivates Lydia to get up every day and work. She is a woman of 51 years of age. She is from the remote village of Nkuene, situated in the central province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough, because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Lydia's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Lydia made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities. The additional income from the expansion will go to Lydia's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming expensive. With your loan, Lydia’s children will acquire a quality education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
29-year-old Marion has never set foot in any higher learning institution, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with one adorable child.

For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, farmers from their village seek technical advice from her on the best dairy farming techniques.

Marion is the breadwinner of her family and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Marion could increase her profits and satisfy existing demand. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Marion, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Marion believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will bring about a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Marion to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a forty-four year old charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Eunice is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Eunice makes a commission on managing the logistics of sales between local farmers and their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Eunice can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy more cereal produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Eunice's clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Eunice a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Mary started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Tebwo, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of five children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Mary believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Mary patiently waits for your kindness. Take action and grant her a loan!

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Bornes, a 40-year-old, farmer from the remote village of Kapsabet, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough, because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections. For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and vegetable produce.

Bornes made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve the education level of her children. Education in Kenya has become expensive, and poor, smallholder farmers such as Bornes are not able to pay for the education of their children. With your loan, Bornes’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future. Be inspired and support her now!

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 33 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Namgoi, a remote village in Nandihills. She is happily married and is blessed with two children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and has stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Accessing funds as a woman is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market increasing her profit margins and providing an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, Margaret intends to accumulate more profit. The extra income she will earn will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and in securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Yennir Leticia

texts.es:
Yennir es una mujer de 35 años de edad es soltera vive junto  a su linda familia en una comunidad denominada Santo Tomas La Unión.
Yennir para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes con este negocio lleva ella 14 años de realizarlo, su negocio se encuentra ubicando en el parque central de su comunidad.
Yennir con el afán de mejorar su calidad de servicio a decido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más de productos de abarrotería, pues sus clientes han aumentado en estos días y su producto ya no se da abasto. Su mayor sueño es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yennir is a 35-year-old woman who is single, and lives with her lovely family in a community called Santo Tomas La Union.

In order to be able to earn an income and raise her family, Yennir works in the purchase and sale of groceries.  She has been in this business for 14 years.   Her business is located in the central park of her community.

In an effort to improve the quality of her services, Yennir decided to request a loan to purchase more grocery store products, as customers have increased these days and she doesn't have enough product.

Her biggest dream is to strengthen her business and have better income.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena desea terminar su proyecto de concluir con la construcción de una vivienda para alquilarla y poder generar un segundo ingreso a su familia. Para esto necesita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000) dinero que usará para la compra y colocación de vidrios, instalación eléctrica y demás detalles necesarios para la conclusión de dicho proyecto.
texts.en: Rosa Elena wants to finish her project of completing the construction of a home to rent, in order to generate a second income for her family.  For this she needs a loan of one million fifty thousand colones (₡ 1 050 000), money she will use to buy and install glass, and install electricity and other necessary details for the conclusion of this project.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her two children, she has been selling eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland.

The Nandi Hills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate into increased profit and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, to permanently change her living conditions and to secure the future of her school-going children.

Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is honest and an eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. She resides in Gatongu, a remote village in the lush hills of Nyahururu, in the central region of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and crops. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is the lack of funds.

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that.

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. Ann is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Ann’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family. You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Lilian. She comes from Kericho where she lives with her lovely husband and two kids. Lilian has been a mixed-farmer for five years. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, crops and a side hustle business. She is most passionate about horticulture farming.

Lilian is seeking a loan to invest in the expansion of her horticulture farm. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Lilian will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children a proper education.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is honest and an eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. She resides in Olessos, a remote village in the lush hills of Nandi Hills, in the famous Rift Valley region of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and crops. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is the lack of funds.

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that.
