Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. Viola is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Viola’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family.

You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en: Rabab is a 29-year-old, married mother of one child, who opened almost a year ago woman accessories and shoes shop. She works to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Today, Rabab is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to increase and diversify her business merchandise with a more-requested accessories to satisfy her customers' needs and attract new ones. Rabab hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with requested accessories to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia es soltera no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, donde se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir (polleras de 5 paños), los mismos que entrega en mercados y también manda a comunidades. La Sra. Virginia por referencia de sus padres es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable. La Sra. Virginia solo estudio hasta primaria ya que tuvo que trabajar desde adolescente para ayudar a sus padres que se vinieron a la ciudad de Sucre, entro a trabajar a varios talleres de costura donde aprendió la costura y elaborar polleras, hace unos tres años aproximadamente empezó a hacer sola la confección de polleras, esto le ayudo bastante para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus padres. La Sra. Virginia requiere el préstamo para la compra de una máquina de costura y herramientas menores como listones para realizar mayores trabajos en costura de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y poder armar ya un pequeño taller de confección de ropa.
texts.en:
Virginia is single with no children. She currently lives in her parents' home, where she works making clothes (5-cloth skirts) which she delivers to markets and also sends to communities. Virginia, by her parents' reference, is a very hardworking and responsible person. She only studied up to elementary as she had to work since she was a teenager to help her parents who came to the city of Sucre.

Virginia went to work in several sewing workshops where she learned to sew and make skirts. Approximately three years ago, she started making skirts on her own. This helped her enough to improve her income and help her parents. She needs the loan to buy a sewing machine and minor tools such as slats to make greater sewing work and thus improve her income and be able to put together a small tailoring workshop right away.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and minor tools to expand her work and thus improve her income and put together a small tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Neltji

texts.en:
Neltji is a 57 year old woman who is married to Simon, a 57 year old retired man. They are blessed with a daughter, already married and a son is still enrolled at college. Neltji owns a business of selling kind of cakes. She started the business 5 months ago. She sells it at offices and schools as well. She operates the business for 6 days per week at 2pm to 5pm. In addition, she also receives order for birthday party and events. This business aims to help her husband in generating more income and to provide a good education for their son.


She wishes to produce more kind of cakes. Fortunately, a neighbor shared the information about TLM loan product so she thought this is a good chance for her to improve her business. therefore she requested a loan of IDR 2,500,000 from TLM to buy the baking ingredients such as flour, sugar, eggs, butter, etc. She is sure the loan from Kiva, via TLM will encourage her for a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy the baking ingredients such as flour, sugar, eggs, butter, etc

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María, de 64 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, no estudio porque su familia vivía en extrema pobreza y tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven; está acompañada, tuvo tres hijas, pero todas ya se casaron y viven en sus propias casas, en su casa solo vive su pareja y su nieto.

María, tiene una tienda desde hace 6 años en un centro escolar de su comunidad, en donde vende sodas, panes, galletas, entre otros productos, este negocio lo inicio porque no tenía otra forma de generar ingresos para su familia; ella sale dos veces por semana a comprar mercadería para su tienda y recorre 29 kilómetros en bus, para llevar los productos hasta su casa.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos como azúcar, aceite, pan, arroz, frijoles, entre otros para mejorar el inventario de su tienda y asegurar más ingresos para su negocio.

María, sueña con tener una tienda fuerte para poder tener más ingresos y apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old and is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person. She was unable to study because her family lived in extreme poverty and she had to work from when she was very young. She is in a common law relationship and had three daughters, but they are all now married and live in their own homes. Only her partner and and her grandson live in her home.
María has had a store for 6 years in a leaning centre in her community, where she sells soda, bread and cookies, among other products. She began this business because she did not have another form of generating income for her family. She goes to buy merchandise for her store twice a week and travels 29 kms on the bus to bring the products to her home.
María needs a loan to buy products, such as sugar, oil, bread, rice and beans, among other products to improve her store's inventory and to secure more income for her business.
María dreams of having a strong business to be able to have a better income and support her partner with the expenses of the home.

loans.use: to buy products, such as sugar, oil, bread, rice and beans, among other products to improve her store's inventory.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Haruna can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Haruna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sainem

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sainem, who is a married 46-year-old woman with one son and one daughter. Sainem has a small shop, and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of 7,000,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Sainem will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy, sanitary life with clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Mega1 Group

texts.en:
Five hard working ladies, decided to improve their families living. That's why they left their hometown in the Philippines choosing Lebanon as their new home to work hard as housekeepers seeking a better income.

These five ladies decided to hold hands and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, each one to invest in a certain issue he needs to accomplish.
Rowena is the featured borrower of Mega1 group, she is a 46-year-old married mother of six, who is working as a house keeper with a limited monthly salary to support her family back home. Her acquired loan will be sent the Philippine, to pay for her children university education costs. She is the second lady standing from the far right side of the picture.
As for the other members who are acquiring their loans to financially support their families back home, Ginalyn is at the center with a grey top, Daisy is the second lady from the far left side of the picture, Evangeline is the first lady at the far right side of the picture, while Esther is the first art the far left with eyeglasses.

loans.use: pay for her children's university education costs in her hometown in the Philippines.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is going to start new business. She always wanted to have own business and in this way to get ahead. Muhabbat is the married parent of 2 children. Muhabbat’s husband is a master of repairing houses. He has not enough income to provide family with all necessary things. Muhabbat also must earn for living.

She took part in a course “To Get Ahead” of women organization and received a certificate. Muhabbat is going to start a business in animal husbandry. She will buy a cow, feed for some months and sell in a local market. Muhabbat is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a cow. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a cow for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 38 years old and she lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. She is married and she has two daughters and both of them are school-aged. Her husband works at the city’s combine as a mechanic. Ruzanna has musical education and now she works at the city’s musical school as a teacher of piano and canon (Armenian national musical instrument). She and her husband did her best to do some saving and finally repair their house. During summer they managed to finish all the repairing works but with furnishing they have now financial hardships.

This loan of 270.000 Armenian drams Ruzanna needs as she would like to buy a new kitchen for her house making it comfortable and perfect place for making delicious meal for her family.

loans.use: to create a new kitchen for her house, making it a comfortable and perfect place for cooking delicious meals for her family.

loans.name: Jafaru

texts.en:
Jafaru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Jafaru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jafaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Jafaru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Jafaru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Jafaru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Evans, a father of eight from Saiwa, a remote village in the rich highlands of the Kitale area of Kenya. He has spent the past ten years of his life farming. He sells milk, maize, and vegetables produced on his farm. He also engages in personal business to make ends meet.

Evans is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities he involves himself in, dairy farming is the closest to his heart. He enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk his cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutritional value. He is so keen and feels so close to his cows that he has named one of them. Milking one of his cows makes Evans feel very proud and fulfilled.

Dairy farming is a highly profitable business venture and Evans wants to take full advantage of it. He would like to expand his dairy business, but the biggest challenge he faces is lack of capital to grow with. He is requesting a loan which he will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

Evans has planted Napier grass so that feeding the cows will never be a challenge. He also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used once he acquires the additional dairy cow. The exotic cow he will buy will produce between 10 to 15 liters of milk daily, and this will translate to more income and profits.

The profits from milk selling will allow Evans to grow his business further by starting to package the milk and processing it into other dairy products, such as cream. In addition, he will benefit from the organic manure of the cow. He projects that he will be able to start a bio gas plant at his farm, which will save him money in fuel costs.

With your loan, Evans dreams of a secure future for his children. Evans patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Alhaji Sule

texts.en:
Alhaji Sule is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Sule has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Sule would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as cash to purchase food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Sule can store his maize and sell it at a future date for a price that is up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Sule will benefit from marketing support that could help him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Sule is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike (with which to do business).

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusmaiani

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Yusmaiani, who is a 43-year-old widow with two sons and two daughters. Yusmaiani has been selling and crediting clothes for five years. She has asked for a loan of 7,000,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family's income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Yusmaiani will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy, sanitary life with clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a mother of five children. She resides with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, and is an excellent tailor and dress designer. Her work is popular in far off places. She is being supported by her husband, and her income helps to solve several issues at their house.

She applied for a loan so that she could invest more in her business and get a bigger return. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help and support.

loans.use: to invest in her clothing business.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer from Baure village. As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields (up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as cash to purchase food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price (a premium of up to 37% relative to the market price at harvest).

Thanks to support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rabiu no longer feels pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Rabiu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
The Biakoye ( unity ) group is made up of two ladies by the name Lawrenda and Gloria, who work so hard to make a living out of their life.

Lawrenda is 25 years old, single and very humble woman who is so determined to break off the limitations of life, by viewing life from her own perspective, she took advantage of the fashion industry within the locality of Teshie to engage in the selling of clothes, sewing accessories, thread and needles on a retail bases.
Lawrender will use her loan portion to purchase more sewing accessories on a gradual whole sale basis for much income and supply.
The repayment on her previous loan was successful, she therefore promises to repay by the terms and condition applied.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing accessories on a gradual wholesale basis for more income and supply.  .

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has no academic papers to show off, but he is an accomplished farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. He is happily married, and he and his beautiful wife are blessed with three children.

For the past five years he has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge he has on farming, farmers seek advice from him. His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, and some personal businesses he engages in to make extra income.

John sells cereals to his neighbors and to the local market and makes more money, although his work is not without challenges, he says. Nevertheless, he is regarded as the best cereal seller in his village. He has been unable to meet the market demand, which has resulted in a loss of tenders. He is seeking a loan to buy more cereals so that he can satisfy the demand.

He intends to buy different varieties of cereals such as millet, rice, sorghum and maize. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that supports small scale farmers, John is confident that this loan will permanently change his life.

Increased profits from cereal selling will allow him to afford his highest monthly expenses: farm-related comforts and the ability to channel a surplus amount to his children's education. John is a visionary and plans to buy a maize milling machine through accumulated profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 25-year-old married mother of two and a Palestinian refugee. Almost a year ago, she started selling woman accessories from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise with new collection of accessories to satisfy her customers' requests. 
Fatima hopes to keep on expanding her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with new collection of accessories to satisfy her customers' requests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some very basic improvements to the house where she and her husband live

loans.name: Barau

texts.en:
Barau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Barau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Barau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Barau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Barau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Barau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house/ renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is maize farmer from Liman village. As a member of Babban Gona, Rabiu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiu had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. This made it challenging for him to afford necessities such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

Rabiu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, he hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: N.n.k Group

texts.en:
Nawal is the featured borrower for N.N.K Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nawal is a 40-year-old widowed mother of two. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business of selling clothes and accessories to cover the needs and expenses of her family. After her husband passed away, Nawal became her family's only breadwinner. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying hard to provide her family with descent living conditions. She is the first lady on the left. Khadija is the lady sitting in the middle and Noura is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling clothes and accessories to cover the needs and expenses of her family

loans.name: Yanthi

texts.en:
Yanthi is 37 years old and lives with her husband, Samuel, a 46 year old man. To provide daily needs Samuel is working at a local furniture factory but the income generated depend on how many orders they have. They have 4 children who are still enrolled at school.

The situation encourages her to run a modest kiosk business of selling daily household needs, cakes and kind of vegetables such as water spinach, eggplants, spinach, carrots, tomatoes, etc. She has been involved in the business for the last 5 years. It is open from 6am to 8pm. With the income from the business she manages to cover the family’s daily living.

Now she plans to provide more stock in her kiosk business such as noodles, coffee, sugar, tea, soaps and flavoring ingredients. When a neighbor shared about the TLM loan product, Yanthi then applied a loan of IDR 2,000,000.

She is optimistic the loan provided by Kiva, through TLM would be beneficial for her business ahead.

loans.use: to buy more stock in her kiosk business such as noodles, coffee, sugar, tea, soaps and flavoring ingredients

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en: Kristina wants to buy another dairy cow. With her previous loan, she purchased her first dairy cow. Kristina told the Branch Assistant, "Our life has gotten better with the addition of the dairy cow. We have now a bit more money because we sell raw milk now. I have also added a few more orchards, including fig and walnut trees."

loans.use: To add another dairy cow

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could help him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to contribute to the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en:
Talatu is maize farmer from Bazai village. As a member of Babban Gona, Talatu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, she has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Talatu had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for her immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Talatu can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

Talatu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, she hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel es soltero actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, solo tiene un hijo pero no vive con él, solo los fines de semana lo ve, pues su madre trabaja en provincia y solo lo puede llevar a la ciudad fin de semana. El Sr. Manuel muy joven empezó a trabajar en varios talleres de Metal Mecánica donde aprendió de soldadura y luego entro a capacitarse en un Centro de capacitación donde aprendió más de Metal Mecánica, en el mismo centro ha realizado varios trabajos pues se hizo  conocer por el buen trabajo y la responsabilidad con la que realiza dichos trabajos. El Sr. Manuel improviso un pequeño taller en la casa de sus padres en la terraza pero no tiene suficiente espacio para que agarre trabajos grandes, por lo que su padre esta haciendo terminar un cuarto grande en su casa en la planta baja el cual le ha ofrecido para que ponga un taller, por lo que el Sr. Manuel solicita el préstamo para la compra de equipos y herramientas de soldadura y material para que pueda hacer todos los trabajos que le soliciten. El equipar bien su taller le generara mayores ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is single and currently living in his parents' home. He has only one child but does not live with him. He only sees him on the weekends because his mother lives in the country and can only take him to the city on the weekend.

As a very young man Manuel started working in various machine shops where he learned to solder. He later went to a training center and learned more about machining. He has completed several projects at that same center where he is known for the good work and responsible manner with which he completed his projects.

Manuel set up a small workshop on his parents' patio but he does not have enough room to tackle large jobs so his father is having a room built on the ground floor which he has offered to Manuel to use as a shop. That is why Manuel is requesting this loan to buy soldering equipment, tools and supplies so that he can take on all the jobs that are offered to him. A well equipped shop will generate more income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soldering equipment, tools and supplies to get more work in order to generate more income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 60, is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is located in the North Rift region of Kenya. It is characterized by good weather and rolling hills. Agriculture is the thriving economic activity in the area.

John ventured into farming 20 years ago. His primary income source is crops. John enjoys his farming business mostly because it’s profitable. He spends a lot of time looking after animals. He is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 for buying seeds to expand his horticulture farm.

By scaling up the business, he will relatively reduce production costs and increase output. He is a very hardworking smallholder farmer who has set out to achieve big things in his life. With your loan investment, John will grow successful.

His strategy is to use the returns from the investment to pay for more farm inputs, the lack of which is a major problem that leads to the closing down of many farms due to poor quantity and quality of yields. If he makes a surplus, he plans to plough the profits back into the business since his lifestyle is not so demanding.

Through the loan, John will attain food security in his house and also improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds to expand his horticultural farm.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 50 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Rosario has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, rice, etc. Rosario has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Levi. He is a 25-year-old farmer from Kimase village, situated in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and two children on a small piece of land where he keeps cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops.

For five years, his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases.

Levi made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime this month, he applied for a loan for buying seeds to expand his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output.

The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. With your loan, Levi's children will acquire a good quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand his horticulture farming

loans.name: Megan Myer

texts.en:
Megan Myer is 31 years old, and has three children. Megan Myer is married and her three children are in school.

Megan Myer is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Megan Myer requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Megan Myer has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Megan Myer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mbembani Central S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Ronald is shown here, raising his hand in the photo. He is a 50-year-old married man with four children, three of whom are in school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from their trainings, especially the enterprise development training.

Ronald is a dairy farmer and he earns income from milk sales. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy cattle feed and dairy supplements that will increase his milk production. This will increase his income and he will be able to pay for his children's school fees, afford quality health care, and provide better housing for his family.

Ronald is grateful to Kiva for enabling him to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and dairy supplements to increase milk production and earn income to pay for school fees, provide better housing, and gain access to quality health care services.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man who describes himself as honest. He operates a posho mill where he sells flour. His primary customers are locals. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Tomasa Claire

texts.en:
Tomasa Claire is 36 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Tomasa Claire works very hard to provide for them.

Tomasa Claire runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other products. Tomasa Claire has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Tomasa Claire would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other products.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Vilma has a weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials for her business, like abacca and silk, and to pay for maintenance.

Vilma has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business, like abacca and silk, and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Narina

texts.en:
Narina is 42 years old, and married with three children. One child is still in school. Narina works very hard to provide for them.

Narina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products. Narina has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Narina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a farmer based in Keiyo village in the North Rift region of Kenya. He is married to a lovely wife, and they have three sweet looking children.

Felix may be new to fatherhood, but he is a farming veteran. He has been doing this work for the past 10 years. The vegetables and maize that he grows on his two-acre farm provide him with a reliable income. He also sells milk and eggs from the animals he keeps, and he has a side hustle business (shop).

Felix enjoys looking after his cow. He also spends a lot of time on his maize farm. He makes good money selling milk and maize. The problem is that he has limited land to expand this operation. Felix is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 for leasing land and buying fertilizer.

The additional land he will acquire through a lease agreement will give him enough space to plant more crops. Since he will be scaling up, he will also rely on the loan to buy farm inputs that do not come cheap, such as fertilizer.

When asked how this loan will be of benefit to his family, Felix replied, "My nuclear family will have a chance to enjoy better standards of living because of enhanced cash flows."

loans.use: To lease land and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Being a famer on the rice field near her house, Sokhom, who is a 43-year-old married woman with five children, can only make $4 USD per day to support her family. Sokhom resides in a rural area of Ba Phnum, Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 23 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is widowed. She is the caring mother of 2 children, a boy and a girl. Dilorom is going to start a new business venture producing biscuits. With this goal in mind, she took a course through a women's organization, “To Get Ahead”, and she earned her certificate.

Dilorom plans to buy an oven, flour, sugar, milk, and butter to bake biscuits, rolls, and other items. She will sell her products in a local market. Dilorom will manage her business alone. She is asking for a loan of 1,900 Somoni to buy an oven for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy an oven for starting her new business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a Kiva borrower. She has 1 child. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for the past 3 years and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the 21,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, and other items. In the future, she hopes to have a wholesale business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and she successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Doña Adriana es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja en la planta de lácteos que junto con su familia construyeron con mucho esfuerzo. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de una máquina descremadora, esto con el fin de desarrollar su trabajo de una forma más eficiente y poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Doña Adriana is an entrepreneur woman who works in the dairy plant that was built by her family with a lot of effort. She is requesting a loan for one million colones (₡ 1 000 000), to purchase a skimming machine, with the purpose of making the job more efficient and to be able to increase the sales.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy skimming machine.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is a married woman, 60 years old, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cloth, thread, and needles and to pay for maintenance for her tailoring machine.

Bernadith has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and needles and to pay for maintenance for her tailoring machine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and married and has eight children. Three of her children are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 30 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

She is now borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and repair her pigpens. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ellen dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and repair her pigpens.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlie is 27 years old, and her two children are in school.

Merlie has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Merlie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Merlie has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Merlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Magaji has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Magaji had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Talatu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Magaji will benefit from marketing support that could help him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Magaji is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Lucio De Jose

texts.es: Lucio es un hombre de 64 años de edad es un hombre humilde pero muy trabajador, él vive con su esposa y su hija de 32 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 25 años. Lucio se caracteriza por ser un hombre luchador que siempre busca la manera de ganarse la vida, él presta sus servicios en una empresa cercana, además de ser albañil independiente, lo que le permite sostener su hogar. Lucio desea terminar de cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que con el crédito solicitado anteriormente inicio el cambio e hizo otras mejoras, por lo que solicita un crédito a  FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para terminar de cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucio is 64 years old. He is a humble but very hardworking man. He lives with his wife and his 32 year old daughter in a house they own for 25 years. Lucio is characterized by being determined and always looking for a way to earn a living. He offers his services to a nearby company in addition to working independently as a builder, which allows him to support his household.

Lucio would like to finish replacing the roof of his house. With the loan he received previously he started replacing the roof and he made other improvements. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: corrugated metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire to finish replacing the roof of his home.

loans.use: to purchase: corrugated metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to finish replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man with 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, flour, soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and his primary customers are locals. He says his biggest business challenge is inflation. Joseph will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is a maize farmer from Jalawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Barnabas is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Barnabas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Barnabas can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Barnabas no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Barnabas hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina lives in Liquisa. She is married, and every day of her life is busy with her business. She is one of the entrepreneurs, and her business is selling cows and goats.

Her husband has been very supportive of her selling the cows and goats. She started to sell cows and goats a few years ago with her own working capital. So now, she is requesting a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add capital to buy more cows and goats.

She was very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin because she could use this loan to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to  buy cows and goats.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Suzana has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Suzana had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for her immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Suzana can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Suzana will benefit from marketing support that could help her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Suzana is thankful that she has the opportunity to improve the lives of her children and family. She looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Jhonatan  tiene 22 años de edad  y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una fábrica de ladrillos, el  socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
El socio solicita le crédito para comprar  ladrillos entre otros.
El socio  se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank LAS HORMIGUITAS. The bank is located in the Cusco district, province of Cusco and Cusco department.

The member, Jhonatan, is 22 years old and is single. The member alternates his daily activities working in a brick factory. He has been working there for a while and it is going well because of the effort that he puts into his job every day. The member appreciates the loan and he promises to make his payments.

The member is requesting the loan to purchase bricks, among others.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, among others.

loans.name: Menelyn

texts.en:
Menelyn is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines.

Menelyn has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Menelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Gonzalita

texts.en:
Maria Gonzalita is 35 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines.

Maria Gonzalita has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Maria Gonzalita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. He is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in his general store. Arturo has been in this business for eight years. He earns more income from food vending.

He successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business. Arturo has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful to see that the days of poor yields are long gone. Muhammed now has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Traditionally, Muhammed had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Talatu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest..

With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Muhammed has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Chhea's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Chhea is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. In order to support her living conditions, she has been growing rice for 19 years. The crop has been threatened by insects. This causes her to gain a lower output than before, and she is able to earn income of only about 7USD per day. She can save around 2USD each day after her expenses. 

Due to not having enough working capital, she has decided to apply for a loan in order to pay the harvesting fee. This will be the first loan cycle for her group with VisionFund. She hopes that this loan will help her crop to be harvested on time, and to be able to sell it for a better price.

loans.use: to pay the harvesting fee which is expected to enable her to sell her rice crop for a better price.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Yusuf is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Yusuf had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Yusuf can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. With Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yusuf has the potential to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Yusuf is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhazzan

texts.en:
Alhazzan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful to see that the days of poor yields are long gone. Alhazzan now has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Traditionally, Alhazzan had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhazzan can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Alhazzan has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Solomon is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Solomon had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Solomon can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. With Babban Gona’s marketing support, Solomon has the potential to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Solomon is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to expand his farmland. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the potential to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could help him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Samaila is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
The group made their payment. During the loan periods, they can manage the business well. They maintained pigs for fattening and then sold them together to the big buyer.

Ni Komang is very happy because her pigs were healthy and grew and reached their ideal weight. She sold all of them. She kept them for six months and then sold them to another breeder in her village. She used the profit as capital for her pig business.

With the same members, the Gayatri Indah Group are receiving a new loan. To increase the business, the group are asking for the same loan size. The group is receiving 20,000,000 IDR and each member receives 2,000,000 IDR. The loan is being used to purchase piglets and feeds and to renovate the cage.

Ni Komang is using her loan to purchase five superior piglets. She hopes her plans will run well and that she can earn more profit.

The Gayatri Indah Group said they are grateful to the lenders, Kiva and MUK for the loan. Their previous loan has proven to support their income. They promise to use this loan wisely.

loans.use: to purchase five superior piglets.

loans.name: Las Mil Y Una Noche Group

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 5 años y su negocio es la venta de dulces.
Ella es buena madre, honesta y muy optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ ubicado dentro de la zona peri urbana, al sur de la ciudad, creada debido a una riada del río Pirai, en la que más de 3.000 familias quedaron sin hogar.
Blanca es de tez morena, cabello negro azabache largo y baja estatura (la primera de la izquierda, viste chompa negra y polera rosa), su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado, construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. El deseo de mejorar su negocio la impulsó a formar una banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; verdulería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos médicos naturales, taller de reparación de electrodomésticos, servicio de pintura de interiores, frutería y limpieza de ropa. Su negocio es la venta de dulces, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante cargando una canasta llena de dulces y acompañada de sus hijos, “vendo, dulces y golosinas, termino de vender y compro mercadería para el día siguiente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de un puesto fijo de venta. Su sueño es tener un kiosco bien surtido frente al colegio, ella desea comprar un kiosco para vender dulces. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Blanca solicita un préstamo para comprar un kiosco para vender dulces frente al colegio.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 22 year old young woman. She lives with her partner, and has two children, who are 1 and 5 years old. She has a business selling candies.
She is a good mother, honest and very optimistic. Her business is in the neighbourhood "Plan 3000", located in the outskirts of the city, in the south. It was created in response to the flooding of the Pirai River, in which more than 3000 families were left without homes.
Blanca has a dark complexion, long jet black hair and is short. (In the photo, she is the first one on the left, wearing a black sweater and a pink t-shirt.
She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and with her children, who are not yet of school age. They live in a rented room, which is made of brick and has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system.
The desire to improve her business provided the impetus to create the communal bank. The businesses of the members are selling fruit, selling second hand clothing, selling natural medicine, electronics repairs, interior painting service, selling fruit and washing clothing.
Blanca's business is selling candy, which she carries out in the streets, carrying a basket full of candy. Her children accompany her.
"I sell candies and sweets, when I finish selling for the day, I buy merchandise for the next day..." she comments. The advantage of the business is that the sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of a permanent location to sell her products.
Her dream is to have a well stocked kiosk across from a school. She wants to buy a kiosk to sell candies. This is her first loan from the institution in the 5 years that she has been doing this activity.
It is for this reason that Blanca is requesting a loan to buy a kiosk to sell candy across from a school.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk to sell candy across from a school.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a 45-year-old with four children. All of them need her support, and they are dependent on this livelihood. Fishing has been the source of income in most communities in Puntod Lopez, Jaena. Vilma and her husband live in one of those communities and have been engaged in a fishing business. To earn a living, they have been doing this business for 10 years.  Vilma  requesting a loan amount of 4,800 PHP through GDMPC to buy a new fishnet in order to use it in her fishing business. She dreams to uplift her business, to have a better life, and to support her children in their studies. She wants them to finish and become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy new fishnet.

loans.name: Monchelo

texts.en:
Monchelo is 29 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Monchelo works very hard to provide for them. Monchelo runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Monchelo has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, coffee, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Monchelo would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Khoeun's Group

texts.en:
A widowed woman whose name is Khoeun, is 46 years old and resides in a wooden house located in Tbaung Khmum province’s Dambae district. She has a dependent child. Rice farming has been the main source of her income for ages. To earn more income, she has also been raising pigs to sell. She is able to save around 5 USD each day after expenses. Recently, her rice crop was not growing well, which returned lower outputs, and her pigs are also getting sick. These are the main challenges for her business.

Khoeun has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and she repaid her previous loans successfully. With the past loans, she could better afford to buy consumer goods. Now she is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield and the remaining money will be spent on buying piglets. She hopes to gain more output from her farming business, so that she can earn more income to spend on healthcare services for her beloved child and save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield, so that she can earn more income to spend on healthcare service for her beloved child and save for future needs.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau is 47 years old and lives with two children in her own house. She has worked raising broiler chickens for the last 20 years, and in this way has been able to support her family. She sells her products in surrounding towns and already has many established customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and to build a new chicken pen, so that she will have a good space for the chickens and can continue raising them.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and to build a new chicken pen.

loans.name: Suyeang

texts.en: As a cucumber seller at a market in Kang Meas District, Kampong Cham Province, SuyEang, 35 years old, is working very hard with this career near her house. She is a hard-working mother of four children. She can earn approximately 10 USD a day. Being a seller is the main work that she has done for more than 10 years. Currently, she is lacking money to buy some cucumbers to expand her business, but yet she can’t afford. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan, she has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to help them. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some cucumbers to sell in market.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Being a farmer in the rice field near his house, CHEA, who is a 36-year-old married man with two children, can only make 4 USD per day to support his family. CHEA resides in a rural area of Baribour, KAMPONG CHHNANG Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in this career for nearly 20 years. 

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan, since it will promote his health, the environment, and his living standards. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for his house

loans.name: Sabina Cely

texts.en:
Sabina Cely is 60 years old and is married. She has a sari-sari store in front of her house as her source of income. Sabina Cely's husband is a farmer. Their profit from farming and their retailing business serves to maintain their needs.

Sabina Cely wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy grocery items to sell. She will manage her business well for continuous growth of it. Sabina Cely hopes to earn greater profit and to be able to sustain both their household needs and their farm.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Sreykhuoch

texts.en:
A garment worker, Sreykhuoch, is a 21-year-old married woman with a child. Her husband is a construction worker. They make only $10 USD per day to support their family.

Sreykhuoch lives in a rural area of Pea Reang District, Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been a garment worker for nearly four years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will improve her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house.

loans.name: Ma. Jennifer

texts.en:
Ma. Jennifer is a 42-year-old store keeper from Badian, Cebu.  She also engaged in buy and sell of chicken. With her husband's help she started her own business three years ago which gave her an opportunity to provide for her eight children aged one to eighteen. She works hard juggling both her business and looking after her kids. 

She wants to increase her inventory and she is requesting a loan to buy to buy salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste and milk. Ma. Jennifer shared that she will always do anything to help her husband in raising their family.

loans.use: to buy. salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, milk

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes es soltera solo tiene un hijo que depende de ella, vive en casa de sus padres. La Sra. Mercedes trabajo en varios talleres de costura para mantener sola a su hijo ya que el padre del mismo nunca se quiso hacer cargo de ellos y lamentablemente su pequeño se enfermaba mucho, motivo por el cual gastaba bastante dinero en medicinas y tratamientos. Gracias a la ayuda de sus padres no solamente económicamente sino también con el cuidado de su hijo, la Sra. Mercedes pudo trabajar tranquila y fue capacitada en un centro de enseñanza técnica de costura en la cual se especializo en la confección de ropa deportiva, por lo cual recientemente decidió independizarse y abrir su propio taller de costura, por lo que requiere el préstamo para la compra de varias máquinas de costura, entre ellas máquina recta máquina over y otras herramientas pequeñas, también la compra de telas en cantidad para economizar sus gastos, de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su pequeño, también poder compensar a sus padres por todo el apoyo que le dieron.
texts.en:
Mercedes is single and only has one son who depends on her. She lives in her parents' house. Mercedes worked in various sewing shops to support her son by herself because the father never wanted to support them and unfortunately, her son got sick a lot. For this reason she spent a lot of money in medicines and treatments.

Thanks to the help of her parents, not only financially but by helping care for her son, Mercedes was able to work and was trained to sow in a technical school. She specialized in athletic clothing and recently decided to work on her own and open her own sewing workshop.

For this reason she needs the loan, to purchase various sewing machines, among them a straight stitch, an over sewing machine and other small tools. In addition, she will purchase fabric in bulk to save on the expenses. This way she can increase her profits, improve the quality of life for her and her young child and can make it up to her parents for all the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to expand her sewing workshop and to offer athletic clothing to her customers in order to generate income for her son.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Roemarie prays to God that her two children, who are studying in college, will obtain their diplomas and find stable jobs with the aid of her direct selling business. In this way, all the sacrifices of her husband, Renato, who works abroad, will be paid off.

Throughout these years that her husband is away, Rosemarie gets inspiration and strength from her co-fellowship members at CCT. They introduced her to the Kiva program and it brings her better opportunities to avail herself of higher loans to improve her business. Her previous loan, worth PHP 35,000, enabled her to buy more direct selling products and gave her better profits.

This time she applied for PHP 35,000 to buy clothes, footwear, undergarments, umbrellas and personal care products. She trusts that you would help her again because she has been consistent in repaying her previous loans.

Rosemarie is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), which has been operating in Batasan Hills, Quezon City and was able to form several fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. They meet every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Rosemarie is consistent in attending this weekly fellowship because she can draw strength and inspiration from the sharing of testimonies and study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, undergarments, umbrellas and personal care products to sell

loans.name: Female

texts.en:
Fe is 49 years old and married with six children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, etc.

Fe has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jeneth has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, sugar, flour, oil, etc.

Jeneth has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jeneth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, sugar, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 51 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josefina has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Pebrita

texts.en:
Pebrita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pebrita is 57 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Pebrita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.

Pebrita has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en: Manuk is a farmer living with his wife and three minor children in Zarinja village. He keeps cows, calves, pigs and piglets, and some hens. He also cultivates potatoes to sell in the market. The main challenge for his farming business is transportation for traveling to neighboring communities to sell his harvest. Manuk has applied for this loan to purchase 6 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help him sustain his farm and continue to earn a living for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 6 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of 4 children. The income generated by Nasreen's husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses so she started her business of selling milk. She has been in this business for many years and has become famous for providing high-quality milk in her area.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Nasreen has gradually improved her business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits and provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Nasreen aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits and provide her family with life's basic necessities.

loans.name: Nazeer Jan

texts.en:
Nazeer Jan is a mother of seven children, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Nazeer Jan is very concerned about her husband's business. She wants to help her husband's business flourish so that the family's problems -- such as the education of the seven children at home and food for the eight family members -- could be solved with the help of the profits. Her husband would gain these after investing a little more into his business.

She thanks Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan for the help and support.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's cement business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a wise man who is engaged in vending. He is selling blankets, mosquito nets, and pillowcases around villages. He patiently rounds his items to be able to sell more and get greater income. Bernardo has four children and most of them are going to school.

Bernardo desires to give a better way of living to his family, and send them to college. He is doing his best to make sure that he will obtain his desire. With this, Bernardo is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy foam and floor mats to sell. He hopes to sell more and raise his income for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy foam and floor mats to sell.

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita has two children attending school. To make a living, she engages herself in a retailing business. She operates her sari-sari store business in their village. Aside from retailing, Emerlita also engages herself in a vending business. Her husband is a farmer. Through their respective sources of income, they are able to meet their daily needs.

Emerlita wants to extend her stock, but she doesn’t have enough capital to make it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy condiments, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and many more. Emerlita hopes to get greater income she may use for the needs of their farm.

loans.use: to buy condiments, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and many more.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Working as a farmer on the rice field near her house, Pov, is a 20-year-old married woman with a child. Her husband is also a farmer. They make only $10 USD per day to support their family.

Pov lives in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in her career for nearly five years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will improve her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell to her customers.

Wilma has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough money to be able to provide a secure future for her family.
