loans.use: to buy additional fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marivic has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, sugar, rice, oil, flour, etc.

Marivic has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, sugar, rice, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rizalina is 48 years old and her two children are in school.

Rizalina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

Rizalina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell at her fruit stand.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 35 years old. She has dedicated her body and soul to her farming business and to her husband.

Mary has been characterized by her neighbors and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began five years ago.

Mary is tired of working just to survive so she has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will serve as seeds during the planting season, food to feed Mary’s family, and a commodity for trade.

Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal grains from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers like Mary to put cereal profits back into her business and use the money to pay for high overhead costs.

With your support, this mother will be able to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 53 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susan has a general store business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Susan has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta and her family live peacefully in their village. The two children are attending school. She and her husband grow bananas and pineapples on their farm to earn a living.

Violeta would like her pineapples to grow with more vigor and produce better quality fruit to sell at a good price. With this in mind she is humbly asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner ASKI to buy fertilizer for her pineapple crops and to pay for labor to help weed the fields. She will use her earnings to uplift their lives and cover their needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her pineapple crops and to pay for labor to help weed the fields.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 32 years old, married, and has a child. While her husband is working, she engages herself in a retailing business. She is managing her sari-sari store business in their village. She is selling several grocery items like breads, biscuits, and drinks. Sheryl wants to expand her business in able to gain and earn bigger income.

Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, condiments, and biscuits to sell. She will do her best to grow the business, so that she may invest her income to their farm needs.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, condiments, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Annely

texts.en:
Annely is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Annely is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Annely has been raising livestock for the past 9 years, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Annely would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: At the age of 49, Razia is proud to have managed a low-cost school along with her husband for more than a decade. Her husband (also shown in the picture) shares her ambitions to improve access to quality education in their town, which is marked by low literacy rates and a lack of public facilities. The school enrollment stands at 337 and almost 60% of students are female. Discussing the challenges they face while running their school, Razia and her husband state that they are unable to provide sufficient space for their students due to a lack of finances. Razia has requested for a loan of 200,000 RS to build an additional classroom in the school and to purchase some furniture.

loans.use: to build an additional classroom in the school and purchase some furniture.

loans.name: Manolina

texts.en:
Manolina works hard to support her family. Manolina is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Manolina requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Manolina has been in this business for 5 years.

Manolina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Everlyne, a very hardworking and energetic mother of three lovely children. She resides in the Konganyil, Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming activities. She has been doing mixed farming for the past five years and through those years she has gathered much experience with farming techniques. Through the income from farming, she has been able to take care of her family and also provide the basic needs for her children.

Everlyne is a very enterprising mum, and although she never got formal education, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always ensured her family of a decent meal. The Konganyil area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a smallholder farmer and accessing funds is very challenging, but Everlyne feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising mums like her.

Despite the obstacles that have occurred, this smallholder farmer is not giving up. She strives day-to-day to get her family ahead and fulfilled. You can be part of this dream. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Sy

texts.en:
Working as a farmer on the rice field near her house, Sy, is a 20-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband is also a farmer. They make only $10 USD per day to support their family. Sy resides in a rural area of Rokhak Kiri District, Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 15 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will improve her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 52 years old and married with four children. For the past thirty years she has worked hard selling clothes to make a living. She also earns money from operating her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Carina has taken out and successfully repaid nine prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of clothes to sell. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida supports her family through her general store business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Zenaida with her daughter, Arialyn, who is 18 years old and is the fourth of eight children in the family.

Zenaida is borrowing 5,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Arialyn, who is studying for an Associate degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Arialyn is currently in her second year of this two-year course.

When she graduates, Arialyn plans to be a chef and help her mother send her younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Marining

texts.en:
Marining is 35 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Marining works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, etc. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Marining has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina has been involved in her business activities since a few years ago. She started her business with her own working capital. Joanina has a kiosk in her house, but her kiosk is very small. So now she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD because she wants to buy more items that people like, such as aqua, shampoo, noodles, toothpaste, balm and other items.

Joanina is married and she is a business woman. Her husband is in the agriculture business, so her husband is very supportive of her doing the business. She is very hopeful that with this loan, she can improve the management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy aqua, shampoo, noodles, toothpaste, balm and other items for resale.

loans.name: Afifa

texts.en:
Five years ago Afifa started a small school where she taught a handful of primary students. Today there are 81 students in her school, 46% of whom are girls. Her husband, also shown in the picture, is actively involved in running the school.

Afifa and her husband are eager to take their school forward and expand it into a university in the future. The couple is ambitious about achieving their goal and is willing to go the extra mile for it. They have applied for a 75,000 PKR through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy furniture for the school.

loans.use: to buy furniture for their school.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina is 48 years old and she runs a business selling vegetables. Every day she is busy with her business, visiting various farms to buy vegetables and then returning home to resell them. She is very happy with the business. She started her business in 2006 with her own working capital of $20. She is requesting a loan of $800 because she wants used to buy more vegetables such as onions, spinach, chili, mustard, and other items.

loans.use: to buy onions, spinach, chili, mustard, and other items.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар рада что ее сын успешно закончил первый курс, благодаря Вам. Вы помогли ее сыну учится дальше. Старший сын сейчас учится на втором курсе. Сама Санавбар занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она выбрала животноводческую деятельность, потому что ее отец раньше занимался именно в этой сфере деятельностью. Сановбар решила идти по стопам отца. Она во дворе выращивает домашнее животных. Санавбар больше старается и хочет, чтобы ее дети учились и стали образованными и большими людьми. На транспорт, на обед и на другие расходы Санавбар с мужем обеспечивает детей. Санавбар из-за нехватки денег решила взять кредит на годового оплаты обучения старшего сына. Она должна оплатить на обучения, если не оплатить, то будут исключить сына из университета. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет продвигать обучения. Санавбар будет очень благодарно на Вашу доброту. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Санавбар знает, что Вы людям помогаете и не оставляете их в беде.
texts.en:
Sanavbar is happy that, thanks to your support, her son completed his first year of studies and was able to pursue his education.  Today, he is a second-year student.  Sanavbar herself works in agriculture.  She chose to get involved in animal husbandry because her father used to work in the same field, so she decided to follow in his footsteps.  Sanavbar has a small farm and she raises domestic animals. She works very hard and wants to see her children study so that they become important and educated people.  She and her husband take care of their children's transportation and food costs as well as other expenses.

Sanavbar is taking a loan because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her oldest son's yearly tuition.  She needs to pay these fees as her son might be expelled from the university if she doesn't.  This loan will guarantee her son's education.  Sanavbar is very grateful for your kindness.  She is confident that you will help her again and will not leave her in need.

loans.use: to pay for her son's studies.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional goods to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Bibihaticha

texts.ru: Бибихатича 34 летняя жена и мать 3 детей. Она жительница района Хуросон. Дети маленькие и учатся в средней школе. Ее муж находится на заработках загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и прокормить детей. Бибихатича 7 лет своей жизни занимается животноводством на районе. И занимается до сих пор. Она уже набрала себе достаточного опыта и освоила все навыки своей работы. Она справляется со своей работой, и с домашними делами. Бибихатича много мечтала о расширение своего бизнеса и о покупке нового скота. В данный момент вести хозяйство ей помогают детишки. Они очень любят Бибихатичу, и помогает ей в работе после школы. Бибихатича просит кредит для купли скота и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bibihaticha is a 34-year-old wife and the mother of three children.  She is a resident of the Khuroson district.  Her children are still young and enrolled in secondary school.  Her husband is a migrant worker; he works abroad and feeds his family thanks to the money earned there.   Bibihaticha has spent seven years of her life working in animal husbandry in her own district and she is still involved in this activity.  She has gained a good deal of experience and has mastered all the skills related to her work.  She manages her farming business, as well as the household, very well.

Bibihaticha has been dreaming about buying more livestock and expanding her business for a long time.  At the moment her children help her with the farm work.  They all love their mom and they help her after school.  Bibihaticha is taking this loan to buy more livestock and expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Dili B and is a business woman. She became involved in business activities a few year ago with her own working capital and she does her best with it. She is very interested in doing business. She has a small store and hopes to open a bigger store, but her capital is not enough.  

She is requesting a loan of $1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store, including cooking oils, detergents, candles, shampoo, eggs, salt, biscuits, candies, soft drinks and other things to sell.  She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, detergents, candles, shampoo, eggs, salt, biscuits, candies, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 57-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients and utensils for her food vending business. Alma has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food vending business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 55 years old and has ten children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 11,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies with which to raise her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Estrella would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies with which to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un señor viudo tiene 62 años de edad. Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que atiende junto con su hija, quien se mudo a su casa acompañada de su familia . Su esposa cuando vivía era quien atendía la mayoría del tiempo el negocio.
El señor  presenta desde hace varios años carnosidad en su ojo izquierdo por lo que su visión es deficiente. Le urge una operación para poder recuperar su visión, sin embargo sus recursos son insuficientes, ya que él es el único  sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
He is a 62 years old widower who has a small grocery store that he runs with his daughter, who has moved into his home, accompanied by her family. When she was living, his wife was the one who ran the business most of the time.

For several years the borrower has suffered from an abnormal growth on his left eye, so his vision is deficient.  He is being urged to have an operation so that he can recover his vision. However, his financial resources are insufficient, as he is the sole support of his family.

loans.use: to obtain eye treatment.

loans.name: Dora

texts.pt:
A senhora Dora de 50 anos de idade é comerciante casada mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 2 a estudar e os restantes 4 já são maiores de idade, vive na casa própria.
Com o valor de o emprestimo ira comprar amendoim, feijão, peixe, frangos, refrescos, amendoim, arroz, farinha de milho para reforcar o seu negocio que faz na sua barraca em casa.
Planos planos o futuro crescer no negócio aumentando o volume de mercadoria para satisfazer as necessidades de seus clientes uma vez que na zona não tem nenhum mercado .
Diz que alem do negocio conta com ajuda do esposo que trabalha na Swazi e tem uma machamba onde produz diversos produto e o excedente vende e diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos como forma de atingir seus planos.
texts.en:
Dora is a 50-year-old vendor. She's married and has six children, two of whom are in school and the other four are already adults. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase peanuts, beans, fish, chicken, refreshments, rice and cornflour.
Her plan for the future is to expand her business by stocking up on merchandise. That way she'll meet her customers' needs, since there are no markets in the area.
She states that aside from the business she gets help from her husband. He works for Swazi and owns a farm where he grows various produce and sells the surplus. She states that she'll apply for more loans so that she can accomplish her plans.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, beans, fish, chicken, refreshments, rice and cornflour.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.pt:
Senhora Isaura tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos independentes frequentando o ensino técnico médio, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de refrescos, peixe, batata, para aumentar o stock de produtos na sua mercearia visto que a quadra festiva esta aproximando.
No futuro pretende ampliar a sua renda mensal criando frangos visto que já tem aviários e só falta iniciar com a actividade.
O seu desafio é de criar poupanças no banco para o seu futuro, e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora
texts.en:
Isaura is 43 years old and married. She has two independent children who are in vocational high school. She's a vendor who lives with her family in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase refreshments, fish and potatoes. That way she'll stock up on merchandise for her grocery store, since the holiday season is approaching.
In the future she intends to increase her monthly income by raising chickens. She already has aviaries and she only needs to get the business started.
Her challenge is saving money in the bank for the future, and repaying the loan without becoming delinquent.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, fish and potatoes so she can stock up on merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosanie

texts.en:
Rosanie is 45 years old and married with two children. For the past eighteen years she has raised and sold pigs as well as sold food to make a living.

Rosanie has applied for a 18,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly to make and save enough money to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Grace has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Grace would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Grace can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Grace will benefit from the marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Grace is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Talita

texts.en:
Talita is 49 years old, and she lives with her husband and son in Stepanavan city of Lori region. She has higher musical education and graduated from the department of canon (Armenian national musical instrument).

For already 35 years, she has worked at the Stepanavan Musical College as a teacher of canon. She also works at the college music band and takes part in many concerts playing on canon. She is a very artistic woman, and as she mentions, the music is a part of her life and she is so happy in her chosen profession.

Now she asks for this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams, as she wants to buy a computer, and through this to be aware of any innovations in the world of music.

loans.use: to buy a computer, and through this to be aware of any innovations in the world of music.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Adelaida, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia continua dedicándose a la venta de golosinas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le v a bien gracias  al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chocolates, galletas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member is Adelaida, she belongs to the bank "Señor de los Temblores II" in the city of Cusco, Peru.
The member continues working in the sale of candy. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, with her work, hopes to obtain a bigger income, and in this way continue supporting her family. She has had her business for a while, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wishes to be able to keep working, and in this way continue providing for her family.
She asks for a loan to buy chocolates, cookies, among others.
She is grateful for the given loan, and is committed to meet the established payments.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, cookies, among others.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
A few years ago, Shabana’s husband left her. Eager to fight her circumstances and devote her life to a cause, 29-year-old Shabana now puts all her efforts into running a small school that she started herself. The school provides education to 234 students. She encourages female enrollment, knowing how important it is to enable girls to excel in all walks of life.

When describing the challenges she faces while managing the school, she states that arranging for the seed capital is the most difficult task. To start the school, she had to use her life savings. "I was scared to lose it all', says Shabana, who is now proud to be an agent of change in her community. Shabana recently requested a loan of 100,000 RS to set up a small computer lab in the school and repair some old furniture.

loans.use: to set up a small computer lab in the school and repair some old furniture.
